title: 4 day stay
text:
Very convenient location
Limited options for breakfast and dinner.
Staff at reception very helpful 
Napoleon assisted greatly with bags and taxi, and also provided some complementary bottles of water while we waited.  Gentleman. 
Would stay again, but shame about the limited food options

title: A great option for staying in NYC
text: From check in to check out we had a great experience. We would like to give a special desk to Brandon who helped us with our luggage and kept us hydrated, to Shavonne who gave us excellent directions for getting around the Big Apple and Martha for a smooth front desk experience. Room was clean but (like most all hotels nowadays) could have used more/better lighting.

title: Great service
text: I was treated very well by Michalyn and enjoyed discussing the stay with her. She is a very lovely person with lots of knowledge in regards to travel.  She was patient with me and really showed me a great perspective on his to travel efficiently.

title: Great stay
text: Shavonne at the front desk is great!!! Exactly what a hospitality employee should be! I would definitely make a return visit once I am able. Very clean room and staff is extremely friendly. A lot food places in the area if room service is too much for you.

title: Continental breakfast to avoid
text: We booked 9 nights with breakfast included at $30 per person, to have a choice between an empty or chocolate croissant, a breakfast that absolutely does not correspond to a "continental breakfast"; we complained and the manager had assured us the $30 dollar relief, but at the time of payment we were charged for everything: we had an excellent breakfast out every day, paying less! I highly recommend not booking "breakfast included": a mockery!!!

title: Great spot for business or fun.
text: I travel to NYC 8-12 time a year and stay at different hiltons, this hotel had it all. Price was great, breakfast in the lobby and a wonderful roof top bar. Many of the hiltons offer the same but honestly why I will make this Hilton my first choice was the great service I received from Shavonne, checking in can with a smile and picked me a great room and every time i would be coming or going she always had a hello. When traveling for work it’s the little things that make huge difference. Thank you Shavonne, wife and I will be back and 85 percent of the reason is your great customer service.

title: I got a mouse in my room
text:
The worst experience of my life there was a mouse in my room

Don't stay here it's dirty! I arrived and in the first room they gave me there was excrement in the toilet, they gave me another room and a mouse came out

I had to change rooms again at 11 at night. They didn't want to change my hotel, they don't want to give me my money back, they just want to give me 1 free breakfast.

It is horribly dirty and the service is terrible. Don't stay here and don't trust Hilton hotels because this chain is deplorable.

title: Not up to Hilton standards
text:
DO NOT GET THE “breakfast included” RATE.

1) for an average of $60 extra per room per day your breakfast will consist of exclusively one stale croissant (plain or chocolate) and a small plate of plain fruit (watermelon, cantaloupe, pineapple and literally 4 berries). And that’s every day! No eggs, toast, jam, cereal or anything else one would expect from a “continental breakfast”. Of course other items are available on the menu but at full cost.

2) rooms are small and outdated with very loud AC. If your room is facing the street (front of the hotel) then expect loud noises from traffic and service trucks especially in the wee hours of the morning.

3) The bathrooms are standard but lack any place to hang towels or toiletry bags. There is literally only one single hook on the back of the bathroom door

4) front desk staff doesn’t care. We mentioned the breakfast situation and were referred to “the manager” who after much back and forth with his manager PROMISED a refund of the breakfast rate difference. Plot twist: the refund was never given and after complaining to Hilton we were dismissed.
Don’t believe verbal assurances by staff and get everything in writing!! That is if you can get it… these “managers” seem to always be in “meetings” when asking for updates…

Bottom line, this is a far cry from any other Hilton experiences I’ve had and not even close to standards you would expect from this hotel brand.

title: Great staff
text:
We had a great stay at this hotel for a trip before moving to the city, the location was perfect. Great to see sights one day and live like a local the next. Staff were attentive, well mannered and super helpful. Napoleon soothed my anxiety, when I was checking out with 4 large bags on my own in the middle of the work day. Took care of it all, checked me out and loaded my car, I really did not need to have worried so much that morning, it was a breeze and has set me up for the next part of my trip. 

Thank you so much

title: Boa opção
text: Hotel padrão Hilton, muito bem localizado. Madison Square Garden está a 7 minutos de caminhada. Quarto pequeno, porém muito confortável. Banheiros com box! Vale uma ida ao Rooftop para ver a vista e conhecer o bar. Atendimento muito gentil!

title: Bad Experience at this hotel.
text:
I would HIGHLY recommend not staying here. I have been traveling a lot both internationally and domestic lately. I had a last minute flight change that left me in NYC for an extra day and I needed a room for the night. I booked a room at The Hilton Fashion District and due to all the time changes I’ve been going through  I mistakenly booked the room for the wrong night, it clearly was my fault, and I’m not disputing that. I called the hotel to see if they could make an exception and the told me to call the Hilton Honors number and they told me to try and ask the manager which I did, they said he wasn’t available and took my phone number and he will call me right back, he never returned my call. When I got to the hotel they wouldn’t make an exception said they wouldn’t change the reservation and I had to pay for a second night. I was upset and responded very curtly, I found it frustrating that they wouldn’t make an exception for a simple mistake. 

I usually stay close to a hundred nights at Hilton Hotels and I’m frustrated that they don’t take this into consideration. Especially since I ran into some serious issues last year with Hilton stays. 

 To make things worse when i got to my room I called down stairs to ask for something and the manager just hung up on me and I called again and I asked why he hung up in me and he started just yelling at me. Then I went downstairs and asked to speak to the manager in person and he started yelling at me in the lobby, and I mean really yelling at me. Then he started getting vindictive and told me since I was rude when I checked-in that’s who he and his staff will treat me, and how did I feel being treated that way. First off, I didn’t yell at anyone, I was frustrated with having to pay for the additional night. Especially given that I’ve spent over $30k on rooms in ‘23.  

I have had some pretty bad experiences with Hilton brands last year and I’m trying to get my company to switch to another brand but unfortunately it’s taking awhile.

title: Hotel customer service
text: Upon trying to book a bridal suite at the Hilton I spoke to a very sweet and helpful worker that told me I could come and view the room before booking with no problem. When I called upon wanting to view the room the customer service was completely different. They kept transferring me to different departments and putting me on hold. when I finally got a hold of someone they told me that usually they do not give hotel tours and that I would get last priority because I am not an in house bride. Seems like they do not want outside busniess at their hotel. I also asked if my date was available and they couldn’t give me that information either. Long story short, I will not be booking my stay here.

title: Average Hilton
text:
Expensive even by New York standards but may not be worth the price. I have stayed in lots of Hilton hotels in Manhattan that are superior to this hotel.

The room was fine. I had a good view of the Empire State Building from the window.

The roof bar was a bit hipster for my taste and only open from 4pm

Front desk were great on checkin but a bit curt on check out. 

The surrounding area is safe. The Irish bar opposite is very good

title: シャワーが冷たい
text: まず、洗面にコップがない。コーヒーサーバーの紙コップを使えと言われたが、紙コップはすぐにしなしなになって使えない。そもそも初日は紙コップすらなかった。チェックインは、極めて不親切で他の人とおしゃべりをしながら横向きで対応していた。カスタマーサービスはまったく感じられない。6泊したがその内の3日間は、寒波がきている寒い中で、シャワーがほぼ水であり寒くて調子が悪くなった。今回は、6人のグループで3室予約して宿泊したが、全ての部屋のシャワーがほぼ水で冷たく、とても悪い気分になった。ヒルトンホテルという名前は、すぐにとった方が良いだろう。ヒルトンホテルの信用を失うホテルである。唯一ヒルトンホテルと同じなのは、1泊100ドル、6泊で600ドルのデポジットを取るところである。コップすらないホテルにデポジットが必要なのか、疑問である。この辺りには、同様の価格のホテルがたくさんあるので、暖かいシャワーが出るホテルにした方が良い。日本に帰国して熱が出て寝込んでいる。

title: Avoid better places to stay at
text:
So let's start with the good things, the hotel is centrally located so great if you want to get around New York. Most places are a reasonable walking distance or short Uber rides to where you need to get to. The room was clean and serviced well daily. 

Now the bad things, the staff were quite awful from the moment we arrived the check in process was unfriendly with no information provided and the staff were more interested in talking to each other than serving customers. It wasn't even busy as we were the only ones checking in at that stage. A bit of customer service asking about your trip what you were interested in, telling you about the hotel ..... nothing. Unfortunately that carried on throughout the stay and this hotel needs to train all their staff in customer service. I think the problem is supply and demand, as there is such demand they get filled without even trying and as such their staff just don't should any attitude to care. There were just stupid things like 3 of us staying and only two cups each day in the room, empty shower gel, towels not being left. Every day there was something we had to contact them about and the reaction we got wasn't apologetic either. The rooms are quite dated with peeling paint from the ceiling in our room, the heating sounded like you were beside a 747 at takeoff and only cold area was pumped out. This place needs a refurbishment to really bring it up to any decent standard. 

One thing to be aware of as well is that if you book through a third party provider none of your Hilton Honors are considered, so you don't get anything benefits whatsoever. That came as a complete surprised and was hugely disappointing to a Diamond member. I think that policy stinks and is restrictive trading. Even after complaining Hilton just weren't interested, so am looking to switch loyalty given their behaviour over that. Even if you booked directly I'm not sure there is any benefit at this hotel, there is no executive lounge and you certainly don't feel that loyalty matters here. On hindsight I shouldn't have thought being loyal and booking to stay at Hilton was a good option especially when there were many better deals at other hotels and its a lesson learnt for me and one that will make me stop using Hilton as a result.

So in summary I would recommend other hotels, there is even a good Holiday Inn in the same road which was a better offer including breakfast and better rooms. Unless you are pushed for choice I wouldn't consider this place. I think a testimony to any stay is would you go back and from my experience I certainly won't be staying there again for any visit to New York.

title: Go Elsewhere
text:
The hotel is a low-end motel type place, and not up to par with most Hiltons. When we arrived for check-in, nobody assisted us to bring in our luggage while it was pouring rain. We checked in to our room and I wanted to go out and get some food at 11 pm. When I went downstairs, I asked the guy at the desk if they had an umbrella I could use. His response, "No, but we still umbrellas." Really? That's how you treat guests? Since it was pouring outside, I had no way of walking around to find food. In our room, the grout in the shower was all peeling off, and the whole bathroom is made of cheap linoleum and really really bright fluorescent office lights. 

Throughout our stay, all of the night staff had a terrible attitude, and then when we checked out, again, no one helped with our luggage. A gentleman came to our room to bring bags down, took them to the lobby, and just left them there unattended. I had to take take the bags to the awaiting taxi myself.

I even tried to talk to someone upon checking out, and no one seemed to care about anything. I will not be staying here again.  If you are here with family, don't expect any kind of service from the hotel.

title: Disappointing
text:
We stayed from 27/11/23  - 1/12/23
During our stay we had cold showers on three days, plus no heating in our room.
I contacted the front desk the reception person informed me the boiler was broken and the engineer was there apparently fixing it. She said she would ring when it had been fixed. What a joke we are home now and she never called.
After two more phone calls on different days due to the same problem we were told it was a technical issue with the boiler and to bare with them This is fine but three days now we had to wash in stone cold water and the room was freezing.
The guy on reception offered us two days of complimentary breakfast which we accepted however it was bog standard we were not allowed anything off the regular guest menu.
On the third day of complaining our alarm went off at 6am this had got to have been set by staff as we never used the room alarm clock. Quite a coincidence it goes off early when we haxe been complaining.
Complimentary water is kept behind reception and you have to ask for it, but yet again it was out of stock for two days 😔
All in all we wouldn't stay there again nor would we recommend it to anyone.

title: Three night stay
text:
I stayed there for 3 nights. The first night heating in the room stopped working and it was one of the coldest November nights. It was freezing inside the room.
The hotel did not inform proactively or apologize when I asked at 2am. There only response every time was that engineers are working on it. It was a terrible experience. 
The positives were that I got an early checkin, and lobby staff was very polite.

title: Average
text: Typical tinny room in NYC. Service was subpar. Some were friendly but most did not really care to even look at you as they continued their own private conversation while phones were ringing and people were standing in line. The roof top bar is not as nice as it looks online so beware! I paid to have a higher floor for the view, but honestly, seemed like a waste of money to me.

title: Needs improvement
text:
I arrived to the hotel after a transatlantic flight and walked in to the lobby and was extremely confused. It looked like a slightly low rent sports bar as they had clad the entire lobby in Monster energy drink banners for the UFC match. Not a great start, but checkin was friendly enough. 

The rooms themselves are decent for NYC. The lighting has a slight ‘alien autopsy’ feel as apparently they’ve decided on cold white lamps, which is anything but welcoming. I also can’t help but question why a comforter about 3mm thick is appropriate for winter in New York, it was not exactly comfy. I had to ask for a blanket 3 times before a very cheap one finally appeared. Annoyingly as well, the fan on the heater can’t be set to be ‘on’ all the time and so all night comes on and off which disturbed my sleep. There is a coffee machine in the room but I was not provided with a single cup or glass with which to drink a coffee or water in my room. Apparently a plastic bottle should suffice. 

The walls are very thin and I was able to hear my neighbours conversations and umm…activities very clearly. A nightclub nearby was also very loud on Saturday night. 

The elevator/lift situation also must be called out. It was not unusual to wait 10 minutes+ to get a lift that was absolutely rammed and then have to wait another 10 minutes for another. 

Based on all of the above I would guess this hotel isn’t owned directly by Hilton. I was a bit surprised that they put me on level 6 of the hotel despite being a Hilton gold member. 

The location was good in midtown with lots of transport and food options nearby and perfectly placed for tourism. 

The hotel bar looked a bit naff from the outside but it’s alright once you sit down and the bar staff were attentive and fun.

title: Great location, ok hotel
text: Pretty standard mid-range NY hotel. Room was fine but lousy lighting in the entryway, which is where the mirror is. If you want to see if your tie is straight, you'll need to go in the bathroom. There was a Keurig machine, but only a couple of pods and no cups. The shower was unsuccessful at containing the water due to a design flaw. It looks like there are 4 small elevators in the lobby, but only two of them were moving passengers upstairs when we were there, for 23 or so floors, so allow lots of extra time to go up or down. The "rooftop" bar has a nice view, but I wouldn't go back for a drink again. The front desk staff were all nice and professional, and they let us store our bags until our room was ready.

title: Untruthful staff
text: I wouldn’t book here. I have spoken to multiple people regarding any sort of refund on my booking and was told that even though I was being tested for COVID and was even sent home by my job as a healthcare worker for suspicion of covid and pending pcr results that there was nothing they could do since I booked through Expedia. Meanwhile, Expedia has told me multiple times that management here refused my request. I keep getting the run around from staff here and don’t think I can trust them for future bookings.

title: Nice location but narrow rooms and space
text:
I was spending the weekend in New York and previously I have stayed in the Chelsea/Fashion District and really enjoyed the district.  It was within walking distance to subway stations, within walking distance to Penn Station, and easily accessible and within walking distance to many restaurants and shops.  This hotel is located in the Chelsea/Fashion District on 26th Street between 6th and 7th Ave (a block behind the Innside by Melia hotel).

The hotel itself is narrow, like many New York hotels, and that was evident in the lobby which had a wide circular car entrance but the lobby itself was narrow and long.  As you entered, in front were the elevators and to the left was the small check-in desk and to the right was entrance to the hotel restaurant.  Check-in was relatively quick and as a HHonor member, I received two complimentary bottles of water.  I then proceeded to the elevator - there were 3 elevators but one was dedicated to go to the rooftop bar so was not accesible; another one was out of service and so were reduced down to 1 working elevator.  

My room was on the 14th floor and the narrowness of the hotel also showcased on the hallways which were tight as well as the room size.  I have previously stayed at Motto by Hilton which is Hilton's answer to tiny/capsule hotels and the room size at that hotel in DC and this regular Hilton in New York were somewhat similar.  As you opened the door, you entered into a little hallway which had the closet, wardrobe, and coffee stand/shelves along one wall.  The closet was narrow but still contained places to hang your clothes, an iron, as well as an ironing board.  The coffee stand was on an open shelf next to the closet which contained the coffee maker and items on top, a minifridge down below, and another shelf/storage on top.  Next to that was a mini chair space to put your luggage.  Along that wall was a large desk with lots of desk space and places to plug in your electronics.  There was a standard office chair which was very comfortable.  Above the desk on the wall was the large TV and below the desk were drawers for additional storage.

Across the desk, along the other wall, was the bed along with two bedside tables.  The bed size was a large full-size or a small queen.  There were lots of pillows available and the bed was generally comfortable to sleep on - it was a bit tight so not sure if two people could fit comfortably on the bed together.  Next to each side of the bed were nightstands with nightlights and places to plug in your electronics on each side.  The bathroom was across from the bed and next to the desk.  It was narrow but did have a walk-in shower, a toilet and a sink.  There were refillable bottles of lotion next to the sink, and shampoo and conditioner in the shower and bars of soap were provided next to the sink as well as in the shower.  Like the room, the bathroom contained the basic necessities but was narrow.

I was only in New York for one day and most of my time was spent outside so I did not experience other facilities of the hotel including the rooftop bar, the restaurant, the fitness center, or the business center.  I did experience the wifi which was strong and was not limited to a certain number of devices.  I was able to stream videos on youtube with no connectivity issues.  Checkout was at 11am and I had requested a late check-out at 12pm but I was told 'to call in the morning and check'.  I called at 10:30am and they said 'no, the latest we can do is 11:30am but you can hold your luggage at the front'.   This was the first hotel that did not offer at least checkout until 12pm and the service was not the greatest in their response.  I checked out and was going to leave my stuff at the hotel and that is when I was told there is a $2 charge to leave your items at the hotel - I wish this information had been told beforehand so customers could be aware.  I am glad though, that unlike other hotels in the area the hotel does not charge a 'facility fee' per night for the wifi and the bottles of water, but $2 to hold luggage when you are demanding customers get out of the room at a certain time is a bit greedy.

title: Good, but could be better
text:
Stayed for one night, on a stopover in the city as the location was good for subways and Penn.  Firstly staff at check-in were really nice and helpful - top marks.

I would say, however, that the room was smaller than I would usually expect from a Hilton and really wouldn’t want to stay for more than a couple of nights.  It was comfortable and quiet enough though.

Breakfast choice was fairly limited.  Roof bar was fun.

While I don’t expect any cheap deals in NYC, I suspect you may get a better price elsewhere.

title: Another great stay!
text: We had another nice stay at this hotel.  The staff is really wonderful - especially the front desk team!  Good location.  Nice rooftop bar and breakfast in the restaurant.  Will definitely stay again - and would recommend to others.

title: Easy Schmeasy !
text: Shavonne did an awesome job at check in !  Rooms are super nice and consistent. Location is very close to FIT.  lots to walk to along 7th ave. I still need to check out the roof top bar.  Highly recommend if you're staying inthis area.

title: Thank you Shavonne
text: Just checked into the Hilton after a long overseas flight and an hour-long cab ride. I was exhausted, to say the least. Shavonne checked me in seamlessly, providing all the information I needed. What stood out was her respect for my tired state; she made the entire process quick and painless. I truly felt welcomed, and for that, I'm grateful. Thank you, Shavonne, for making the start of my stay so pleasant.

title: Breakfast. Do not prepay.
text: Don’t get the breakfast. It’s a two star motel “continental breakfast” deal but charged premium price. The same menu has wonderful options for less money. I asked for a cancellation of the breakfast I had pre-paid  for, so I could eat better, but “no refunds”. Felt ripped off. Super frustrating! Room, bathroom, service, etc were good.

title: In the middle of everything
text: The hotel is well located as it's walking distance from Penn Station, and about halfway between Times Square and Soho. There are places to eat nearby, including some "hidden" gems. The rooftop patio gives a great view of the city at night - kids are not allowed up after 5 pm, so keep that in mind. The room is comfortable and roomy enough.

title: AMAZING STAFF
text: Shavonne was very helpful and super friendly! She went above and beyond to make sure our check in experience and stay was amazing! We stopped in NYC to wrap up our celebration and we are glad we did!! WE APPRECIATE YOU!

title: Albergo con posizione super strategica, ottima organizzazione e pulizia
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questa struttura per 7 notti, avendo modo di apprezzare in modo particolare la posizione (già di per se vicina al centro -Flatiron Building, Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, ecc.- ma vicinissima ad almeno 4 fermate della Metropolitana, con a circa 100 mt un Whole Food Market, molto fornito in cibo anche senza glutine e numerosi locali in cui mangiare ad ogni pasto), la disponibilità del servizio di accoglienza ma soprattutto la camera, molto ben pulita e con un bagno veramente eccellente, con Box doccia ampio e molto gradito. Presenza in camera inoltre di una macchina per il caffè americano/thé e di un frigobar piccolo ma molto, molto utile ad uso libero. Tv via cavo disponibile, doppio letto matrimoniale (eravamo in 4, due adulti e due ragazzi). Aria condizionata funzionante in modo più che soddisfacente e facilmente regolabile. L’albergo dispone anche di un rooftop bar e di un locale per cabaret dei quali però non abbiamo usufruito. Decisamente consigliato.

title: Not worth it
text:
We stayed for 13 nights, we included our breakfast also. On the first day we were handed over our coupons for breakfast.
Breakfast was very bad, we being vegetarian , options we  had was just few pieces of fruits & a bread toasted 
We asked for other options, but they didn’t gave us,we returned our coupons to the hotel, they agreed to refund, but on the departure date they refused 
WILL NEVER STAY IN HILTON HOTEL
WE BOOKED HILTON FOR ITS NAME AND FAME, BUT TOTAL DISAPPOINTMENT

title: Great birthday weekend
text: Forget the great location and comfy beds it’s the excellent staff that makes this an outstanding Hilton. Finally, a Hilton that spoils you and makes you feel welcome and special. Marion at the front desk was fabulous!! She and her staff made my day. Housekeeping on the 4th floor was friendly and accommodating. The bartender at the first floor bar was amazing and fun. the waitstaff at the rooftop bar made me feel welcome and were awesome. This is an old school Hilton that is a destination rather simply a place to sleep.

title: Hilton Fashion District New York Chelsea
text: Ho soggiornato con la mia ed un'altra famiglia Otto notti presso questo albergo di New York situato in una location molto comoda e in un quartiere tranquillo. La stanza una con doppio letto matrimoniale è molto scomoda piccola e con un solo armadio piccolissimo che a malapena avrebbe potuto essere utilizzato da due persone non da tre come eravamo noi. Pulizia carente e bagno sempre sprovvisto di set asciugamani quasi ogni giorno dovevo chiamare per farmeli portare. Roof bar con Bellavista anche se accolto in maniera molto arrogante dal dipendente appena uscito dall'ascensore

title: Buon hotel a Manhattan!
text: Sono stato con moglie e i miei due figli in questo hotel fra la 26th e la 7th. A poca strada dall’ Empire State Building e molto vicino alla Penn station. Hotel moderno , comodo , con un rooftop bar con gran vista. Ci siamo trovati molto bene. Non avevamo una tariffa con colazione ma vicinissimo c’è un ottimo Paris baguette con prezzi adeguati e colazione europea ( croissant di tutti i tipi e buon cappuccino ). Stanza con bagno moderno , doccia grande e due bei letti queen size.

title: Good location
text: The hotel was conveniently located two blocks from a subway. If you like to walk, you could easily get to Times Square, etc. There was a great deli with reasonably priced bsgels as and sandwiches a block away - Chelsea Gourmet Deli (reasonable prices, and friendly staff), as well as a Whole Foids Market. Right across the street was a Subway and a Chipotle restaurant. We were in room 724 - we faced a building, but got no street noise. There was some noise from the hall. Oddly, there was no closet. The bathroom was a good size. There was no safe, but there was a bar fridge, and a Keurig. The staff was friendly.  The ice machine was in the basement, outside the fitness centre.

title: Horribly rude staff
text: Hilton Honors member and this was the absolute worst hotel experience I have ever had due to the terrible attitude of the front desk staff. Hotel staff somehow discarded or lost a bag of my stuff in my room, and the front desk was hostile, argumentative and condescending about it, as well as uncommunicative and told me nothing about it even when asked over the course of several days. Even saw a front desk staff member roll her eyes at me while I was literally standing in front of her. A hotel should be a place of hospitality but the way I was treated by the hotel alone ruined a large part of my New York trip. My friends and I felt so unwelcome we didn’t even want to come back to the hotel after spending the day out.

title: Chambre double famille
text:
Hotel avec un personnel efficace et tres gentil. Son emplacement est ideal pret du metro.
 La chambre double  etait assez petites et vieillotte mais propre. Le menage est fait tous les jours. L'insonorisation est à améliorer. 
Le rooftop n'est pas accessible aux non adultes donc pas tres utile pour les familles.
Donc pour conclure cet hotel convient pour un cours sejour mais correspond plus a un 3* qu'à une 4*.

title: Staff makes it Stellar !
text: I had an excellent stay at the Hilton West Fashion District. The best part of it was the courteous, professional, and engaging staff members who made my 1st in Chelsea a fantastic experience. I must commend everyone that I interacted with for making my stay an easy & fun vacation getaway: Martha, Caroline, Zoribel, Raul, Marian, and Napoleon Mendez. Each individual named should be applauded for making this first-timer's Chelsea visit a great delight.

title: Horrible staff
text: I encountered a disappointing situation when I inquired about breakfast. The staff member I spoke to appeared to be having a difficult day and her response came across as unfriendly and dismissive. I believe that clear communication and respectful customer interactions are essential in any hospitality setting. While the majority of the staff were wonderful, this particular encounter left a negative impression. I hope the Hilton takes this feedback as an opportunity for improvement in providing consistent and friendly customer service.

title: Clean and comfortable Hilton in an ideal NYC neighborhood.
text: Very pleased with our stay at this hotel. Location is ideal -- easy to walk to many places and also within 2 blocks of subway. Fun restaurants nearby on the pedestrian blocks of Broadway (La  Pecora Bianca, for one). Front desk helpful with any questions. We had a double room. Beds were comfortable with soft sheets. Bathroom decent sized (not cramped) with great water pressure in the shower. When we left each day to explore, I requested housekeeping. Our room was always clean upon return. I have read several reviews that the a/c was not adequate. Ours worked perfectly. Yes a little loud, as is the case with most hotel room a/c. Earplugs completely blocked the noise. The street is not too busy - did not hear street noise in our room. We were on 20th floor. Walked 1/2 block to 6th or 7th street to hail cabs. Did not eat at the hotel except for delicious coffee in entry level restaurant, and cocktails there as well. Went up to rooftop bar at 5pm one night & it was lovely. Was asked if I had a reservation, which I did not. They were still able to seat the 2 of us with a 1 hour time limit, which was fine. So if you want to be guaranteed a table, best to make a reservation. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Awful Hotel
text:
There are many choices to stay in New York.  This hotel should not be one of them. Stay away. Never have written a review before - until now.  

Hotel not up to Hilton standards.  

Utter disappointment for the following reasons:

Room was not ready on time. 
Bags were left with the bellman. When I returned hours later - they were left unattended unwatched. 
No new bath towels were left in room by house keeping. When I returned after a long day and asked why - I was told delivery truck had not yet arrived. This was at 9:00 pm. So I just picked up a dirty towel from the floor and used that for the evening. Not joking. 
Was not permitted a late checkout even though am Gold Member. 
Breakfast orders were consistently wrong. 

Really should done my homework.

title: Great location and staff
text: Location and staff were fantastic. Only issue is with parking - we were told reservations weren’t needed for parking but when we arrived the lot was full. We were told to wait an hour or so or come back “after”. Eventually it was sorted and we were able to park however we had been in a panic not knowing where to leave car for 4 days.

title: Location!
text:
My husband and I spent four evenings here on a long weekend in NYC.  The location is excellent, convenient to both lower Manhattan, the Theater District and subway/trains everywhere else.  We found the neighborhood -- Chelsea, I guess -- really pleasant.  Easy walk to many restaurants.

The hotel itself is quiet and accommodating.  Our room was small -- just enough space for two.  It was clean and in good condition.  They seemed to be chronically short of towels -- we only had two each of bath towels, hand towels and wash cloths -- and I had the impression from housekeeping that laundry wasn't keeping up with demand.

We had a dining credit for being Hilton Honors Diamond members and enjoyed breakfast very much in the lobby restaurant.  Staff were pleasant and food was good.

I have stayed in the Hilton Times Square and prefer that for the accommodations, though navigating through the throngs at Times Square is a chore.  I prefer the location of Hilton Fashion District.  So take your pick, but both are good options with their pros/cons.

title: Choose a Better Hilton in NYC
text: This hotel is not up to the  high standards I have expected from Hilton.  The rooms are adequate but nothing special, the entire hotel could use an update.  The front desk personnel are friendly but lack any tourist helpfulness.  There are only a few restaurants on the block. There is not a taxi stand and the front desk people advise you to  walk to the corner to hail a cab - this is difficult with luggage.  The one very good aspect though is there is a cabaret in the basement that is fantastic!

title: Great location
text: Stayed 5 nights with kids 11 and 14 years. The location is great. Staff was friendly. The beds were comfortable, the only complain about the room is that the AC was very loud. We didn' t try the restaurant

title: Nice hotel in a good location
text: Nice hotel and great location with great friendly staff. However my room was not cleaned 3 days in a row and that put alittle dampener on the stay .But  I will say again the staff where really lovely and the location was perfect and it is totally worth to stay here .

title: Great location and great hotel!
text:
This was the second time I have stayed at this hotel while in NYC.  It’s a great location-very close to three different subway stations so you can get anywhere easily!  Less than 2 blocks to the 1, about 3 blocks to the C,E,F and M lines. This would be a good base for anyone wanting to explore the entire city!  Also only 5 blocks to Penn Station for connections.  

Rooms are clean and comfortable, with the amenities you would expect with Hilton.  Front desk staff are pleasant, courteous, and efficient (though one of the porters, when storing my bags,  was very direct in ‘thanking me’ for a tip before I’d even given one.) 

They do have a rooftop bar which draws a crowd in the evenings and a lounge with entertainment. 

Only issue I had was they could never get the digital key to work with the Hilton app- not a major thing though.  I will definitely plan to stay here again when I return next month.

title: Excellent location and friendly staff
text: Excellent location and very friendly staff. Our family very much enjoyed the hotel, location, and hotel staff. Hotel was very clean and well kept. Rooftop bar was nice with an amazing view of the Empire State Building. Location was convenient to the metro and walkable to closer activities. Felt very safe and quiet. Also close to a couple of trendy thrift stores if you are traveling with teenagers who like that. Excellent stay, would recommend it highly!

title: Excellent staff, room, and location... Will be back
text: We really enjoyed our stay. The hotel was great, as was the location. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Zoribel especially went out of her way to help me with a special request. Thank you to Zoribel and the whole team at Hilton NY Fashion District!

title: Great Hilton
text: This Hilton is amazing. I’ve stayed at over 12 Hilton properties in New York. This is by far was the best one. The rooms are clean, the staff is helpful, and the location is perfect. Stay here.. you won’t regret it

title: Worst Hilton I’ve ever stayed
text: I am Hilton Honors Goldmember and traveled around the world. This is by far the worst Hilton I’ve ever stayed. The staff was very rude. The rooms were dated with noisy radiators. The bed was uncomfortable and the room was very small and they wouldn’t give you any additional pillows it was overall nightmare experience. Ended up, not sleeping all night and checking out to go to a different Hilton at Times Square.

title: A most positive feel and stay.
text: We are staying at this hotel for our daughter to attend a summer workshop at FIT. Upon check-in we experienced a little issue with my credit card. The lady checking us in, her name is Maryanne was very gracious, she offered me a bottle of water and a seat. After the credit card was sorted, Maryanne completed the check-in with grace and professionalism. Our stay is from June 25th to July1st. We will check out after I complete this review. The Hilton in Fashion District is my hotel of choice due to professionals as MaryAnne and associated always quick with a smile: Zoribel, Caroline and Napoli. The housekeeping did a great job. The only "thing" was a Hilton male manager in a suit pacing the floor in a suit never really greeting guests, totally ignoring me not even a "hello or welcome".  MaryAnne, Caroline, Zoribel and Napoley were all attentive and made us feel welcome. Good job Hilton for having such workers.

title: Great location views and comfortable
text:
Great location nice and central rooms clean and very comfortable paid extra for room with a view and didn’t disappoint we had views of the skyline including edge and Empire State. 
Staff very accommodating shame about roof top bar being seperate not very accommodating for minors but that’s not hotels fault

title: Best Service at Front Desk
text: Shavonne at the front desk has repeatedly gone above and beyond to make me feel welcomed, valued, and appreciated as a guest. Every time I check in she knows me by name, and takes the time to ensure I have the best service.

title: Shavonne was Fabulous!
text: Exceptional room and desk service. Shavonne was super accommodating and nice. She made me feel welcome and  explained all the amenities available to me. I love staying at Hilton for the great service and Hilton NYC Fashion District was no different!

title: Thank you Brandon!
text:
Enjoyed my stay here, but a huge specific thank you to BRANDON, who helped me store my bags, and organize a taxi to get to the airport when I needed to leave. He was so helpful and made my last day in NYC so easy. 

Hotel is in a great location, rooms were comfortable. Rooftop bar is also very cute.

title: Lovely staff
text: Thank you to BRANDON!! The best doorman ever - he was so kind and helpful when it came to booking taxis and storing our luggage. He's the best! The hotel itself is clean and very well located - walkable to almost everywhere I needed to go.

title: Front desk
text: I have stayed here the last 3 times I’ve come to town for work. My fiancée is with me this time and Shavonne was so kind to both of us when we came through the doors. She also helped me with my bags last time I was here and made a great impression! Wonderful staff across the board, thank you Shavonne! :-)

title: Have you ever paid $350+/nt for a crappy, dirty, dated and tiny room just to get screamed at by the front desk? We have!
text:
The staff at this hotel could not be ruder. From check-in to check-out, the stay was one of the worst I have ever had and this is coming from someone who travels almost 70% of the year. Caroline, Martha, and Zoribel were front desk personnel we encountered during our stay. We were lied to about the validated parking, our room, and about the daily credit vouchers for being a Diamond member. The parking situation sucks - they say they validate at the lot up the street but if you have an SUV, that lot won't take you so we ended up paying $70/night for another lot a few more blocks away. We asked for water because there weren't any in our room and the food truck outside wasn't open yet we were told that they aren't in the business of giving away free water. Mind you, I am a diamond member and had no water in my room. I would've gladly paid if they had a small shop for me to purchase from. They have 2 spots allotted in their driveway for loading and unloading for their guests. Both at check-in and check out those spots were taken by town cars just sitting there making it very difficult to load/unload. We got yelled at (no exaggeration) in front of a lobby full of guests/workers when we left our car to go grab our luggage and the woman even called my husband an a$$hole in front of everyone. I tried to speak w/ a manager but no one was on duty (supposedly) and I called and left a detailed voicemail but didn't hear back for days. Worst NYC hotel experience and by the way the rooms are dated and dirty. Stay away!
Names of front desk "help": Caroline, Martha, Zoribel
Name of Manager: Enajee

title: Nice Hotel; Excellent Customer Service!
text: This is a nice cozy location in the fashion industry.  Based on my previous stays at other Hilton properties recently, I was a little concerned that my on-line presentation for Juneteenth would not been successful, but thankfully for Shavonne and her outstanding customer service, she went above and beyond to ensure I was a satisfied customer and that my concerns were eliminated!  Thank you Shavonne for putting my mind at ease and showing that you truly care!

title: Cool
text: Shavonne was very helpful and pleasant my entire stay! When a problem arose she was quick to solve it and deliver immediate results. My room was clean and the hotel was pleasant. Will be back shortly!

title: Great Stay in Great Neighborhood
text:
Loved the hotel for it's prie, location and access to cool bars, restaurants, metro to go anywhere.

The staff was very friendly and helpful. I interacted with Shavonne, she was great with helping me. She went beyond to help with my Internet connection, truly appreciate it. Will definitely try to be back here again in my next trip.

The hotel also arranged a cab to airport if needed.

title: Horrendo
text: HORRENDO HOTEL sucio, huele SIEMPRE A Marihuana; no se queden las habitaciones son muy chicas las almohadas son una piedra; sucias y lúgubre el lugar…. Busquen otro lugar es espantoso; desde la recepción huele mal el pasillo. No te dan ni un vaso con agua en la habitación

title: Awesome person at the Front desk
text: Shavonne was the friendliest and most helpful person that checked me in that I have ever experienced.  That's saying a lot as I am a lifetime diamond member. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Great Welcome From Shavonne and Team
text: Fantastic welcome to NYC and Hilton by Shavonne - Creating a wonderful start to a busy time in NY. Full of ideas on where to go and what to do, and taking ownership of the Guest Experience - with a warm smile too! Thanks Shavonne and all the Hilton NY fashion District team 👍

title: Great Hotel in the Heart of the Fashion District
text:
The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. They worked hard to give us a great stay in NYC. They strive to make your stay personal and comfortable. The hotel is conveniently located near major subway lines and travel to and from the airport was fairly simple for NYC.

Brandon, the doorman, goes the extra mile to make your stay even more pleasant. He took care of our bags on checkout day and arranged a car to the airport. We can’t wait to see him and the other staff again on our next visit.

title: My Sleep Experience Was Destoryed by Dumpster Truck.
text:
I liked the room and the staff was highly professional.  But the most important criterion for a hotel is the ability to get a good night's sleep.  That did not happen.

Across 26th St. Is a group of 5-6 dumpsters. A sanitation truck was emptying those dumpsters between and 3 and 3:30 am. The rumbling and banging noises were loud and nonstop. 

The hotel either needs much more soundproof windows or it needs to disclose this issue to a guest.  I would have stayed elsewhere if I had known that this could happen. Since I was going to check out around 5am, changing rooms was not a viable option.

title: Very pleasant stay in the middle of Manhattan
text:
I can only recommend this hotel. It is at a great location, and I had a comfortable, quiet and well equipped room. The personnel was very kind and helpful. The laundry service is pricy, but just on the other side of the street there is a cleaner that takes daily orders for a good price.
The rooftop looked good, but I have not tried it out.

title: Central, Comfortable, Perfect!
text: The location was perfect for all our needs, right in walking distance for 99% of the activities we had booked. The staff were fantastic and knowledgeable about the area. The room was comfy although we only had a view of the fire escape next door. The beds were so comfortable, perfect for relaxing in the afternoon, or falling asleep after a late broadway show. The only thing I wasn't a big fan of was layout of the the walk in shower. But I will definitely book here again!

title: Great experience. Thanks Brandon
text: Excellent place to stay when visiting NYC. It is perfectly located and it is in a very safe place of the city. Shout out to Brandon (the doorman) who was helpful multiple times. He is a great resource that will give you advise on what to do and more importantly how to navigate the city. Thank you Brandon!

title: Hilton Fashion District - not your average hotel in any way
text: I had a major delay due to a small natural disaster at my destination the hotel was incredibly accommodating.  I have to mention Caroline who really stood by me, held my reservation as I found another flight and made me feel at home. It is people like her who make you want to be loyal to a hotel chain.  Gwendolin her boss was also accommodating and helpful.  Kudos to this well run hotel and its employees!

title: Good location decent hotel no frills.
text:
Perfect location for site seeing, we are a family of 4( kids age 11&16) room was big enough for 4 nights. 
We walked everywhere, it’s 15 mins walk from Times Square,30 mins walk to Central Park.Didn’t get a chance to do the rooftop bar🫤
Decent coffee machine that we used for hot water as well, hot shower,big mirror in bathroom.
Taxi from airport was $80.
Must do Williamsburg,the summit,hi-line,Yankee game as well as all the normal list.

title: Great weekend stay in the heart of NYC
text: Great experience at this Hilton because of the staff! The rooms and amenities are pretty average for an NYC hotel, but everyone working was so pleasant and helpful. Especially the doorman Brandon, he was so generous and friendly, always welcomed us into the building with a smile and was so helpful with our bags checking out. I would stay here again!

title: March Weekend Trip
text:
I stayed here during a weekend trip to the city with family, and would choose to stay here again!

Overall, it was a great place to stay. I felt that the rooms were spacious for it being NYC, clean, and comfy. I paid extra for a view and was not disappointed!

I liked that we never had to wait long for an elevator - one was always waiting in the lobby upon our return. 

The location was a change for us. The area didn’t seem to be overly touristy, which was nice. And the staff was helpful when it came to figuring out what subway to take and stop to get off at. 

Also, the view from the rooftop bar was nice. The only thing missing was complimentary breakfast but it wasn’t a deal breaker. 

Once again, it was a great place to stay and would stay here again!

title: Favorite hotel in NYC
text: I visit New York many times during the year and this has been my favorite hotel since the first time I stayed here. The staff is really friendly and always make you feel welcome even when hotel is booked solid. Love the rooftop bar. Great cocktails, great music and a lovely view. The rooms are nice size for a long weekend. You cannot be to location in Midtown Manhattan. There’s a Whole Foods across the street and you’re very close to Madison Square Garden for concerts and sporting events. You can also find some great restaurants around Madison Park.

title: Clean, comfortable crash pad
text: This is not the Hilton for lolling in your room and enjoying the view and the amenities -- both of which are in short supply here. But our small room was clean and very comfortable, great for a short stay where you might be plan to be out all day, get a good rest and then head back out after a shower and coffee in the morning. Good location for walking downtown/Chelsea or up to midtown. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful.

title: No complaints, pleasant, reasonably priced hotel in a good location.
text: Absolutely no complaints.  Comfortable room and bed.   Water pressure for the shower very average but not unexpected.  Roof top bar was a nice touch and we were welcomed with friendly host.  Didn't get the chance to eat at the hotel as my company had made other arrangements.  Overall would be very happy staying here again, particularly given the very reasonable room rate.  Didn't get a chance to see any of the sights as was there for work but imagine the hotel is well located for the various tourist attractions.

title: Above and beyond
text:
Came to NYC for a long family weekend from CT. From the moment we arrived we were greeted by Brandon the doorman. His charisma/ hospitality and desire to make our stay unforgettable was felt right from that moment. He went above and beyond to make our stay with our 2 year old as smooth as possible. He was always very attentive and there right when we needed help at ANY time! I can honestly say I will be returning to Hilton NY Fashion District mainly for the service Brandon provided. We would LOVE to see more Brandon’s at every hotel we stay. 

Brandon, 

If you ever read this I hope you know how much we appreciated your help!! 

—Garcia Family

title: Unlike the Hilton Experience
text: Had a really poor experience staying at this property. To begin with the lights in the room were really poor. If one would try to work/use laptop, it's going to hurt your eyes. There was a $25 charged for early check in, which was one of the first experiences I have had. Overall, it was hard to believe that this property was part of the hilton chain. If you are looking to just drop your luggage & explore the city, then this place makes sense.

title: Never Again
text: The hotel was clean and convenient but small. It was extremely noisy. Garbage trucks woke me up every night. The only plus I can think of is the fact that the room wasn't dirty. But between the small space and the 24/7 noise I won't ever stay here again.

title: Huge thank you to Brandon (doorman)
text:
Very nice stay. Nice room and good view! Brandon(the doorman) was really good and helpful through out.

Even other hotel staff was very helpful and good room service. 

Location is perfect. Broadway us just here and walking

title: Fantastic service!
text: I came here for work and let me just say, Shavonne at the front desk is on point.  She’s personable and saved my life at least twice in a span of three hours.  Let me explain.  I’m a gold member, so she put me in a room on the highest floor.  That sounds great, but the room felt like a sauna and I definitely would have died from heat exhaustion in my sleep.  She graciously changed my room.  For some reason, I just kept living things around the hotel including my wallet AND work badge, but you know who was looking out for me?  That’s right, Shavonne!  She personally returned the items to me and wasn’t irritated by the fact that I had apparently turned into “the needy guest.”  I’ll definitely be back.  Thanks again, Shavonne!

title: Bridal dress shopping
text: Location was perfect. Staff very knowledgeable to point us in the right direction. Appreciated the bottles of water at check in. Room clean. Shower leaked some water under the door but not a deal breaker. Extra towels were available to put on floor. Loved the security, could not get on elevator unless you swiped the room key first. Room clean.

title: Great, friendly service
text: This was a quick business trip and it was made more comfortable and friendly by everyone at the hotel. I was tired when I checked in and left my backpack in the lobby and the staff made sure it got to me. Great service all around.

title: Extremely Disappointing
text: Having stayed at multiple Hilton properties globally, unfortunately this hotel was severely below par. From the arrival late night where the aircon was broken and blowing freezing air in sub zero temperatures outside, to needing to move rooms, to the stir of arrogance of the front desk manager (Gwen) who used terminology such as 'my love' when addressing the poor standards and at the same time advising that out of 280 rooms I was the only one with issues which they were happy with. Even after trying to speak to her in person to highlight that issues do happen but that it is the response of the team that matters, she continued to say that the issues were caused by me and she would 'allow me to leave' if I chose to do so. So quite a challenging and disappointing stay, nothing of which is not fixable but with the biggest issue being some of the teams attitude. I would not recommend this hotel in its current state unfortunately.

title: Hilton took great care of us
text: Our client and myself thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hilton New York Fashion District during our NYC trip. Loved the amenities and design layout. The staff was very friendly and professional with any questions we had. The rooftop bar was very sexy!!

title: Great hotel, great location
text: This hotel is in a great location - really close to Empire State Building and minutes away from a subway station which will take you all the way down Manhattan to beside where the Statten Island ferry leaves from. Check in was super fast and I was in my room on the 21st floor in no time. Room smallish but what you expect in New York. Nice view of the Empire State Building from the window. There’s a rooftop bar at the hotel but they don’t tell you it’s not part of the hotel. Slightly embarrassing when you want to charge to your room and didn’t take your wallet with you. I think reception should tell you that on check in. $18 food and beverage credit a day for diamond members was automatically removed each day from the bill. Bar staff in the hotel bar (at reception level) were excellent and they mix a mean cocktail. Reception more than happy to store bags during the day after check out. Would recommend the hotel and definitely on my list of hotels in New York to give business to again.

title: Small, dark commuter hotel is not the "4 Star" Hilton you were expecting!
text:
We stayed over the holidays for over $500/night with double beds. It was a small, dark hotel with small dark rooms - they squished two twin beds into a maybe 10x10 foot space. We couldn't have the suitcases open and walk to the bathroom at the same time. The "city view" was of a brick building 4 feet from the window. The tiny "cafe" was only open in the morning, the rooftop bar was closed, and the place refill our water bottles was busted. It was so bad, we changed hotels after the first night. We felt like we got hotel catfished by the online pictures and 4-star rating. . 

The bright side is the staff was absolutely lovely and helpful.

title: Great midtown base
text: We stayed over New Year as our booked hotel was closed at short notice. The Hilton is well placed in midtown and accessible for everywhere in Manhattan. Rooms are great as a base for sightseeing but pretty basic. Beds are comfy and big bathrooms. We didn’t use the hotel restaurant as the menu was a little fussy for kids/teens. Rooftop bar is lovely. Brandon helped us with our bags and was outstanding - really helpful and couldn’t do enough to look after us : )

title: Great Location and Pleasant Staff
text: Great location with walking distance to Korea Town, Herald Square,  Bryant Park, the Highline, the Vessel, and other attractions. Subway is near by. Love the young girl, Zuribel at front desk. She is the sunshine when you walk in to the hotel, pleasant, friendly, and always has a big smile on her face. The staff at the restaurant are courteous and polite. The bell hopper was eager to help.

title: Christmas Fun
text: Front desk Sid, doormen Napoleon & Brandon, bartender Tyler, Frankie and the rest of the front desk staff were fabulous and accommodating. Thank you for a wonderful stay and all of your help in making this a memorable family trip!

title: Christmas Stay
text: Soribel at the front desk personally helped me with the ice machine and is an asset to the Hilton brand and was doing her job plus more with a smile on her face. Also I do want to mention Ramon was also outstanding & professional. Last but not least Gwendollin was extremely knowledgeable, pleasant & professional with a smile on her face always. We can’t wait to stay there again & hoping all those team members are still working there as they made us feel like family. Thank you!

title: Excellent service
text:
Excellent front desk service including the Bell and luggage man.
Rooms slightly tired perhaps: chipped furniture and wonky swivel chair; poor instructions for room phone. The rooms (2) were just a little dark: they needed more light near the wardrobe which was very very small.

title: Great Stay
text: Had a great stay. The staff were all great and helpful with my questions.  Rooftop bar and the lobby lounge were very nice.  Room was comfortable and quiet.  We had a great view too!  I am grateful for the experience!

title: Bem Localizado e só! Pouco para um Hilton.
text: Localização Excelente, mas o Hotel é padrão turístico. O quarto bem pequeno, cafeteira não funcionava, frigobar não funcionava; de qualquer forma o quarto era muito limpo, sempre arrumado pelas manhãs, banheiro também. Café da manhã nem precisa, devido a quantidade de opções próximas ao hotel. Da pra ir a pé em muitos locais em Manhattan, já que o metro de NY é complicado.

title: The Staff Makes It Great!
text: It's a very nice hotel in a solid location, but all made infinitely better by the overall vibe and warmth created by the staff.  Martha.  Caroline.  Enajee.  Jhon.  Their welcoming attitude made all the difference.  In a tough city, walking in to this sort of environment means everything and I'll definitely be back.  Thanks!

title: Back customer service and manager never contacted me when I asked to speak with her/him
text:
In November 19 we choose this hotel to celebrate our anniversary and it was the worst ever choice, we had a delayed flight so we arrived around 230 am, I called ahead of time to inform the front desk about the event and I called to let them know we are coming late, 
Firstly someone at this location made a mistake on our reservation that was November 18-24 and set it for December 18-24. That got fix even though they blame third party.
I’m a diamond member with Hilton and I have travel the world and I always choose Hilton whether a book directly or through a third party and I never loose the benefits of a diamond member, I don’t care about the points and that is what I loose.
Front desk person name Erika said that it was a note from the manager to no give us any benefits because we book to a third party and treated us, like we were a third class citizen and didn’t care about our business.
I requested a extra pillow on Saturday and on Monday and I never got any.
I called diamond call center and they were a bunch of liars and blame me for choosing that location.
Even it was a third party booking they got paid and there was no reason to be treated with disrespect as we were asking for freebies 
At the front desk I was told that I used the wrong Amex card and all of them are diamonds members and world travelers and they know everything about diamonds members.
I think if you are in a customer service you should treat customers with respect.
You travel to enjoy your vacation or your special moments and the last thing you want is to deal with bad customer services.
I won’t recommend this specific location

title: Amazing staff!
text: Wonderful hotel in a great location. Rooms are clean and well kept. Staff is top notch. Shavonne was super friendly and accommodating! Zoribel was always smiling and has the best restaurant recommendations!

title: This hotel is unloved by its owners.
text:
I want to be fair: I gave this hotel 3 stars because everything worked. Functionally, it was fine. 
However, this hotel was a disappointment. 
Reception staff were not very welcoming and were not personable. No mention of my gold status with HH. No mention of an upgrade. They just asked whether I wanted’points or breakfast’.

The room (1909) had a nice view and was clean. But, my oh my, dated isn’t even the word. It was run dow. 
The television was hanging in a 45 degree angle. Curtains were torn at the end and didn’t black out properly, the lampshades were all hanging crooked. 

This hotel is unloved by its owners. Neglected. This was not in line with how I normally experience Hilton. I paid way too much money for what was less than mediocre. 

I requested a later checkout at 14h00, but that wasn’t granted.

title: Awesome stay. Rested and felt welcomed the entire weekend.
text: Excellent service. Everyone we interacted with was great. Beds are so comfortable. Special s/o to Marian, she was there Friday night, Saturday night, and Sunday morning. She always had a smile on her face and accommodated all of our needs. Great asset.

title: Good hotel, Amazing Frontworker!
text:
We really enjoyed our stay at the Hilton, the location is just perfect for everyone who loves to stroll around the city! 
But we especially want to thank Brandon for his kindness and helpfulness. 30mins before we were meant to leave for the airport in the evening our flight got cancelled, which was a pretty stressful situation because we needed a flight out of the city that day. Brandon really helped where he could and was really understanding with our situation (not that easy since we were all over the place). 
We wish everyone a Brandon by there side in a stressful situation! 
Also a nice rooftop

title: Best Staff Ever
text: Everything was amazing! Quick cleaning of our room, free water bottles, centralized location, wonderful staff, and awesome bar/lounge. Rooms themselves were nice and clean, not much too them, simple. The perfect place to stay if you want to explore and experience NYC.

title: Excellent experience
text: The staff was excellent especially the front desk Shavonne was super accommodating and she was so kind and friendly! Also housekeeping was great! Honestly the whole experience at this hotel was perfect! I will be back!

title: Shavonne made our trip!
text: Shavonne was amazing in starting our NY visit off right!  She ensured our parking was validated and even sent a gentleman to retrieve my phone from our already parked vehicle. True professional and customer service beyond expectations!  We will definitely come back and stay.

title: Easy access spot
text: Great front desk service. We needed a special accommodation and Martha, Brendan and John rocked! Excellent location, near subway and many restaurants. Very pleasant little spot in Nyc. Will definitely come again

title: Breathtaking views of the Empire State Building
text: I was here on business for an International Piano Competition at the Lincoln Centre. I could have stayed there but I chose here due to the views. My stay at the hotel was fantastic with very professional staff and I felt well looked after. Check in was really straight forward and efficient. They double checked my room had a view of the empire state for me which was one of the main reasons I chose this hotel. They were always on hand to answer any questions I had about my stay in New York. My room was always really clean too. Absolutely can not wait to stay here again.

title: Go for the location and nice hotel.  Stay for the service and staff!!
text: The staff is the reason I chose to leave this review.  The staff at this hotel were so fantastic.  From Brandon at the door to the nicest and super helpful cleaning woman (I wish I could remember her name) helping us on the top floor.  But MOST OF ALL - Zoribel Torres and Marian were the most kind, friendly and helpful dynamic duo at the front desk.  Zoribel welcomed us so warmly and we were super surprised that included Happy Anniversary for my wife and I.  So kind and unexpected.  Even more unexpected was the upgrade to the top floor...EVEN MORE UNEXPECTED...sparkling wine and Macarons with a lovely anniversary card.  Listen, the hotel is just fine. Nice and well appointed.  Great location and great wi-fi.  What makes this hotel stand out is the amazing staff.  We will return for that reason alone.  I truly hope Zoribel Torres and Maria at the front desk are appreciated by this hotel.  They are just wonderful and Hilton New York Fashion District is lucky to have them.  In fact, every person we interacted with at that hotel was just lovely.

title: Nice hotel, but....
text:
Hotel very satisfying, good location, but today 3 weeks after our check out, we are still waiting for joining the hotel directly (mail or direct phone impossible to find) about our forgotten bag in the hotel hall.
Would you please help me and contact me to pay the return back to France for our backpack?
Thanks  a lot

title: Great start at a well located hotel
text: Great location. The rooms were clean and well priced. The staff was super kind and helpful. The airline lost my luggage and the front desk did their best to make my situation as pain free as possible. Brandon was especially courteous and made us feel at home.

title: 5 Stars!
text: Great hotel with spacious rooms and great service. Everyone that I met was kind and hospitable. The doorman, Brandon, was especially polite and helped with my luggage and answered questions kindly about other amenities. Overall, a great experience and I would stay at this hotel again.

title: Excellent midtown Manhattan location
text:
We chose this hotel for its proximity to Madison Square Garden - about a 5-6 block walk.  We were attending a concert and wanted to be able to easily walk to/from MSG.  But the location also proved to be very advantageous for our other activities and sightseeing.  We were able to walk to Union Square Greenmarket, Eataly, Strand Bookstore, Empire State Building, as well as dining/dessert.  For attractions further away, we could get to a subway stop with a short 5-7 min walk.
Room was more spacious than I was expecting for a Manhattan hotel room.  Not much hanging closet space, but there was a six drawer dresser plus two nightstands.  Comfortable king size bed, large flat screen TV, desk/chair and small ottoman for seating.  Bathroom was good size with a large vanity and walk-in glass shower.  
My one complaint with the room was that there was no refrigerator/microwave - instead there was a money grab mini-bar which was not helpful for a multiple night stay.
Hotel has a nice rooftop bar.  Drinks were pricey (not unexpected), however the seating areas were pleasant and the view was lovely.

title: Nice stay, great location
text:
Hotel was great, we stayed for 8 days. Wi-Fi worked well and the room was clean. Fantastic location. Only complaint was that the AC wasn’t super effective so on hot days it was hot in the room.

Brandon and John specifically were two staff members who were incredibly welcoming, kind, and helpful in making us feel welcome and getting us to the airport upon departure.

title: Good location, Poor service - avoid if you can.
text:
This has been one of the worst Hilton experience for us, I'm Hilton honors gold member and the front desk charged me for the breakfast by mistake cause I had elected 18$ food option on checkin, when I went to correct it they treated me like I'm fraud or something and straight up made it feel like its my mistake.

Even the hotel room rug was wet due to LEAKING, and no one cared. AVOID if you can

title: Hilton must reward their staff - super friendly
text:
I have visited this hotel no less than 10 times in the last 5 years. It's already part of our routine in NYC.
The location is excellent.
The rooms are just the right size for New York City.
There is a pearl that the hotel has and it is the reception, always predisposed and friendly. They make you feel at home.
I think it is essential to mention that Zoribel Torres and Marian Rock are #1, I wish all the Hilton's had more people like them.
Also Martha, Caroline Ircania, Sid, Raúl, Napoleón, Jhon, Shavonne stand out for their predisposition.
If you plan to go to NYC don't hesitate. "location, location, location" plus an awesome staff.

title: Recepcion
text:
Hemos estado cenando en el rooftop del hotel, y supuestamente es independiente.
Al bajar a recepción hemos pedido porfavor si nos podían llamar a un taxi porque llovía a mares y de muy malas formas nos han dicho que si no estamos alojadas ahí, que no, aunque entendemos que el restaurante no forma parte del hotel, lo hemos pedido como un favor, ya que somos de otro país y no sabíamos donde llamar, simpáticas y educadas, si señor

title: Another Wonderful Stay
text:
When we realized we were planning a much needed week long trip back to NYC, there was only one place we wanted to return to, and it was the Hilton New York Fashion District, almost a year to the date. 

We like how centrally located the hotel is to everything but just far enough away that you’re not stuck in the tourist trap and bright lights of say Times Square. Plus you’re so close to everything, the Fashion District, the Flat Iron, and Chelsea to name a few. We drove in and opted for a garage that was a block away that had a decent rate for 5 days, letting us have several options if needed to move about the city. 

We checked in on Sunday, I had two rooms, and was able to use the Hilton app to select the rooms and check in prior to getting to the hotel. All I had to do was get keys to either room when we got in. One of my rooms was on the 20th Floor and the other being on the 16th. No need to be on the same floor, though I’m sure I could’ve waited to see if rooms were available. Got to the rooms and had City views. I will say that the view from the 20th floor was better as you could see the Empire State Building from the window. Both rooms were clean and ready to be occupied. 

We settled into both rooms before heading out for a bite to eat. That’s one thing about being in NYC, you can’t go hungry. During our stay we did stop into the restaurant on site for breakfast. I’m glad we weren’t having to attend to a schedule because the wait time for our breakfast seemed to be a bit obvious and puzzling as we were the only ones in the dining room. One of our diners had ordered eggs and wanted them to be poached, she received hard boiled., we didn’t send them back as we weren’t sure how long it was going to take to correct the issue. I ordered the Banana Bread French Toast, I was going for indulgence, which at first it hit the mark, but it was too much to finish. That was the only time we ate in the dining room. On our last night we decided to check out the rooftop bar, which was excellent. Especially for a nightcap. Drinks were great, dessert was tasty and shareable. Service was top notch. The view was great. Just keep in mind that you cannot charge to your room. So have your cash/card ready. 

The few things I will point out from the stay, on Tuesday after returning to the room to relax, our tv was not turning on, we waited about 5 minutes and noticed the red indicator light re-illuminate and the tv was working again, however we lost quite a few stations. Hoping it was just a temporary issue, we didn’t report it. Then Thursday afternoon after returning back to the room, we called down to the Front Desk, and they sent engineering up. The first gentkeman wasn’t entirely sure what he was doing and tried to say that “maybe it was the weather.” Um no but ok. He then called another engineer who came in and they tried updating the tv with a USB stick, that still did not fix the issue. His immediate response was to have us switch rooms, with it being our last night, I wasn’t trying to move. We checked with our other room and we’re told that it too had lost channels at some point. 

I was also looking forward to the standard comfortable Hilton beds, but this trip seemed to miss that mark. 

I would love to see the rooms get upgraded, especially the bathrooms. Bring them into the new standards, take out the framed mirrors and put in the LED backlit ones. And the sink counters were great 10+ years ago. Team up with the Fasion Institue have them design a new and updated vibe. Just a thought. 

All in all, the staff is always great and friendly. Will we be back on our next trip to NYC? Absolutely.

title: Shavonne is the best!
text: The room was fine. Nothing fancy but what made our stay was Shavonne!!! She was so nice & made sure we were extra comfortable. She was able to get us a room early & explain all of the amenities. Thank you for making our stay so special, Shavonne! We will be back

title: Mediocre Hotel With Excellent Staff
text:
We stayed here for NYFW. The hotel is pretty average. You'll find the undersized lobby and rooms NYC is known for, and overall the place could use a good demo and redo. It's pretty worn.

The staff is great, however, and Brandon and Napoleon took great care of us: checking our luggage, calling cabs to the airport, and providing plenty of recommendations for places to eat. 

We'll find another place to stay the next time we're in the city, but will revisit this location after they complete their next remodel.

title: Very Average Hilton in NYC Fashion District
text: With the exception of check in, the staff at the Hilton NY Fashion District was helpful and friendly and did their jobs well. At check in, however, the clerk delighted in telling us that we would not be receiving any Hilton Honors benefits because we booked through a travel agent. Off putting and weird.  The hotel itself is grim and charm free.  Truly terrible lighting throughout the hotel. There are no worse neon lightbulbs than those used EVERYWHERE at the hotel. The rooms are small and old. Thin towels; beat up baseboards; very noisy air conditioning; old wallpaper. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable and best of all, the hotel is very quiet despite its location. Overall, C- level property. Convenient to Penn Station. Not particularly convenient to anything beyond mid-town.

title: Hilton with the best staff
text: Excellent service. We are loyal Hilton members and this is probably the best staff we’ve met. The hotel is very nice by NYC standards. Good restaurant. Gorgeous rooftop bar (make reservations). And full bell staff. They were very quick when we needed towels. The gym is a little small (and hidden in the basement), but it is suitable and has both a weight machine and free weights. It’s close to multiple subways. Special mention to Brandon who was so friendly and kind the whole visit. We can’t wait to come back.

title: Excellent hotel in manhattan
text: We came to the city to attend a wedding and stayed here in September of 2022.  The location is great, in the middle of everything.  There was a nearby parking garage and I guess it was affiliated with the hotel, because the cost to stay there was only like $30-40 per 24 hours which is great for Manhattan.  Front desk was super friendly.  Brandon in particular was extremely courteous and helpful on several occasions throughout our stay.  We spoke to probably a half a dozen staff members and everyone was so friendly and helpful.  We would stay here again given the opportunity.

title: Best check in
text: I just had the best hotel check in. My flight arrived late to NY so I couldn’t wait to get to the hotel, find some food, and get some rest. When my Uber dropped me off at the Hilton I was greeted my a wonderful women named Shavonne who was already expecting me. She new my name and was able to give me directions to a great restaurant close by.  Thanks Shavonne for taking such good care of me.

title: Great location
text: Recently stayed 2 nights for a wedding. The staff was very friendly. The location is fantastic (coffee shops, restaurants, and K-town for last night eats). The valet staff was excellent, Napoleon and Brando really helped us out. I had to move a bunch of tables and they really came through to get everything safely into the trunk of the SUV. Hotel is a little dated, but the service and location make up for that.

title: Great hotel!
text: This is a perfect spot for easy access to every neighborhood and activity on your NYC list. Accommodations are clean, functional, and well priced. Staff is friendly and helpful. I had a few special requests and Shavonne Zoribel was extremely responsive. Definitely recommend if you’re ready to immerse yourself in city life outside the chaos of midtown! Also very convenient to major transportation hubs. Rooftop bar is amazing!

title: Great location and staff
text: My stay was great. I needed a fridge to store my breastmilk and they provided that without any issues. The rooms are a bit small and the communication between the restaurant and the hotel is nonexistent however, the hotel staff are fantastic. I’d come back for that very reason. All staff I interacted with were empathetic and accommodating, especially Shavonne. I’d recommend this place due to the location and good customer service.

title: Hilton NY Fashion District
text: Brandon, the doorman gave impeccable service!  He was so attentive and went above and beyond!  Thank you, Brandon!  This level of service was the highlight of our stay at Hilton NY Fashion District.  Thanks again!

Super hôtel, personnel très très agréable .
