A notre arrivée un valet récupère nos bagages et les montes directement dans notre chambre . Nous prenons possession des cartes de notre chambre à l’accueil , le réceptionniste nous imprime les explications en français et s’excuse de ne pas parler le français ! 
Chambre au 5 eme étage , vu sur un autre bâtiment en face pas vraiment de charme , je décide de retourner voir le réceptionniste et demande très gentiment si nous pouvons obtenir une chambre avec une meilleure vue …. 16 eme étage avec vue sur le haut de l’empire state building .
Très bon séjour je recommande cet hôtel fortement pour le rapport qualité prix et très bon point il est bien placé permettant de rejoindre le métro rapidement qui dessert de nombreux endroits . De nombreux commerces et restaurations à proximité à pied .
Réservation effectué sur voyage privée avec vol . Rien a dire comme à chaque voyage.

Validé

Septembre 2022

title: Amazing Staff, Great Location & Very Clean
text:
I have been staying at this location for over ten years.  I come for work and pleasure on a minimum of 22 days a year, but most years close to 30 or 40 days.

The staff is amazing.  I love all of them Marian, Martha, Caroline, Zoribel, Sid, Erika, Simin, Brandon, Shavon, Luis, Napoleon.  I hope I did not forget anyone, the hotel staff is amazing too, very accommodating.  

I bring them treats a few times a week during my stay and the same for the maid staff.  The other day when I came home my friend say "how is it to be in your own bed/apartment" and I replied it is good, but to be honest I feel like home at the hotel too.  They are all just so very nice we all have bad days it is normal, but everyone at the hotel is very cheerful and I talk a lot.......and they talk back too.......lol.

What is more important is the cleanliness and this hotel is very clean.  It is a great location.  I go to my sister's house in NJ a lot of times and from the hotel to the train it is less than 10 minutes.  THE PERFECT LOCATION.

I love all my friends at the hotel, yes, they are like friends :) 

Tommy

title: Great Staff, Good Hotel
text: Myself and my 16 year old niece spent a long weekend in NYC.  The staff at this Hilton, including, Caroline, Marion and Syed were exceptional and made sure all our needs were met.  From the front desk to enginnering to housekeeping, all were great and very accommodating!  Caroline even took the time to leave a happy birthday card and treat for my niece!   Attention to detail was great!  Room is small but fit us both comfortablyl.  As a diamond member I was issued credits at the hotel restaurant where we did enjoy breakfast twice but it is limited and pricey even with the Hilton credit.  There are plenty of food choices, what there are not plenty of, is taxi cabs in NYC.  Uber and Lyft  are the only way to go.  Our first day was very frustrating with no taxis at Penn Station, lined up at this hotel or any exhibits.  Almost missed the start of Hamilton because it took an hour to get there!  Take your frustration away but loading the uber app!  Hotel is in a decent location, walkable to a lot around you.  We were unable to enjoy the rooftop bar but it looks fun!  Nice Hotel, Great Staff!

title: Horrible Experience
text:
UPDATE: they outright denied any complaints/requests were ever made so the cherry on top is they’re liars too :)

Overall mediocre hotel, there was a leak in our shower the entire stay that would flood the restroom floor. I brought it up twice to hotel staff and nobody followed up on it. I asked for additional towels on three separate occasions and only received one towel… the other two times were ignored and never followed up on as well. The housekeeper would only leave behind one towel after cleaning as well, even though there were clearly two people staying in the room. Did they expect us to share the one towel? I’m not sure if towels were being rationed for some reason? It was extremely frustrating either way. There are so many other options to choose from in this area or in New York in general, avoid this hotel if possible.

title: Cute hotel
text: Good location, nice rooftop bar. Rooms are small but clean and cozy. Staff is helpful. Room cleaning service was not at it's best, the cleaning lady every day kept forgetting to leave towels. We didn't have a chance to use downstairs restaurant, but it there was no entertainment, as advertised on website.

title: Well located but understaffed
text:
Hotel is very well located , but really understaffed
room service is a challenge
A Special mention about Doorman Brandon , extremely polite & very helpful 
he actually helped us save $ 25 on a cab ride to JFK - thank you again

title: Great stay!
text: Good stay at this hotel…. good location and lovely rooftop bar with a view! Brandon at the hotel was GREAT! Helped with our luggage and taxi he was so friendly &helpful. Will definitely be back! Love NYC

title: Anusha
text:
The rooms were v expensive for there small size, and v dimly lit. No toiletries in the bathroom

On the plus side, service was nice, staff was friendly and accommodating and the rooftop bar was a plus to the hotel (4pm-12am)

title: Enjoyable Stay
text: We had a good stay here for one night.  The service was good, the room and bathroom were clean. Special Shout-out to Brandon who was awesome in getting me a parking spot right in the front of the hotel!!!   Definitely, we stay here again.

title: Excellent location and service
text: We enjoyed our stay. The house keeping is very diligent. The staff is very helpful, e.g. she pointed out water station at the fitness center for refill in hot summer. It is a great location close to Amtrak Penn station, and subway is super convenient. I like Chelsea district, check out the Chelsea market, and the High Line.

title: Nice Hotel
text:
First, I want to give a shoutout to Marian and Maria. They helped me find a delicious local pizzeria. All the staff were super friendly and helpful. 
The hotel overall is in a need of a facelift. The rooms are nice but could use a bit of retouching. The biggest issue was the elevator. It made a lot of uncomfortable sounds and some people got stuck in the elevator. It was impressive to see how quick the fire department came. 
Location is great and close to the Penn Station.

title: Staff are not very nice
text: Location is good the room is ok ,  I stayed there for a week. When I left the tips the room gets cleaned and soap was provided. One day I forget to leave the tip, the bathroom was not cleaned and no shampoo left in the room. When I complained to the lobby, the staff was not happy and did not apologized. Their attribute was very bad. Later a person came to the room and gave shampoo . Soap and cups but was rude. The next day they left so many shampoo and conditioner in the bathroom. It felt so obnoxious.

title: excellent hôtel au calme dans NY avec un roof top du tonnerre
text:
Nous avons séjourné 6 nuits à 3 (2 chambres) dans cet excellent hôtel.
le personnel était très attentif (grand merci à la dame élégante et charmante qui parlait très bien français. Merci aussi aux autres membres du staff tant de l'accueil que du restaurant).

les chambres disposaient d'une excellente literie et de tout le confort et étaient extrêmement calmes (bien isolées). L'hôtel propose un excellent petit déjeuner (il faut essayer le toast avec guacamole et saumon fumé, un régal). 

Au 20 ème étage, un rooftop présente une jolie vue sur l'Empire state Building.

Bref, nous recommandons cet hôtel bien situé à une encablure de la highline et du fameux "The EDGE".

title: Very Accommodating, Great location, Helpful Staff.
text: I took a solo birthday trip to NYC in August 2021 and got a great deal on 2 nights at this hotel. I wanted to visit the FIT Museum and FIT, but also wanted to be close shopping and Time Square. My train arrived in NYC early, so I called the hotel and spoke with a nice lady who gave me the option to check in early. The room they gave me had a great view to the main street, it was on the 8th floor and overall clean and tidy. I ordered Uber-eats one night and the front desk staff were kind enough to hold on to my food until I arrived. I am a very low maintenance person when it comes to staying at hotels, so overall this was a great stay.

title: Great Customer Service
text: The staff at the front the desk was amazing Martha and Zoribel went out of their way to help us out. Napoleon and Steve are very attentive and friendly. They made our stay extra special and we will stay here next time we are in town

title: Good value Nice neighborhood.
text:
After escaping the clutches of the Hampton Inn By Hilton Chelsea.  I was regimes by Hilton corporate to this property.  My arrival was at about 1 am.  I arrived and was greeted by name at the front desk.  Offered water and my keys.  I was told no upgrades were available on such short notice but they had a room for me.  

The lobby is very nicely appointed still remnants of Covid precautions remain with plexiglass barriers and such but for the most part pleasant atmosphere.  

The standard king room was quite large for a Manhattan hotel and the bathroom very nicely appointed with a large walk-in shower and sink at shaving g height.  The room smelled clean and fresh all of the furniture appeared well maintained and every square foot used with intention.  The only thing lacking is a place to sit other than the desk.  

The bed comfortable the AC and thermostat worked flawlessly keeping the temperature at a comfortable setting was easy compared to my prior accommodations.  There are abundant outlets to plug all manner of electronic gear into as well as decent Wi-Fi  in the room without upgrading to the premium internet.  

There is adequate lighting as well as a minibar (however it is not stocked due to Covid precautions) so there is in fact no refrigerator.  There is a coffe maker with Kcups and water in room.  

Overall this is a very adequate hotel with a decent staff.

title: Great hotel right in the heart of the city
text: Great spot and a great hotel in the fashion district/flatiron district in midtown NY. I've stayed here a few times and it's my go-to in NY. Rooms are small but comfortable, and staff are very helpful. Parking was just down the road and also quite straight forward. Breakfast was nice and the views are great - you can see the Empire State Building from many north-facing rooms! I'm happy with the spot, making it easy to access the east and west villages, shopping, and the more touristy spots too if you wish. Great food is easy walk distance too. A nice hotel!

title: Great location, clean facility
text: Very impressed with the facility.  Location, cleanliness, security all first rate.  Employees could not be more accommodating.  Rooms are on the smaller side, but they are adequate.  Adjacent restaurant works.

title: Posizione perfetta
text: 5 minuti a piedi dalla metro, 10 minuti per l'Empire State Building ... che dire, la posizione è perfetta per muoversi in tutte le direzioni a Manhattan. Camere pulite,  silenziose, personale della reception cortese e disponibile. Sicuramente da tenere presente per un soggiorno in città

title: Hilton Hotel Extortion
text:
I will let the facts speak for themselves without any emotion

- I checked into to the Hilton Hotel Fashion District on April 3rd and checked out on April 10th

- I stored my luggage in the luggage room and went for a meeting and  returned 4 hours later to retrieve my luggage. 

- I requested for a hotel taxi for the airport and departed

- I received my credit card statement on April 26th and found out that I had been charged an additional $800

- After calling the hotel I was told that I had been charged the amount for breaking a television

- I was not communicated with during my stay, after I checked out and after I returned via email or phone about this charge

- It is an utterly false claim as I had not damaged the television.  I had not even turned it on during my stay at the hotel

- I have tried to resolve the matter in an amicable manner with the hotel but they keep insisting on the claim 

- Being a Hilton Honors member for many years and having stayed at multiple properties for my business, I am utterly shocked at this behavior which is tantamount to extortion 

I would ask the readers to not only stay clear of this hotel but also to spread the word of this extortion by the hotel

title: morning restaurant terrible!
text: Breakfast restaurant terrible. Seating layout horrendous for covid and any sense of not sitting on top of your neighbor. HK staff maskless in elevators! Rooms small. homeless folks in front of hotel sleeping on sidewalk in broad daylight. restaurant staff poorly trained.

title: All I needed!
text:
My first trip to New York. I chose to stay in the fashion district because I love to shop and when doing my research this area would be where our family would be spending a great deal of our time. We planned to see a NBA game and take trip to Time Square amongst other things. This hotel was clean, in a safe are and within walking distance to Broadway, Time Square and Madison Square Garden! Everything we needed was under mile walk. 
There are lovely staff to help you navigate the busy New York life and a roof top bar with picturesque scenery. No complaints here about the hotel at all. 
If I may add one warning!! In typical NYC fashion parking is an issue. There is a garage maybe two blocks down and you pay per day. I was skeptical but our ride was safe there for four days.

title: Not one I would recommend
text: So disappointed with the lack of atmosphere, welcome and service. You feel like a burden. Had to ask for shower gel, shampoo, something to drink out of (even then crappy single use plastic cups only, I’m afraid) no welcome hello, door man scowled when we said good morning 🤣 Barman wouldn’t give us ice. It was our 24th wedding anniversary, New York didn’t disappoint! Everyone everywhere in NY we visited  is super lovely. If I was on business trip this hotel would do (beds are comfy) although shower was freezing and the coffee machine didn’t work. If it’s a welcome you are after choose somewhere else.

title: Poor quality of stay
text: The rooms are nothing like shown in pictures. The room was small, dimly lit, broken switches in the bathroom, dirty coffee maker and dusty surfaces . The staff is not at all supportive. In spite of being a Hilton Gold member, I was charged for the upgrade. The hallways were very depressing and not very clean. Overall, I would never stay at this Hilton property. No complimentary drinking water

title: Couples trip
text: Great location. Friendly staff. Walking distance to train, 40/40 club, and several thrift stores. Rooms were a little tight, but it’s typical NY. Great breakfast, although not complimentary. Can’t wait to return when the weather is warmer!

title: Family fun
text: We had an amazing time and stayed for 6 nights. Rooms are tight which is to be expected but staff and housekeeping did an awesome job keeping it tidy and replenishes towels and shampoo daily! The area was great, walking distance to great restaurants, morning coffee, some thrift stores down the street and a fun piano bar across the street to boot’ the bar upstairs is nice too with beautiful views

title: Excellent Location
text: Close to train station, many many restaurants, Flatiron building, supermarkets, bodegas, liquor store. Easy access everywhere. The rooftop bar is an excellent choice for sunset drinks, I’ll return to this place if I have to go back to NYC.

title: A Reasonable NYC Hotel with Minor Niggles
text:
Sandbar Rooftop bar has a good view including the Empire State building.  Food is OK, nothing special.  Bit surprised when we went to pay to find that the bar is not linked to the hotel so we couldn't put the charge on the room.

Saturday evening got back from our meal at a reasonable hour and yet the bar downstairs was closed. Which wouldn't be so bad if the roof bar was connected to the hotel.  But we just wanted to take a glass of wine back to the room.  Didn't exactly spoil the night but a pity.
Breakfast was good.  Room clean, good size for NYC.

title: Great service
text: Everything was clean and my experience with the staff was great. I would stay here for all my upcoming business trips to New York. The location is perfect and very accommodating to all your needs, and everything is only a block away.

title: Room was not clean And manager was rude
text: The room was not clean enough. The sheets had stains on them. Stay away, much better options and very misleading about the view for the additional price. I’ve been a HH member for many years, super disappointed. Done.

title: Nice hotel, rude staff
text: I feel very conflicted rating this property. My room was elegantly appointed, very clean, LARGE, and had everything I need. The location is excellent. I would rate the room and location 5/5. But the staff at this hotel are unbelievably rude -- I've never experienced anything like this before at a Hilton property. The person who checked me in was very friendly and nice, and the housekeeper who serviced my room was polite and courteous. However the night staff are RUDE. Every time I stopped by the front desk after 7pm the staff were so RUDE and disrespectful. And at checkout, the employee was not rude but she was definitely borderline disinterested in helping me! I would recommend that staff at this property have some customer service training. I would also note that the housekeeper - who was friendly - entered my room TWICE without knocking. This was unprofessional. Worst of all, night staff do not wear face masks (day staff do wear masks).

title: Decepcionante
text:
Escogí este hotel porque las fotografías de las habitaciones parecían confortables, y por la foto del "rooftop". Pero el restaurante/bar del rooftop no tiene nada que ver con el hotel, ni ofrece ningún tipo de descuento para los clientes alojados. Ni siquiera en la recepción del hotel te saben dar información de apertura y precios.
No ha gustado · Nos dieron una habitación en la 8ª planta, sin ninguna vista, que daba a un patio interior deprimente y sin ningún tipo de luz natural. Además la habitación anticuada, oscura, pequeña y necesita reforma. Nos alojamos tres adultos y no teníamos ni sitio para guardar las maletas, y encima las camas bastante pequeñas, nada de king size. El lavabo con una gotera en el techo que iba cayendo agua junto al lavamanos, cada día lleno de agua, y el desagüe de la ducha no funcionaba suficiente y se quedaba toda el agua estancada. Por no hablar de los amenities del lavabo... que eran ridículos e insuficientes. Por último el precio, cuando hicimos la reserva para 3 personas, 4 noches, el precio eran 1.242$, pero al pagar, nos cobraron más de 1400$, aparte de los 50$ de fianza que deben devolvernos. Una mala experiencia y un hotel que no hace justicia en la cadena Hilton, ni mucho menos a lo que se espera de un hotel de 4 estrellas.

title: Hilton bought a motel 6?
text:
This rating is strictly for the hotel itself, not the service, which was not bad.  In fact, the lady at the front desk was nice enough to adjust my bill after my checkout since I noticed a charge that did not credit me for the Diamond member $15 / day benefit at the bar.  

If you are accustomed to hotels like Conrad or the Waldorf, this hotel will feel like a motel 6.  Even with the location of the hotel, I would avoid this hotel at all costs and just Lyft or Uber here from another hotel.  This was the smallest, dingiest, and loudest hotel I’ve been in for a very long time.  Expect long waits for the elevator, worst possible gym, dim lights in your room and everything bad you can think of.

title: Fine hotel, bad staff
text: Basic amenities and standard rooms with a staff who could care less. Didn’t have much interactions with the team as I did a digital key check-in but on 1/1/22 at 7:15 PM I was disgusted by the older gentleman in the lobby. He wore his mask completely down under his chin and refused to help a family with questions regarding the on-site restaurant stating that “we are a hotel. they are a restaurant! i can’t help you, you have to ask them.” we all understand the concept of third party outlets renting space, but let’s at least have some courtesy to assist this out of town family. His continued demeanor displayed him barking commands at other patrons in the lobby while keeping his mask far down. He should not be employed by Hilton. Won’t come back if this is what my Diamond status gets me.

title: Won’t stay there again
text: The room was very poorly lit, I only assume this was to hide the old rug, stained linens and 50 year old decor. I had to Use a flashlight even with all the lights on. Way overpriced for the accommodations, although all the workers there were wonderful!!

title: Small but efficient
text:
Got two rooms for one night. Both rooms were clean but very tiny, not uncommon in NYC. Reception was very friendly. Rooftop bar was very nice. Drinks pricy but tasty and view were great. Breakfast was good, only 2 choice if using hotel voucher, continental or American. We all got the American (eggs your way, bacon or sausage, potatoes, toast. We added the pastry basket and the croissants were delicious! Location of the hote is away from the really touristy area. That was a plus for me. 

On the negative side, we got a high floor one room away from the elevator hoping for a quiet room. Room had no street noise but we heard the elevator cables moving up and down all night long. Next time we will ask for a room as far away from the elevator as possible. Also the walls are thin. We were awakened by a woman who was fighting with her husband over the phone. At first we thought she was in the hallway in front of our room. It turns out she was in the room right next to ours. So if you want to keep your conversations private, whisper in your room.

COVID Protocol in NYC: must show proof of vaccination with ID at all indoor establishments. We used the NYC COVID app so we didn’t have to pull out our ID and card every time.

title: Great Location Great Hotel
text: Rooms were clean. Staff was impressive. They have a restaurant that is excellent. Centrally located. Rooms were a. Ice size. Good price. Free coffee for breakfast. Close to trains and shopping. Quiet location.

title: Needs fixing up!
text: I you are looking to park your own car, drink from paper cups and stay in a room with peeling wallpaper, and unpainted patches areas and dust bunny’s under the furniture then this “Hilton” is for you…………………………………………………

title: On-Line Check-In Means Nothing
text: Everything was fine except for the Check-In I checked in through the Hilton App and never received a check in notice for the designated check-in time of 4:00 pm. After waiting in the lobby for an hour I asked the front desk why so long and they said my room as not ready.  ??  Why are you letting me check-in on the App and then house keeping does not have my room ready???  Minus one star. Do not feel the staff is empowered to offer commensurate compensation for the inconvenience. Minus one star.  What’re ever happens do NOT let them put you in a low floor in the front on the hotel.

title: Select another if possible
text: Although the service was outstanding, the hotel is outdated, beds are extremely uncomfortable, furniture is all marked up and the rooms are small. Pillows are terrible! For over $300 a night during the week, there are better Hiltons in Manhattan.

title: Poor service
text: Located on 26th st the hotel do not offer proper services, no good welcoming, no services in rooms. I found dead rat in the street 10m from hotel entrance, no waiters to assist me while checking in and checking out.

title: Surprise pleasurable stay
text:
We stayed for a week , I was concerned about cramped NY experience. However despite the the size of room ( or lack of size ! ) . The front desk , restaurant, rooftop bar , housekeeping 
And a room on the top floor with a lot of light made me a loyal guest of this property. I will return here on my next trip .

title: Great location, clean rooms, friendly staff
text: Queen Room was standard room size for New York City hotels. Great city view with Empire State Building from room 2109. Bathroom was spacious, I’m glad it had space to spread out toiletries and hair tools and not just a pedestal sink. There was only two of us, and I would not recommend more than two people in the room. No fridge to store leftovers or a microwave to heat up anything, but I was aware of this when I booked. Room was clean and well stocked every day. Housekeeping did a fantastic job and was attentive. Check in was easy, staff was very friendly. They also held our bags for free so we could explore the city a little more after we checked out. Location is great. Short distance to the 28th St red metro line that easily takes you to upper west side and Central Park, Times Square, Greenwich Village, Tribeca, WTC, and ferry to Liberty & Ellis Islands. Great rooftop bar. Would easily stay here again in the future.

title: Hilton Girlfriend Experience Provider
text:
I visited here on business with a single man for the night. Overall it was a good experience. The mattress was a little hard in my opinion and the food was a 4 star but for a Hilton I wouldn’t expect much more.

I won girlfriend experience provider of the year award which was the highlight for me.

title: Wonderful for wedding block
text: The staff at this hotel could not have been more kind or efficient. We had a big group that was constantly on the move and the hotel supported us from directions, to luggage to handing out welcome bags to our guests. They truly helped make our wedding weekend the best time ever.

title: Terrible experience with staff
text: The front desk Martha and manager on duty Camille were extremely rude and obnoxious. Awful experience. Ruined my stay. Was granted late checkout as Diamond member upon arrival. Was then disturbed incessantly while working to leave.

title: Great stay!
text: Great location, close to many restaurants and subway stations. The staff was friendly and helpful. We asked for extra pillows, coffee and coffee cups and they were delivered to our room within 10 minutes. The room was small but not cramped. The bathroom was clean and had a spacious shower. Never had to wait more than a minute for an elevator to our room on the 17th floor. The a/c was ice cold and nearly silent. The in room  WiFi worked well. We would definitely stay here in the future.

title: 3 Star Name - 2 Star Property
text: The property is in a nice convenient area, with a driveway for taxi's to drop off/pick up; all stops there. The room were small which is understandable for NYC, but a lot of attention is needed to bring this up to Hilton standards. The walls throughout and in the rooms are scuffed, chipped; our AC unit was dusty, bathroom fan didn't start, clogged with dust; as we'll the mattress was very tired (one side firm, the other you would sink in). The fridge is a bar fridge ONLY for purchases, can't fit any leftovers in it.

title: Should be a Hilton Garden Inn - at best.   Paper thin walls, no Hilton benefits
text:
This hotel is not a Hilton - really more of a Hilton Garden Inn.

First, the rooms are small (which is not unexpected in NYC), with sparse amounts of beaten up furniture.   The HVAC is a loud below window unit like you would find in a cheap hotel.   The doors and walls are paper thin so you hear every word spoken in the hall.   The king bed had two small pillows.

The hotel is located in the Fashion District, so attracts a party crowd that comes back late and noisy.   Expect to be woken up in the middle of the night.

The hotel does not honor Diamond benefits.   No late check out.   Breakfast is a sad collection (croissants, boiled eggs, oatmeal and... that's it!).   I get that COVID has reduced staff but the incremental effort to have more than two items at breakfast would be very low.   I have recently stayed at much lower-rated hotels that have far better choices.

It really is much more like a Hilton Garden Inn - this is not a full service property.  It does not compare in terms of amenities, rooms, furnishings, location, or service to even the shabbiest Hiltons.

title: Worst stay at a Hilton property ever.
text: Filthy hotel. Angry staff. No ice machines. Pillows the size of postage stamps and sheets that did not fit. Could not use the fridge. The AC sucked. Just everything bad you can think of a hotel. Multiply it and make a reservation elsewhere.

title: Excelente
text: Muy buena ubicación, limpieza, tamaño de los cuartos, roof top muy linda vista, lpersonal del front desk, personal de Limpieza, cuidado por el covid excelente, todo en general estuvo muy bien, gracias por el trato tan lindo de toda la gente del front desk

title: Super Small Rooms
text: I requested to switch rooms due to the very small size of the closet space, there are no microwaves or fridge in the room, a fridge has to be requested. The wifi cuts in and out and often times during the day you have keep putting in your log in info. Hotel doesn’t have glasses, only paper cups. The HBO channels are a plus. The service on the rooftop bar was great and so of the hotel staff.

title: Safe Haven for Newbies to NY
text: This was a first visit to NY for me. I felt totally safe in the Hilton. Restaurants across the street, easy taxi access, clean rooms and accomodating staff. Would highly recommend to any age group. Would definitely stay here again!

title: A nice place in a central location
text: The hotel is really nice, around many restaurants and stores, also has a bar in the rooftop, the staff are friendly, also they speak Spanish, the room was just what we needed, the only thing that I can complain is that if you are taking a shower the water filter outside the shower, but I will stay again for sure in a future visit to NY.

title: Nice Reasonably Priced Hotel in Spectacular Location
text:
Checked into this hotel on short notice on quick visit to NYC w/daughter.  Staff was excellent and helped us get a nice clean comfortable room with two beds. Rooms not huge, but it's NYC!!! Room did have some items missing, like cups and ice buckets mostly related to Covid protocols, but staff would provide any items if requested. Staff provided good information about where to go and what to do, as well as clise by food options.  Close to subway stops on 7th Ave at 23rd and 28th streets.  Walking distance to the highline, Hudson yards and Times square. Great coffee shop around corner called 7 grams which was a huge plus. 

Free in room wifi with decent throughput.  The rooftop bar seemed cool though we didn't use it and many of the othe amenities on site. A huge bonus is there is a close self-park option at a reduced daily rate that did not have in and out privileges that we used to park our vehicle. 

On checkout day hotel securely checked our bags before we needed to get our car so we didn't have to worry about them on our last day in the city. 

Only complaint is the in room fridge was solely dedicated as a paid minibar so could not be used to refridgerate purchased beverages or other items.

We paid less than $200 a night and would highly recommend at that approximate price point.  Would highly recommend!

title: Dingy and Tired
text:
I stayed here for almost a week and I have to say I was less than impressed. Aside from the reduced services and amenities and COVID precautions, I came to find that the room I was given appeared to be unclean - very dusty everywhere, dried brown liquid on the floor of the bathroom and the sheets were stained yellow and brown. I don’t think this was just a mistake. I believe that this hotel is just dingy and gross. Also, don’t even get me started on the “gym”. It’s a claustrophobic subterranean closet with the most outdated equipment. 

The hotel is situated in a great location; however, I would suggest staying elsewhere - perhaps Crowne Plaza, which is just down the street (closer to Penn Station). 

The rooftop bar is fantastic (not surprisingly unaffiliated with the hotel). Grab a spicy marg with a view of the Empire State Building.

title: Worst Hilton Stay Ever!!
text:
I just want to preface this review by saying that my wife and I are seasoned travelers. We’ve been all over the world and are also Hilton Honors members. With that said, we know a little about hotel standards and accommodations when it comes to a hotel chain of this caliber. 

Long story short and simply put, this particular hotel was by far the worst experience we’ve ever had. First off, the rooms are incredibly small. We had a king bed room and our room was basically the bed with barely enough space to walk around it and to the bathroom. Considering this is Manhattan, I’m able to forgive that. What I can’t forgive was everything else wrong with our room, and lack of service and amenities. 

First off, and our biggest complaint was that our shower wouldn’t drain and that the shower door was also leaking. As you can figure, this caused water to quickly overflow and spill onto the bathroom floor.  This made for us to have hurried showers while standing in stale water as it sometimes took hours for the water to drain. 

Secondly, there was no iron or ice bucket or even an ice machine on any of the floors. What kind of hotel doesn’t keep irons in the room??? Anyway, I had to call the front desk twice and they finally brought it to my room 30 min later. As for the ice, I again had to call the front desk for it, only this time they wouldn’t deliver to my room for reasons I couldn’t understand. I had to swing by the front desk myself and pick it up. Awesome hospitality right? Anyway, so I inconvenience myself by going downstairs and asking for the ice at the front desk. Mind you I’m expecting it to be in a metal bucket with ice and a lid. But alas, that’s far from what I receive. They literally give you a bag of ice here…..like they pulled it out of a freezer at 7/11…..with no ice bucket….like wtf??? You think that it would be common sense that if the rooms didn’t already have ice buckets that they would give you one when you request ice right?? The following day I swung by the front desk again to pick up some ice and I made sure to mention I wanted I bucket this time around. Instead of the usual large metal ice bucket I’m accustomed to at hotels, they gave me this small plastic bucket as if I were gonna build sand castles with it on the beach.

I can usually forgive the shortcomings of a hotel if the service is exemplary but we found that to be lackluster as well during our stay. Suffice to say we won’t be staying here again and when we return to NYC, we will be looking to stay at a different Hilton location and hopefully a more enjoyable experience as well.

title: Average at best due to Covid
text: Very small rooms awkwardly shaped. Not many amenities available. No ice during hot summer days. Rooftop requires reservations. Request to be near friends was denied. Location was fine for tourists. I wasn’t too impressed

title: Great location, perfect sized hotel.
text: Comfortable hotel in the heart of Fashion District, within walking distance of several subway stops and restaurants. Rooms have nice coffee maker. Staff friendly and vibrant rooftop bar. Always enjoy the stay here.

title: Great hotel/location
text: My new go to hotel for the city now.  Loved the location and access to everything I wanted to do.  Quick walk to Flat Iron district.  Nestled between 6 and 7th easy to get up or downtown via taxi/subway.

title: Muy buen hotel en Fashion District
text:
La ubicación es muy buena, en la 26 cerca de la esquina con la 7. Se puede ir caminando a todas las atracciones y la estación de tren.  
Quizás la zona es más linda hacia el sur o más animada en Times Square pero se llega caminando en 10 minutos. 

Nosotros habíamos reservado un Garden Inn en la 35 pero a último momento iba a estar cerrado y nos pasaron la reserva a este hotel respetando el precio, así que fue más económico de lo habitual. 

La habitación no es muy grande, pero para los estándares de NY está muy bien, con 2 camas cómodas, escritorio de trabajo con sillón, TV, cafetera y frigobar. 
El baño es correcto. 

La limpieza es muy buena en todo el hotel. 
Muy buen wifi, nos dieron acceso al premium por ser clientes Gold. 

El desayuno es con vouchers de usd 12,50 por día por persona en un local a la vuelta que tiene de todo. Alcanza para un buen desayuno pero no es cómodo como estar en el hotel.

title: Trip was fine. Location to FIT was perfect.
text: All in all the room was fine. Not perfectly clean but satisfactory. Room 215 was extremely small (wall almost hit us in the face when we walked in)…and so very dark like a cave and lightening was not good enough.

title: Great Place To Stay
text: We enjoyed our stay here and would be more than happy to come back while visiting NY. Great rates especially being close to so much and recommend for others to stay here as well. Staff was friendly and helpful!

title: Great Stay in Chelsea
text: Look no further! Everything you need and want in a hotel is here. DO NOT MISS SANDBAR - you have to make reservations, so make sure you do so before your stay. The vibe at the lounge is the BEST. The hotel itself is beautiful and clean. The staff here is kind and welcoming. I will look to stay here again my next trip into the city.

title: Never booking with Hilton again
text: No hand sanitizer in the elevators, no ice machines in The Whole building no vending machines, no microwave or refrigerator in the rooms. Heat and air didn’t work and kept cutting off after two minutes. One trash can in the room. No food. Rooms smelled and bed and pillows were very hard. I will never book with Hilton again all that money we spent for three days. And I’m disabled and my room was on the 14th floor🤦🏾‍♂️🤬🤬🤬🤬

title: Expected better from Hilton.
text: Staff was friendly. The Room was my issue. Toilet was dirty. Mattress was caved in. Duvet/Comforter was torn on the side.   AC thermostat unresponsive. Found hair in restroom from former guest.  Found an item under the end table of a former guest as well. Mini bar was empty. No mini fridge or microwave.

title: Good Hotel Location and Staff very kind
text: Hotel is well located. Staff is very kind and they will help you with questions and concerns. I arrived earlier for the checking and they gave me a room which was wonderful after a long trip. Beds in the room are comfortable. Roof top bar at the hotel is a plus.

title: Small rooms and lifts, average service, good position
text:
Came here for 1 night during working here for a few weeks. As a very regular user of Hilton I compare this with others in NY and the US.
I booked here because it was closer to the office I was working in. As a gold member I am used to the normal Hilton ‘ways’ but found it a bit different here.
The front desk staff didn’t give out the normal breakfast vouchers - the only ‘extra’ was water. There seemed to be a long wait for lifts at most times.
The room was smaller than others but comfortable.
For breakfast you are shown downstairs and the buffet is in a different room to where they want you to sit. They seem to orient towards ordering food and charging accordingly - so be prepared to be assertive if you just want the buffet - which is ok.

title: Great location, clean hotel
text: The hotel was beautiful, rooms were spacious for NYC. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The location is convenient for food and things to do. We even rented bikes one night and rode to Timesquare. The bed was uncomfortable and breakfast was not available. The only two complaints we had! Be sure to try to rooftop bar!

title: Tiny room. King sized bed is a queen. Paid extra for city view and looked out at rusty water towers.
text: Tiny room. Kung sized bed is a queen. AC only goes up to 72 so you have to turn it off when it gets too cold then when it gets hot you have to turn it in again meaning you have to get out of bed every 25-30 minutes so it’s a sleepless night.

title: Amazing
text: Amazing time.   This location is amazing.   Proximity to penn station and just a truly enjoyable experience.   Cannot wait to come back.   And cromptons across the street was phenomenal too.   Everyone at this hotel should be very proud of themselves.

title: No fridge or microwave
text: Not having a fridge and a microwave really put a damper on the trip. My girlfriend and I wasted so much food and had to keep our drinks cool on the AC vent. It was extremely hot outside so we had to stay hydrated, unfortunately this place doesn’t offer you an option to keep your drinks cool when it’s literally 90 degrees plus outside!

title: Great hotel!
text:
Nice room. Very nice people at the reception. Beautiful rooftop bar with great view.
In Chelsea aérea ! Near everything . I will definitely stay there again. 
Have subway stations very close and Whole Foods just run the corner

title: Clean, Friendly and Convenient
text:
Great small hotel in the heart of Chelsea. I got a little scared by some reviews but found some of the criticisms unfounded.  It’s a short walk from Penn station. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The elevators worked and I never waited for one. 

The room was clean and stylish although some of the wood is banged up. Nice big TV though. I hate the old school fridge that charges you every time you touch something, especially since it was empty LOL.  This is a NYC hotel. You know the room will be small. But it was fine. 

I didn’t bother with the rooftop since there’s a reservation system and $25 minimum charge. That may change as it recovers from COVID precautions. The bar on the ground floor was very nice and we used that instead. The only negative was that staff seemed unaware of the change to “credits” for Hilton Honors which I would have used at the bar. 

Overall NYC is back. I had a great time and would not hesitate to stay at this Hilton again.

title: New York!
text: I came to the city with my best friends to celebrate my birthday and everything was amazing. Literally the only thing that I as unfortunate was no mini fridge in the room to keep some snacks and drinks. Other than that 10/10 would recommend!

title: Great hotel with perfect location to explore downtown and midtown
text: Really great experience for our family when exploring NYC. Like the proximity to a High Mile a beautiful new park in Chelsea. Food alternative as a result of restaurant renovation were great. The room A/C was bit noisy, but opening windows compensated it.

title: Horrible
text: It was so bad that I had relocate to another Hilton that was just as bad and filthy. I originally booked a room at another Hilton Garden Inn near Times Square for Father’s Day week with my family and 2 days later the reservation was canceled by the manager Heather Davis saying that the hotel was not going to be open and that she would reserve us a very nice room same price etc etc well when we got to the hotel we were given a extra small room that was barely enough room for 2 people and it was filthy with a view of a brick wall . I will never ever use any Hilton brand hotel again I was lied to and treated as if I was a peasant.

title: Great place to stay in fashion district
text: The manager Ashley was very helpful with our rooms getting serviced and our luggage back from the airport. She was also very helpful with information about the bars reservation times and the general rules of the rooftop. Also if you need anything changed in your room she's the fastest at getting your request fufilled.

title: Probably wouldn’t stay here if it wasn’t so cheap.
text: Bed is nice and soft, shower is small, there’s a hole in the ceiling of our room, no fridge, no ice maker anywhere in the hotel, toilet paper is horrible, location is decent and the elevators are a nightmare since only 2 of the 4 are functioning.

title: Many other better options
text: While nyc noise is common....this hotel was one of the worst for noise.  Rooms are very dark.   Not many elevators were working and the ones that were were slow probably due to more demand.  We lost likely would not return to this hotel, as There are many other better options at less cost.

title: You're Going to Want to Go Somewhere Else in NYC
text: You could kind of call this a hotel I guess. They give you a room but good luck getting to or from it with only one of the four elevators working and guests on every floor waiting to get out of the place. More than once I waited for 20 minutes before deciding to walk 11 flights of stairs drenched in sweat. They give you a shower but what do you do with it when there are no wash cloths? There’s a coffee maker but no cream or sugar or anything else you’d need to actually make coffee. There are housekeepers but they don’t clean your rooms because of COVID. It happened to be 90 degrees in the city which meant it was also super hot in our room since the A/C wasn't working - I called the front desk to ask if there was a fan or anything else they could do since the A/C was broken and the response was just, “No. I’m sorry”. We’re sorry too. Horrible experience. My wife and I have stayed in several hotels since COVID took hold (including at the height of the pandemic) and this has been the only disappointing experience. Literally any hotel in NYC will be able to deliver a better experience than this so do yourself a favor and look elsewhere!

title: Update to my one star review
text:
I am happy to report that after contacting the management of the hotel. Matthew Washington, Manager on Duty, reached out to me and we arrived at what I would call a fair settlement. As I said to Mr. Washington, while I appreciate his concerns and his offer, the fact is that what happened to me should not have happened in the first place. That being said, at this point, I am satisfied.

MY ORIGINAL REVIEW:
We arrived at the hotel on 5/29 only to be told there were no rooms available. We had a prepaid reservation and they did not challenge the validity of our reservation. After sitting around the lobby (with several other people without a room) for a half hour, they finally sent us to another property a block away. The new hotel was absolutely fine (actually nicer than the Hilton), but it was an additional $80 out of pocket and all Hilton would do is credit the rate at their hotel. I am a Hilton Honors Gold member, but because I booked through a 3rd party site, it was ignored by the hotel.

The way we were treated was disgraceful. What was even more egregious was that they had the availability problem throughout the day and they made absolutely no effort to contact us. Shame on them.

title: Save your money!
text: This location uses COVID as the excuse for literally everything. The gym is closed. There is no breakfast. There’s no mini fridge or microwave. The rooms are tiny. Finally, the staff isn’t all that friendly or helpful.

title: DID NOT HONOR DIRECT RESERVATIONS
text:
My reservation was booked directly with Hilton nearly 2 months prior to my stay. I arrived to the hotel around noon to drop off my bag. My room was, understandably, not ready at that time. I again tried to check in after the stated check-in time (approximately 3:30) and was told my room type wasn't ready. I paid for a specific upgraded room, so decided to wait rather than change room type. The front desk staff member did not mention there was a problem with my reservation at that time. I went back out and about and returned to the hotel around 7:30 pm. I waited about 45 minutes while the front desk staff was helping 4 other customers - all who seemed to have a problem. When I finally got to my turn I found out why - NONE OF OUR RESERVATIONS WERE HONORED. That's right, multiple parties - at least 4 that I witnessed, plus myself - were left without a hotel room in the evening in NYC on a holiday weekend, despite a reservation. Thankfully I was able to book another hotel quickly (not a Hilton brand, that's for sure). But it ended up being triple the price since I was desperate and booking for the same night. And I had to take the subway late evening to get there - with my  luggage. To top it all off, my credit card was charged in full for the room upon making my reservation (again, nearly 2 months ago). The first time I tried to check in, they charged my card $100 (understandable for deposit, but odd since I hadn't actually checked in yet). A while after being turned away and after being checked into my new hotel, I get a notification from my credit card that the full room charge was charged again. Then I received a folio that I had checked in and immediately checked out. 

That same evening, I tried to call the Hilton chain customer service number from the app and waited on hold for over 90 minutes to attempt to rectify the situation. I finally gave up, as it was so late at night.

title: Paper thin walls but great location
text: We heard the women laughing till 2 am in the room next to us both nights. Housekeeping didn’t clean the room very well by leaving coffee creamer/napkin packets from prior guests open. Great location to everything. Very near the subway and lots of food choices.

title: Good Location/Dated Hotel/Needs Upgrades
text: The location of this hotel is great, but the hotel felt old and dated, the rooms were dated, the staff was great, the gym was small and stunk. The view from our room was great, but they need to make some upgrades. I know they are currently working on the bar and restaurant, next they need to work on the rooms.

title: Not what we expected from a Hilton hotel as the web reviews and the hotel website said otherwise.
text: The restaurant and roof top bar was under construction and the rooms were basic bottom end rooms that you would expect from a lower hotel chain.  The staff was cordial but nothing over the top but it was located near some great restaurants nearby. We utilized our friends hotel as home base as our lobby and room was too small as a meeting location.

title: Algo desecionado
text: Un hotel con buena ubicación, pero se encuentra en remodelacion y tiene cerrado el bar y el restaurante,  y algunas otras áreas,  sus habitaciones son muy pequeñas y están pidiendo un cambio urgente ( renovación) para el desayuno tienen un sistemas de tiket que te entregan de 12.50 para ir a una cafeteria en la esquina del hotel ... si quede algo desercionado al compararlo con otro hilton.

title: Dismal needs serious updating and much better lighting
text:
This hotel is extremely dismal The lighting is very poor and the rooms are even more dismal dark blue wallpaper poor lighting looking out onto a factory type building.
Do not book a room here if you are depressed because you will end up feeling more depressed.On the plus side the hotel was spotlessly clean and the staff were superb nothing was too much trouble
Ufortunately the restaurant and rooftop bar were closed for refurbishment so I cannot  there are plenty of places to eat in the area. 
I did not like the area as I thought it was rather grubby but as usual New York was wonderful as were it's people.

title: Clean room, decent location, friendly staff
text: We were looking for a quick getaway to NYC for a few nights and this hotel fit the bill.  We arrived by train and the hotel wasn't far from Penn Station.  We arrived early and thought we would need them to hold our bags, but our room was ready early and we were able to check in.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The room was clean and the bed was comfortable.  The restaurant was not open (under construction) but we were aware of this when we booked the room, so it was not an issue.

title: First time in New York
text: Albergo anonimo di cui ho visto solo la camera e la hall. Sono presenti anche un'area fitness ed un ristorante che non ho visitato. Personale molto cortese e disponibile, anche se per lasciare in deposito le valigie prima di partire ci è stata richiesta una mancia. Camera adeguatamente pulita, con un buon servizio di internet. Purtroppo il sonno è stato disturbato dai rumori provenienti dall'impianto di riscaldamento di vecchia generazione a 30 cm dal letto.  Rapporto qualità/prezzo nella media. Scelto più per la localizzazione in vicinanza di un centro congressi in cui dovevamo recarci.

title: Dirty
text: When I checked into the hotel, I saw hair everywhere in the room! On the bed, on the pillow, in the bathroom. It's gross and the room looks so outdated. We checked in around 3am and my friends said it's okay. We will only be here for 3 nights. On the last night, I was complaining to my friends how I couldn't sleep cause I'm itchy every night. My friends said they are too! I just thought I had dry skin. There are bed bugs for sure! We stayed at a different hotel after and no more itch. Also, on the last night, the house keeper knocked on our knock at 8:30am!! I had to tell and said "NO cleaning!!!" I was pretty upset at this time. When I checked out, I complained and the lady gave me a look and said you should have said something. I told her " it's not like anything was going to happen." If this room is dirty, I can't imagine it'll be clean elsewhere. It's a 4 stars hotel, you should NOT wait for guests to complain how dirty the place is or if there are bed bugs. I will NEVER stay at a Hilton property again and would not recommend to anyone.

title: Good placement, fair service
text:
The hotel is placed right next to the Fashion Institute, next to several subway line. The room are fairly good furnished and comfortable.
Two issues:
The restaurant of the hotel is under restructuring but no one inform you about it unless at check in. The replacement is a modest grocery store (Sunac Fancy Food) which provides also warm food. Way to poor replacement solution for the standing of the hotel
We had an issue with the coffee machine and in the room there was no phone to call the assistance.

title: Awesome service
text: Although the restaurant and bar are under renovation, the front desk staff have been phenomenal check in was a breeze room is clean and nice. The 17th floor not much of a view (a water tower) but it's New York and who spends time in their hotel... wine and sweets at the front desk for Valentines day. Restaurant across the street was fabulous with great drinks. Marion was a fantastic help with my Valentunes Day presents that got shipped to the hotel. Would recommend. Need a mini fridge for my left overs though.

title:
Good location but really poor customer service. 
No Diamond benefits!!!
text:
Stayed for 2 nights here in January. The room was very clean and good size for New York. 
The location is quite good , 1 mile to Times Square and Maddison Square Garden is just 2 minutes walk. 

However if you are a Diamond member please avoid this hotel. I think they don’t even know what Diamond member means . No upgrade, no drink vouchers, there is no lounge and you get nothing at all as a Diamond member. Why being a diamond??? 

Aa their restaurant is closed they gave me breakfast voucher for 12,50 to use in a convenience shop / deli cafe. For 12,50 in new york you get a coffee and a bagel and thats it. Really poor. disappointed as they charge you much more for their breakfast (when the restaurant was open) than 12,50. 

One evening I called and asked for a dental kit and the girl at reception told me I have to come down to collect it as there is not enough staff. This is really bad when guests are paying a fair amount of money and also I am a diamond member . 

I will never ever use this hotel again. There are hotels around much cheaper that basically provide you the same experience or even better. Its a waste of money.

title: Accessibility
text: From the hotel you have easy access to many sights within New York. It is a couple of blocks from Times Square and the port authority, Nordstrom rack is also super close where you can buy discounted couture. The restaurant was closed for renovations, therefore cannot review but the rooms are spacious, for New York. Will recommend for cleanliness and accessibility to Times Square.

title: Did not get the full experience
text: Hotel is in good location, but a bit noisy if your room faces towards the street even if you are high up. Rooms are lovely and clean, but no fridge. No one to help with bags and small temporary entry built to the hotel like tent like (I assume for winter only to not let cold air in), but very difficult to get through with suitcase if noone helps you. No restaurant and bar was a dealbraker if you stay for business and for this reason I would not return. Check in staff friendly, but check out staff was half a sleep (I did check out 5am).

title: Noise all night long; sleeping not possible
text: While the hotel can't be faulted for its location in a very noisy part of town, the lack of effective soundproofing meant for a long and sleepless night filled with sirens, car horns, trucks backing up, construction equipment (even after midnight), loud car/motorcycle exhaust, garbage trucks, delivery trucks, and people yelling in the streets -- despite my room being on nearly the 20th floor.  These "city view" rooms also cost extra to book, and the rooms and hotel itself are rather worn and dated.  Rooms are also small and the hotel had relatively few amenities.  If all Manhattan hotels were this noisy, I'd give a higher rating, but I've stayed at plenty that, despite the street noise outside, have relatively quiet and comfortable rooms.  Apparently the rooms on the backside of the hotel are quieter (and sometimes cheaper), which would have been nice to know when booking, not when checking out.  The hotel itself isn't "bad," no one there was unkind, and it surely beats having no hotel at all, but this is not the standard I would expect from a Hilton (or any Hilton chain) hotel.

title: I had a great stay
text: The Hilton New York Fashion District was conveniently located, extremely tidy and staff was super nice. Would stay again when visiting NYC.  I stayed right across from elevator and it was not too noisy. Price was also very good for a New York hotel.

title: Hotel with no services
text: I came as an Honors club member and the restaurant was closed.  Chairs for the restaurant were being tossed in a dumpster outside...Never was picked  up......NO benefit to being an Honors Club Member.   .

title: Ok hotel for the money
text:
My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 days at the end of November and start of December and chose it due to the location. The plus side of the location was it’s proximity to many popular places including the Flatiron, The Empire State Building and Macy’s which were all around a 10 minute walk.  The downside of the location is that there’s not a great deal immediately outside the hotel or on the nearby streets other than fast food outlets.
We booked the hotel back in January 2019 as we got a good deal and the hotel website boasted a rooftop bar and on site restaurant. When we checked in we were told the rooftop bar was closed for refurbishment and that the restaurant went out of business 3 months ago. This meant there was nowhere on site to get food or drink which we were very disappointed by.  The reception desk gave us a sheet of food options to order in but we didn’t take up this option.
The room itself was a decent size but very basic and not what I’d expect from a Hilton.  Our view was onto other buildings so we couldn’t see outside properly. There was a bug on the bed and a bug catcher under the radiator which was a bit concerning!  However we never saw any other bugs so we chose not to make an issue out of this.  The bed itself was comfortable but the duvet didn’t have a proper cover, it was 2 sheets folded round the duvet itself, which became unfolded during the night which was really irritating, and not very pleasant seeing marks on the duvet.
The room was made up daily but sometimes quite late in the day. There were a couple of occasions where we returned to our room around 4pm for a rest before going out again and had to wait for the maid to finish the room. We had to ask for additional drinks one day where they hadn’t been replenished and our final day they had run out of bath towels and we only had hand towels. We always tipped the maid as we appreciate the busy job they have and the time pressures, however it was disappointing that we didn’t always have the items in our room that we should have had.
The reception team were all very helpful and stored our luggage on our last day when we checked out and arranged us a private cab back to the airport that afternoon.
On the whole the location of the hotel was handy, the price we paid was reasonable and the reception staff were courteous, we were just disappointed that the hotel room appeared more of a low budget hotel than we were expecting.  We were also unhappy at the lack of food options available at the hotel and felt that because this change had happened since we placed our booking over 10 months previously, we should have been advised prior to our stay either by Expedia or the hotel themselves.
We definitely plan to return to New York again in future however we will be paying more for a more upmarket hotel.

title: Unfriendly staff
text: From the moment I arrived to the moment I left the staff was both unfriendly and rude. You would assume Hilton has a strict hiring policy but the staff here show otherwise. Nothing but attitude and dismissal. Very disappointed

title: Don't get your hopes up
text: Stayed here as a Hilton Diamond member but did not get a room upgrade or any other meaningful perk beyond a few extra Hilton Honors points because they couldn't offer breakfast on site (the property is undergoing renovation, apparently on multiple floors at once).  The only saving grace is that at least prices are competitive for this part of town.  I would recommend this place if you get a rate that is competitive with similarly tiny rooms elsewhere in the area.

title: Restaurant under construction
text: Lovely spot in a great location. I stay here anytime I am in NYC. Great staff, and excellent restaurant when it's open. It's closed for the moment and "Room Service" menu from different restaurants is less than ideal.

title: Christmas in New York and a great place to stay
text: Great hotel love it . Always stay here when in New York and always love it . The staff helpful and friendly and the rooms nice and comfortable . If your in New York choose this hotel it’s situated in a good location very easy to get around . Great hotel .

title: Disappointing & Limited
text: This centrally located Upper Chelsea property is clean & fairly modern, BUT it’s not a true upscale Hilton Hotel. Staff isn’t welcoming. Rooms are small & bathrooms are tiny; had to turn sideways to shower! No restaurant, bar or even a coffee/snack bar in this facility; fitness room is a joke. Beware of the dispensing minibar; touch something & you’re automatically charged, with no refunds! Only ice machine is down in the lobby & it’s NOT self-serve. Safe is on the floor in dark “broom-style” closet; ironing board has to come out to hang anything. Hear EVERY sound in narrow hallways. This place should be marketed as a Garden Inn (motel variety), really dilutes the Hilton brand:

title: Noise, construction, dismissive staff
text:
I had wondered why this Hilton in Chelsea had reduced rates. Thought it may be the post-NYE low season or something. Was really stunned by how dismissive the staff was. 

The beds and room sizes were good, as you would expect from a Hilton. But the walls were paper thin and there was construction outside on the street the entire night. The hotel had NO services whatsoever because it was undergoing renovation, so you’d think the staff would be a little more courteous to keep people’s spirits up so we can ALL manage our expectations. But they refused to tell me where I could even fill my reusable water bottle while I waited for my room to be ready. 

“Is there a faucet anywhere?”
“No.”
“What about the gym? Can I use the cooler?” 
“No.” 

I walked away because honestly I hate confrontation, and it felt like this person just wanted to be petty over one thing or another. 

When I got my room and they swiped my credit card, they told me there’s “nothing to charge to it because all facilities are shut down,” but then refused to tell me what the deposit was for. My reservation was prepaid. 

Look, I get it. It’s crazytown in New York City and I’m sure the staff deal with a ton of stressful situations and rude tourists. But cut the rest of us some slack. It’s not our fault.

title: Great time...decent hotel
text: The hotel was nice and a good price point. Had a few small issues but overall it was in a good spot and had a great view.  No mini fridge though and the mini bar was almost empty with no price and no bar on the premises. But a nice staff that do they're best to help

title: Trip new york
text: Al zo dikwijls in New York geweest en dit mail was het iets budget vriendelijker. Ben toevallig op Hilton Fashion District gekomen en uitermate tevreden van de kamers. Voor New York normen waren deze heel ruim. Bed was ook fantastisch. Behulpzaam aan receptie en locatie zeer goed.

title: Första hotellet att rekommendera i NYC
text: Det första hotell som jag kan rekommendera i NYC. Städningen var dock inte så bra. Hittade strumpor under nattduksbord, som var täckta av damm. Mycket dammigt över lag i ventilation, hörn och så vidare. Ytliga städningen var okej, så länge man inte kom åt dammiga ytor.

title: Christmas disaster
text:
Christmas day disappointment,  restaurant   was closed, rooftop closed. Heater not working. Had it fix at 1am. I booked third party was I wasn't aware that everything was out of service. I would stay elsewhere.  Finding a decent meal on Christmas day wasnt easy. To top it off the front desk was not helpful instead they were rude. Especially since there website apparently stated both restaurant nd rooftop were closed. I was not aware 
 I will never stay again.

title: Great stay after Christmas
text: We stayed here after the holidays, the location was great. Plenty of good food and bars near by, right in the middle of the city. We were located next to the 1 subway so travel around the city was made easy. Highly recommend a stay here.

title: Convenient
text:
This was a convenient hotel for a fourth of July cruise.It is within walking distance of Pier 62 at Hudson River Park. Though I recommend not taking a cruise from there, no amenities while waiting and in a heavy traffic area. Chelsea Pier cruises are preferable.

The hotel! Stylish, as advertised, sorry I didn't have time to check out the roof top bar. Rooms are small, as expected in NYC. I stay alone, so not an issue. A bit tight for two. Coffee maker, mini-bar, safe. The mini bar contents, are not inviting and you are advised if you "pull flap" you will be charged, therefore, you can't use the fridge. There is a safe, but it's up on a top shelf of a closet, in the dark, so you can't read the instructions. Note to management: Post instructions in a visible place. I would stay there again if I was in that area.

title: Not Satisfactory Stay
text: This was a birthday gift to my 15 year old daughter. She always wanted to see NYC. The room location was horrible the beds was uncomfortable and if I was given any notice of the renovations I would’ve picked a different location. The room was extremely hot because I was told NYC hotels don’t have AC during winter. A bit rediculous because it had cool on the thermostat in the room but oh well. Was given a shower and not a tub it was hard to shower a 2 year old. Just not satisfied with our 7 day’s stay.

title: No está a la altura de la cadena Hilton
text:
Personal extremadamente antipático, hemos hablado con varias personas de recepción durante nuestra estancia y a cuál más desagradable.
Habitación amplia para tratarse de Nueva York, pero muy mal insonorizada, se escuchaba todo de las otras habitaciones y pasillo. Baño limpio y correcto (no se ofrecen muchos detalles, sólo dos pastillas de jabón y poco más)
Te hacen un bloqueo de seguridad en la targeta de 50$/día (todavía no se me ha devuelto)
En general, buscaría otra opción. No volveremos ni lo aconsejaremos.

title: Mattress worn out
text: I have stayed at this hotel the last few years and it used to be great.  It is showing its wear and the mattress is completely worn out and needs to be replaced. Woke up with the worst back pain of my life. Was offered no fix and was told that there was nothing wrong with the mattress.  Asked to swap it with another room even but again they stated engineering says there is nothing wrong with it. When the springs squeak and sag and the mattress bottoms out when you lay on it how is it not worn out. This property is showing its age and no longer worth staying in.

title: Rapporto qualità prezzo eccezionale
text:
A 150 metri dal Madison Square Garden e con parecchie fermate della metro vicine.

Stanze pulite e ben tenute ideali per un soggiorno di coppia anche se un po’ piccole e con un unico difetto: poco spazio negli armadi (vi sono però cassettiere molto ampie).

Nel complesso la sistemazione ideale per chi, come me, usa l’hotel solo per fare la doccia e dormire.

title: Convenient & quiet
text: Easy location near subway but quiet facility to get away from the busy streets. Great value for the price. Can’t wait to return when the rooftop is renovated. We did not take advantage of other amenities as we only stayed one night.

title: Items forgotten will never be returned
text: I forgot a pair of Chanel sunglasses in the room. I called the hotel 1 hour after i checked out and 2-3 times per day. for the last 3 days. I’m still waiting for housekeeping or management  to call me back. Each day is an excuse. Guests beware - if you forget something in the room the staff will ignore your calls and keep your forgotten belongings.

title: Not worth the price
text: Expensive, no complimentary breakfast, closed rooftop, dirty room and rushed service. Not worth paying hundreds to stay a night. The surrounding location isn’t so great...a lot of used condoms on the streets :\

title: Comfortable, clean room
text:
Room was comfortable and clean, hotel was nice and quiet. There's a daily room deposit fee of $50, which isn't stated in the email, though you do get it back once you check out. 

They have room service, and they also allow food delivery to come to your door, which is convenient.

title: 安いから妥協できるサービス
text:
立地と設備の割には安いのでいつも利用していますが年々サービスが落ちてくる。金額が安いからなのか？？
今回は12月のクリスマス前の利用なのに数ヶ月前にすごくディスカウントがあったのでよかった。5,6回は利用しているがいつもニューヨークではここを使う。立地がよい。

title: good value and location
text: Spent one night during the Christmas season. Easy walk from Penn Station, and not that far from the theater district. Staff was very friendly, and we never had to wait in a line at the check in/out counter.   Check in/out was quick and easy.  The room was bigger than comparable hotels in NYC.  I chose a city view room on the 18th floor and had a great view of the Empire State Building.  Wifi worked well.  Room was very clean and modern.

title: Dirty, dirty Room
text: Good location good front desk but poor housekeeping - No vacuums floor, dust, hairs on the shelf and hair dryer. Lack of coffee creamers and cups in the room, not enough towels. anyway DIRTY ROOM. Sad

title: Over priced stay for the room
text: Extremely small rooms and very pricey! Diamond members are not welcomed properly. I stay many nights a year at Hiltons hotels and this has been the worse specially for $500 a night stay. I personally will never stay here again

title: AVerage experience
text: I was a little disappointed with a number of things during my stay as i have listed in the survey. hopfully i can get some bonus points to reconsider staying here agian during one of my numerous work travels.

title: Cleanliness and Service Needs To Be Addressed
text:
Room was not properly cleaned as we found used lotion under the bed, a toenail on the carpet, snot on the blinds, a used ear plug on the floor and 75% of products in the fridge to purchase were out. We let the front desk know and it was basically laughed off and didn’t feel like it was a big deal. The Asst Front Desk Manager tried to make excuses around the conditions. You don’t do that in the hotel/hospitality industry. You accept the mistake/challenge and use it as an opportunity to grow and correct the issue and create the outcome for the guest to have a reason to believe why they should be spending money at the property. They gave two vouchers for breakfast and 2k in points and a refresh of the room. Unfortunately, the room was never refreshed the next day and never was offered a different room. Will not be staying at this hotel again.

I emailed pictures the Asst Front Desk Manager for follow up. She copied 5 different individuals on the reply. No one else reached out and no additional follow up or phone call was made to make sure everything was ok. Part of the definition of hospitality is hospitable treatment of a guest. This was not felt.

I hope this provides a learning opportunity for Hilton and this property.

title: Excellent Location, good service.
text: Hotel is situated in an good location. The staff were all very accommodating despite the fact the hotel's online system was done when arrived. The room was missing a television remote but this was quickly fixed with a quick call to have someone send it up.

title: Fine property, but I am not sure what makes this a Hilton
text: In NYC, I've stayed at the Hilton Midtown, Hilton Times Square, Hilton by the United Nations, and I've visited the Hilton Millenium Downtown. Each property has its own special feel. There is something that makes the hotel unique. The Hilton Times Square offers turndown service, but no executive lounge. The Hiton midtown has a lounge. The Hilton Fashion District is just a hotel. It could easily be a Doubletree, as it feels just like the one up a few blocks off of 6th ave. The staff is awesome at the Hilton FD, but there arent even ice machines on the floors, any of them. When I inquired I was told to go to the front desk to get ice. The rooms are small, especially in comparison to midtown and times square Hiltons, and the elevators work really, really, hard to keep up with the traffic. The gym is undersized, what you would expect at a Hampton Inn. 2 treadmills, a bike, and an elliptical. The cardio machines only have 2 television channels. Back in the rooms, guests are treated to comfy beds, which is what really matters, but cheap toilet paper and tissues. I end this asking, what makes this a Hilton? It seems to have a presence for the brand in Chelsea to me, and that's all.

title: 良いのは立地のみ
text:
廊下からドアの開け閉めの音がパンパン聴こえてくる。道路の工事とクラクションも窓から筒抜け。水も置いてなくて、ミニバーをみたら在庫は空っぽ。
ここまでは、まあ許せても、暖房が効かずに冷たい風しか出てこない。極め付けは、シャワーが水。(翌朝にはエアキンとシャワーは修理されたようだけど、すでに帰国日)。12月の外気温3度には辛すぎる。
近くにスーパーがたくさんあるのはありがたい。
買出しして一息ついて、ふと思ったのは、発展途上国のゲストハウスみたいだなぁ。

title: Not the greatest hotel, a bit tired.
text: I stayed in this hotel after being booked it through work. It is very centrally located in Manhattan which meant that access to attractions and my work was good. The hotel however was a bit old and tired and could do with a refurb. The restaurant is being refurbished so that means no breakfast in the morning! Also soundproofing is poor, I was on the 9th floor and the traffic noise was bad (I lived in central London for 16 years so I am used to traffic noise, but this was something else). Beds were comfy though and wifi was fast. I probably wouldn't go back if I had a choice, unfortunately.

title: Doubletree disguised as an Hilton
text: Hotel with a good location in the middle of Nomad , however do not expect Hilton quality Closet and drawers were minimal specifically considering the room was equipped with two queen beds. Toiletries are exactly the ones you may find in a Doubletree Hotel

title: Go somewhere else
text: Had issues with this hotel a year or so ago. Figured I give it a second chance since it’s convenient to my customer. Won’t go back. No restaurant and no bar due to construction but the room nights were still $500. No notification till I checked in. Breakfast offer was to go up the block! Ridiculous! Room was noisy small and bathroom was worse! As a diamond member really disappointed.

title: Disappointing customer service
text: I called to cancel a reservation and was given the run-around for three days by hotel employees.  When I was finally put in touch with the manager, Jackie, she screamed at me and slammed the phone down without even allowing me to respond.  I was shocked and taken aback.  I have 400k Hilton Honors points from staying at Hilton properties and have never been treated this way, anywhere around the world.  I see that the hotel has tried to justify its poor service in response to some of the other negative reviews.  Sadly, there is no policy that excuses treating paying customers like garbage.  I will be staying at the Conrad and look forward to enjoying their excellent standards.

title: Great location
text: Visited with family and had two rooms close by on 21st floor, good view and rooms clean and spacious by New York standards. Reception staff welcoming and helpful. Location is great, easy walk to Chelsea Market, Macy's, 5th Avenue and most sights. Two negatives to our visit, rooftop bar and restaurant closed during our stay which was disappointing and airport taxi booked by hotel did not arrived in promised timescale, proved stressful end to visit, concierge not particularly helpful in resolving this just suggested we got an uber!

title: Completely wverage
text:
Stayed here in November 2019 for 5 nights with family.

The location is very good - close to many attractions and the 28 Street subway station to connect you to the rest of the city. The area is kind of run down though, although the hotel have no control over this.

The rooms are very very tired and in need of a refresh. The furniture is not particularly well kept and has obviously not been changed for a number of years. The cleaning service was terrible - our room was serviced just once during a 5 day trip. We were left without clean towels, toilet paper and toiletries were not replaced and trash was not removed from the room for the duration of our stay. 

The reception staff were however very nice - checking in and out was simple and efficient. The hotel also provided a car service to JFK for $73 fully inclusive. 

Overall, it was adequate but very expensive for the service and facilities that are provided. There are many better properties to spend your cash at in Manhattan and I would definitely not recommend for family groups.

title: Hilton "NO" Honor
text: I booked a hotel room at the Hilton New York Fashion District today thinking it was for the 11th to the 12th of December.  Through some error it was registered for tonight (Dec. 3rd).   When I called the hotel and spoke with the manager, Jackie, she refused to cancel the booking!  I am currently in Los Angeles and it is impossible for me to stay there tonight. This was an honest mistake and I am very surprised Hilton would treat their Honors members and the general population this way!  I am not sure that one night for $144 is worth Hilton losing a customer that stays 50-70 nights per year in hotels

title: You will be charged twice and they will damage your car
text:
I checked into thie hotel, gave my car to the hotel to be parked and it was a great experience.  The night was good and I checked out early am.
