As I checked my receipt I was charged $60 for parking yet I had a rate which included parking (I made a reservation with an agent who confirmed that the $129 rate included parking at 1/2 off with regular rate being $106). The hotel refused to refund that and told me to call Hilton corporate.  After getting into the car and getting out to get coffee down the block I noticed the car was hit while in the possession of Hilton, I emailed pictures to the hotel and contacted the corporate for these issues and no one was very forthcoming with resoilution.  I was told to contact garage. Seriously? I was charged by Hilton and gave my car to Hilton yet I have to speaek with someone else? 2 days later I am told I should have contacted police, garage, etc.  And here I was thinking that Hilton and this property are professionals and will try to help the customer who was trying to get home before the snow sotrm.  Guess not.  So go somewhere else if you do not want to be charged twice and get your property damaged.  Sad that if the Diamond customer is treated like this what happens to others?

P.S. I was asked if I wanted breakfast or 2000 points and I chose points.  Yet to see them.....

title: Great location
text: Visited the Hilton hotel on 26th Street in mid-November. It was a central location, in the middle between good restaurants to the south and theatre to the north. The staff was very friendly. Maririan, at the front desk, was exceptionally nice and courteous. The hotel elevators are extremely fast. My room was on the 15th floor and it never took more that 12 seconds (I actually counted) to get from the lobby to my room, so that was a nice bonus. The hotel itself was okay. It was rated 4 stars. But it was a little tired looking and the rooms (at least mine) was a little dated. The hotel is more of a 3 or 3.5 stars than 4. On a positive note, my room was quite spacious (by New YORK City standards).

title: Short stay in NYC
text: Definitely a very good place to stay.  Staff at check-in, front desk, and room maid service all very friendly and happy to answer requests.  I didn't have many.  Very clean rooms.  Also my room facing back was very quiet.

title: Missed Opportunities
text: Once again, Hilton missed the chance to make good on the lack of beverage and food services. My suggestion would have been to have a delivery option. I'm hung up on this, since I keep mentioning it. Bottom line, this was a rip off. Sorry, but that's how I feel.

title: Good location, close enough to action
text: This Hilton is in close proximity to the action but far enough away that you have peace and quiet.  Small, clean rooms, Comfortable beds and pillows. Roof top bar and hotel restaurant were under construction.

title: Used on the floor! Horrible customer service
text:
On November 10, 2019 my husband and I checked into the Hilton NY Fashion District. We found a used condom and a grape on the floor. This was deeply disgusting and disturbing. Once we saw the used condom and grape . We packed up  and went to the lobby to report this and to request a refund. 

The Director of Front Office refused to refund the money. She said that we would have to contact Priceline to have them approve a refund. When we called Priceline, they said she denied the refund. We called her back she said they were conducting  an investigation and that she did not say that Priceline had to authorize the refund. Hilton complaints said they would follow up as the Director has not been honest about the protocol. Hilton never followed up, and when I called back they denied the claim. 
No refund or voucher offered, instead we were offered dishonesty. The agent on the last call hung up.

The irony is that Hilton vacations has no problem incessantly calling me. Deeply disappointed by the brand and hotel.

title: Right in iconic Manhattan
text: This hotel is just a short walk from the most iconic part of Manhattan, Madison Square Park.  From there you can see the Flatiron Building, Empire State Building, Met Life Tower and New York Life Insurance buildings.  There are also plenty of great restaurants.  The hotel staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful.

title: New York Business Trip
text: Great location!  Great staff!  Very clean.  Need drink and vending machines on premises.  Breakfast would have been nice.  Staff very helpful.  Room was very clean.  Lobby was great.  Check in and check out was very easy.

title: Frown is not a nice way to greet  guests even in nyc
text: Rude front desk if you like being mistreated from the minute you walk in this is your lady. Not a hello, not a smile, a perfunctory you have two free bottles of water.  It wasn’t busy it wasn’t late why not great guests. The rooms are small and the district is pretty dirty

title: Good value right now
text: The (really fun) roof bar and restaurant are closed for renovations, and they have dropped the room prices accordingly, making this an absolute bargain for NYC in holiday season. Really. We got a king bed, high floor, city view for $215 (just under $255 with all the various taxes). There's me, long time metro resident and "bridge and tunnel" gal the last 40 years, snapping pix of the Empire State Building from our room! We really enjoyed the old rooftop bar; looking forward to the improvements. But right now it's a great opportunity if you're looking for a place in Midtown. Ten minutes walk to Penn Station and less to the 23rd St. PATH station. Also check out Crompton's across the street.

title: Correcto
text:
Hotel muy bien situado a escasos metro de la 7° con la 26. Así que muchas zonas de Manhattan están accesibles paseando.
La ubicación muy buena.

Habitación y baño espaciosos, para lo que se estila en NY, con aspecto un poco más viejo y gastado de lo que se ve en las fotos.
Buena calefacción y cafetera de cortesía.
No me gustó que tenía un armario de apenas sa s 50 cm de ancho. Demasiado pequeño.
Bien para estar unos días en NY, y como la mayoría bien situados, caro. Es lo que hay.

title: Security risk at this hotel
text:
I am staying at this hotel now and this morning at 8 am someone opened the door to our room - while we were in bed. 
Who had the key to our room and how did this happen? We reported the incident to security. But there is definitely a security breach here. Is there someone running around with a master key, hoping to find an empty room at breakfast time ? Scary possibility. Let’s see if security even bothers to get back to us. In the meantime, beware

title: Worn and tired undergoing construction
text: I was surprised on check in to find the restaurant and rooftop lounge under consrtuction. I chose this facility since it was supposed to be a full service hotel. There was nothing online or in any communication that advised me of the renovations. The hotel is very tried and worn in the Lobby, Hallways and rooms. However, the staff (Front desk, Sid especially) was friendly and very helpful. They are the only reason I did not change hotels.

title: Overall good experience
text:
This is a great location, close to subway to travel to all of the different areas. Walking distance for a lot as well. The staff is excellent and friendly, one of them even went out of her way to go outside and help me get my car parked! There is a sweet restaurant/bar right across the street I recommend to unwind at the end of the day. The restaurants inside the hotel were all being renovated so I cannot comment on that. We ordered room service from the local place they use and it was really good and quick. One of our items was wrong and they just credited our bill - no quest asked! 
The room was small and faced the alleyway..but it was comfortable. Not a luxury Hilton but clean. We weren't there much anyway. The only thing that I really was disappointed in was the parking. They have self parking and valet but there is no signage when you get there so you pull up in front of the building and have no idea where you are supposed to go? The streets are crowded so its very nerve wrecking...If you arrive, you can pull directly in by the door to check in and from there you will be told where to park or get valet. prices are about 45-60.00 and you pay a fee to take it out and in again. You should prob avoid this. Weekend street parking is free but if you don't move your car before 7 am Monday it WILL have a ticket for 115.00! I have the ticket. So I feel that the parking is the biggest issue here, the stay was comfortable and clean.

title: The little things matter
text:
Spent two nights - total cost was $670 with parking, so price was OK. Location isn’t bad - near several subway lines. Staff is nice. Clean.
Rooftop restaurant and bar is closed. Get that, but at least put up a vat of coffee in the lobby in the interim. Room had minibar stocked with a can of coke, nuts and KitKats. Either stock in properly or remove it. Carpet in room seemed new, but it wasn’t laid right. Bed was not great.
Hotel could be much better with fairly minor fixes and attention to detail.

title: Average for NYC Hiltons
text: The hotel was clean but tired. Management notified me in advance that the restaurant and bar are shut down for renovation. The front desk staff was helpful and polite (impressively polite for NYC.) My room was missing part of the towel supply on day one, and the bathroom sink drained very slowly. While acceptable for a short business stay, you may want to look at alternate Hiltons or Doubletrees in NYC, at least until the restaurant reopens.

title: Perfect location for New York
text: The mattress was very comfortable and the room was spacious for New York.  Very nice and clean bathroom with great desktop work area.  In room coffee, ironing board and large mirrors.  The room is nicely lit.

title: Disappointing Hotel in the Fashion District
text: The hotel's on-site restaurant was closed for renovation.  The rooftop bar/lounge was closed for renovation.  The only restroom facility was a single-occupant facility located at the front desk which the employees posted an "out of service" sign on the door half of each day.  The mattresses are hard and need to be replaced, and the bed pillows are extremely uncomfortable.  DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!

title: Very good option
text:
Stayed one night for a concert at MSG. This property is in a great location. Walkable to a lot of sights such as Central Park, Times Square, Empire State Building, Broadway, etc. Front desk staff was incredibly friendly and apologetic for not having an upgrade due to my Hilton status. The restaurant and bar on property are both closed indefinitely at the moment, however, there are endless options close by. 

I had a standard queen room. Some might find the room size small, but I found it typical for a Manhattan hotel. It was well laid out, spotlessly clean, and it’s purpose very well. Being NYC you will hear street noise but I didn’t find it to be a problem and slept very well. 

I won’t hesitate to book this property again. I enjoyed my stay very much.

title: Stay here. Great location for price
text: I suggest that anyone stays here. It's a great place for the location. In addition,  the price is also was great. I would always go again. Anytime I go to NYC I'll always think of this location.  Next time I need to try the fitness center and other services they offe .

title: Good hotel midtown
text: Nice midtown location near subway. Restaurant was closed for maintenance but there are many options to eat nearby. Staff very friendly. Room size was good (for NY) and very clean. I would stay here again.

title: Close to perfection!
text:
This was our fifth year in a row to NYC and the best hotel yet.  There is a great rooftop bar with a laid back beachy vibe (it works in the city weirdly).  There's also a great bar across the road, Crompton Ale House which does tasty food (mahi mahi fish tacos) and a nice signature cocktail.  
I asked for a quiet room when making our reservation.  When given our room on the 3rd floor, I was concerned about traffic noise but we were at the back of the hotel and it was the quietest hotel I have stayed in New York!  There was no view but you can't have it all.  Will stay here again.

title: Very nice hotel
text: We were only in town for one night for a Billy Joel concert at Madison Square Garden and this hotel checked all the boxes for us. Great location and easy walk to MSG. I had limited interaction with the staff but they all seemed pleasant. The room was fine. It’s NYC so everything is a little cramped. We would definitely stay here again.

title: One Night Stay
text: Enjoyed my stay, staf  was friendly and helpful. I just wished their were microwaves and refrigerators(that you can place your own beverages in). Their is a refrigerator with prefilled beverages that you can use at a cost. Overall it was a quick pleasant stay!! I would stay again!!

title: Never a bad experience
text: Clean friendly over the top staff. This hotel continues to excel be it their customer service cleanliness of their rooms. I love staying here! The staff can never do enough. I can’t wait for their remodel to be completed for the restaurant and bar.

title: Nice hotel
text: We enjoyed our stay here. The hotel room was very nice and roomy and had a nice bathroom, although, the shower door was weird with the way it opened. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. My only concern is that it wasn't in the nicest of areas. My friend and I felt a little 'unsure' about walking back to the hotel late at night by ourself once we were out of Midtown so we took a cab every night back to the hotel which adds up! But, I really did like the hotel itself.

title: Tired and Expensive
text: This hotel needs renovation. Very expensive for the quality provided. Room lighting was very bright white. The temperature of the lighting needs adjusted down. Room is tired and fixtures in the room were broken. Location is good.

title: Rooms way too small
text: The hotel is dating. A lot of the furniture is damaged and the hotel generally shows its age. The rooms are some of the smallest I have seen - even in NyC. The size can be okay for a solo traveller but any more and it gets problematic. Had to walk to front desk to get ice, no ice machines and no room delivery. Not the end of the world but definitely not the expected level of service.

title: Très bon emplacement
text:
L'hotel est très bien situé dans Manhattan et proche du métro. 
Les chambres sont confortables et propres. Très bon rapport qualité/prix.
Le plus : le rooftop avec une magnifique vue sur l'Empire State Building

title: New York City Weekend in the Fashion District
text: From the moment we arrived at the Hilton located in the New York City Fashion District, we were impressed with the level of customer service.  When checking in, we had to stand in line longer than the desk clerk thought was reasonable, so the first thing she did when we got to the front of the line was give us four coupons for two free drinks each.  The rooms were a bit small, but that is typical in New York City.  The rooms were quiet, the beds were very comfortable and there was a large flat screen TV in the room for us to watch our favorite college football play on Saturday afternoon.  We only ate breakfast in the restaurant, but breakfast was excellent.  A buffet was available or we could order off the menu.  The hotel begins serving breakfast at 7:30 AM on Sunday mornings.  There were ... I believe four elevators, so we didn't have to wait for an elevator very long at all.  The street in front of the hotel was relatively quiet and there was a bar and three reasonably priced restaurants across the street.  One of them was a sandwich shop.

title: Garbage Customer Service - Would not recommend
text:
I was originally going to give this a 2 star but I am actually going to give it 1 star considering how the front-desk person who checked me out was rude and did not care and did not care when I had issues during my my time here.

Most of the front-desk people don't care except for the first I talked to when I checked in and she was helpful and willing to give me high-speed wifi. I had issues throughout my entire stay.

The first thing that happened is my room's door could not close all the way and I had to put in a lot of extra work just to close it. I called the front-desk to fix it and to move me to a new room because I did not want to deal with it.

When I changed my rooms I could not use the digital key in the Honors App. I tried calling and asking the front-desk for help and they kept saying they were trying but they clearly weren't and did not care one bit especially the front-desk manager who was rude to me when I checked out. That same manager then told me to call the Honors IT Support and when I did they couldn't help me because only employees can call the number and ask for help. They never were able to fix it at any point when I was there. The front-desk person who was useless also never apologized for her garbage actions and was arrogant and kept saying she was the highest up when she clearly wasn't.

As for the room, it's quite small. You don't get a couch chair like you do in other hotels. You only get some super tiny ottoman. The bathrooms are pretty good especially the water pressure. But it's overall a tiny room that doesn't have much. You won't like it if you spend a lot of time in your room. It's doable and adequate if you are out all day and night.

The sad thing is that this isn't even the worst hotel in NY but nonetheless this is vastly below Hilton average/standards. I would not recommend this hotel due to their terrible customer service and not to mention you can't cancel your booking for this hotel after a day as they want your money as soon as possible.

title: Very nice!  Large rooms!
text: Just got home from here on October 1st.  I would most definitely recommend this hotel. The rooms are large by New York standards... and VERY clean.  One of the most exciting things was having HOT water and great water pressure!  HA!!  The bed was comfortable and the a/c worked well.  We had a group of 4 couples and requested rooms near each other - they gladly accommodated us.  The elevators worked great, no long waits at all.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  The location is near the 1 line and the F - so we had no issues getting around. They have luggage storage and also an airport shuttle.  This was a great stay and very reasonable (by NY standards!)

title: NOT TELLING GUESTS THAT THERE ARE NO FACILITIES/RESTAURANTS FOR THANKSGIVING
text:
So disappointed that we had booked to visit New York over Thanksgiving and The Hilton has not mentioned that they were having a full refurbishment during our stay meaning there are no eating/drinking facilities for the duration of our stay!!! Certainly no roof top bar or restaurants to enjoy - as their website is still advertising......
Very rude response and very much a don't care attitude that we are a large group.
Have stayed at Hilton Hotels in the UK in the past, we have never received such poor customer service as we have with this hotel manager.
Appalling "standard" response from the Hilton regarding this!!!!

title: **** BEWARE BEFORE BOOKING ***** NO rooftop garden or restaurant facilities during 27 November/2 December
text:
Those considering booking here should know in advance of no rooftop bar and restaurant from 27 November -2 December.
I had booked via Expedia (who were BRILLIANT) for my 50th Birthday for 19 people.  

A few emails were sent and I eventually ended up being emailed by the most rude hotel manager, who said if we weren’t happy with the facilities to look elsewhere. As a gesture of “goodwill” he would waive the cancellation penalty for the 19 of us.
The holiday was paid in full in January 2019. No-one had contacted us to say  there would be no facilities for breakfast, dinner, eating or drinking.

I am the organiser of 19 family and friends over thanksgiving.
The Hilton were rude, unsympathetic, gave me inaccurate information and basically couldn’t care less. Their attitude - if you don’t like it go elsewhere.
Expedia  informed me that I had the right to cancel my Hilton booking up until 24 November at NO EXTRA Charge. The Hilton manager was disingenuous in offering us a goodwill gesture of waiving the cancellation fee.

I feel that travellers should be aware of the lack of facilities available at the hotel, I took a screenshot of their website this afternoon, still promoting the RARE rooftop bar and terrace.
I have all of the emails, screenshots and evidence of my experience and If the facilities at the hotel are an important part of your stay, I would strongly recommend checking the situation with hopefully a far more professional and sympathetic member of the Hilton team.

title: This is the cleanest hotel and great location
text: The hotel is very, very clean and the staff in all departments is so nice they are all so helpful, I actually look forward to seeing them each day that is how nice they are.  The hotel is close to everything you would possibly need.

title: Extremely well located- nice breakfast place below- nice, experienced staff
text: This was walking distance from my meetings- so right there is enough to get at least three stars. Then there was the easy breakfast place below, ( with nice staff) pleasant bell station to hold my bags the day I was leaving, a town car to take me to the airport that was not more expensive than Uber, and decent sized  rooms in a city where you could find yourself in a closet. No big extras ( wine at five , that sort of thing) but easy and free wifi- and a noon check out. I think as mid range hotels go, this one is a good deal.

title: Great location, horrific service, park bench for a mattress.
text: Location was exactly what we had hoped for. However, this hotel does not come close to living up tot he Hilton brand. While clean and well appointed, careful which room you choose. we ended up in a shoe box. The mattress was awful, like sleeping on a park bench. The worst part was we had asked for ice several times upon our arrival to chill champagne for our anniversary. We never got it. We called 3 or 4 times. We ended up going out to dinner without our pre-planned toast. I would not stay at this hotel again.

title: Great Hotel/Staff/Location!
text: This hotel is one of the best locations in NYC, you are in the heart of Chelsea, walking distance to Flatiron, subways, restaurants, bars, coffee shops! My friends and family stayed here for my wedding weekend and we were all so impressed! The staff is so warm and helpful. Cannot recommend this hotel enough!

title: Nice stay!
text: Had to fly to NY for a business event, and stayed at the Hilton NY Fashion District...good call by my travel department.  Wonderful staff and amenities, and the convenience of having a restaurant on site was an extra plus.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: Everything from check in to check out was brilliant with this hotel. The trip was for my mum’s birthday and the hotel left a lovely handmade card and cake in her room which was very nice of them. My room was on the 22nd floor with some great city views. The rooftop bar had some great views across to the Empire State Building. Breakfast in the morning was fantastic and the staff in the restaurant were great. In fact, all staff we came across were great. The hotel is in a great location and really not a far walk from some of the main tourist attractions. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone for a stay in New York!

title: Convenient and friendly
text: This hotel in Chelsea is a great location.  Lots of restaurants, Whole Foods, Trader Joes, and Fairway.  The staff is friendly and helpful. I would suggest you don't do the "free breakfast" which is a $20 per person credit, however, their buffet is $22 and not great, but after taxes and tip, we paid $15 for free breakfast.  The other days we went elsewhere for less. The rooms are small but it's NYC, but very clean.  The hotel temperature is way too cool for me and the thermostat is cranky.

title: Very rude customer service. Stayed twice. Didnt have my check out invoice. No emails inspite of calling many times.
text:
They didnt have my invoice ready on both the stays. I called them 3 times, they said they will email it, but never emailed them to-date. And they hang up rudely in the middle of the conversation.

They then transfer you to 1-800 hilton phone number and send you on a wild goose chase.

title: Good hotel and location
text:
We had an enjoyable 5 night stay at this hotel. The rooms are a bit on the small size but very comfortable and clean. Good in room amenities include large TV, coffee/tea maker, bar, iron, safe, hair dryer, toiletries, broadband WiFi, etc.
The hotel also has a small gym in the basement and a splendid roof top terrace.
The bed was comfortable. There was a bit of noise at night due to squeaky/clunky doors but very little street noise.
Location is very good, around 20 mins stroll to Times Square. Plenty of eating places nearby.

title: Style Comes First
text:
I guess as to be expected for the fashion district, the hotel was very stylish and swank, with a modern design and rooftop bar. The front desk staff were all nice and pleasant, and it was super easy to check-in and check-out online, right down to picking a room. It all feels extremely 21st century and I like that the elevator could not be accessed without a room key for extra security. 

In terms of functionality though, the room was pretty small and felt cramped. We had a city view which I personally liked, and housekeeping was excellent, with the housekeepers always complying with our requests to come back at a certain time right down to the minute. But still the room, bed, and bathroom were all smaller than expected. It was very quiet though - didn't hear any noise from the rooftop bar or the city once inside. And the bed was comfortable as well. 

It wouldn't be my first choice for staying again, just because overall I would prefer something a bit more spacious than swanky. But it was a good stay!

title: Basic Hotel not a 4 star
text:
Location - 26th street 7th Ave. Perfect for Metro access and walk to 5th ave shops or long walk up 25 blocks to Time square. Whatever the preference is. 

Staff - Friendly and approachable

Room - Disappointing. Room on 20th floor full of dust. I wiped my finger across tops of drawers and bedside table full of dust. Under the bed never vacumed. The TV remote control perfect example of how dirty the room was. Sticky and dirt stuck in the keys. Bedsheets ink stains. 

Was quite upset for the price i could have stayed somewhere not a Hilton for better quality but being Diamond i always stayed in Hilton. 
Cleaning service - didnt change loo roll when empty..no shower mat..just little touches were missing. 

Overall not value for money. 

Would not stay in a Hilton NYC again.

title: 14 dias de excelente hospedagem
text:
Viajar para Nova York sempre foi um sonho. Então, tivemos um cuidado muito grande ao escolher a localização e o hotel onde eu e minha esposa iríamos ficar durante 14 dias. A escolha deste Hilton em Chelsea não podia ser melhor. A localização é sensacional. Ficamos a poucas quadras de duas linhas do metrô que nos levava para todos os lados de Nova York. De Coney Island ao Harlem, do Central Park ao One Trade Center. 
O quarto do hotel é muito confortável e aconchegante. Ficamos no 16º andar, com uma vista para o topo do Empire State. A cama é muito gostosa, a ducha é perfeita e o banheiro é bem espaçoso. A limpeza também foi impecável durante os 14 dias. Como o frigobar do hotel é daqueles que não é possível colocar nada porque tudo o que você tocar será cobrado, pedimos um pequeno refrigerador no nosso quarto e fomos atendidos prontamente – sem nenhuma taxa extra. Aliás, a equipe do hotel atendeu todos os nossos pedidos: quarto em andar alto, o já citado refrigerador, early check-in e late check-out. E, vale frisar: eu tive a sorte de encontrar uma oferta especial no Booking, o que certamente melhorou bastante (e viabilizou) o custo benefício deste hotel. 

O único porém (que poderia ser melhorado) é a iluminação do quarto que é muito escuro (mesmo com as luzes acesas), mas isso é um pequeno detalhe.

title: 14 dias de excelente hospedagem
text: Eu esposa ficamos duas semanas neste hotel. A localização e perfeita. Perto de tudo, no meio de manhattan, entre a 6 e a 7a avenida. A equipe nos concedeu um early checkin é um checkout até as 15h (raro!). Pedido especial de quarto em andar alto e com uma bela vista do Empire State. Cama deliciosa. Ducha perfeita.

title: Good night sleep
text: Everything you need in a hotel. Very nice front desk staff.  Clean rooms with comfortable beds.  Great water pressure in shower.  Restaurant and rooftop bar on premises.  Room service.  Nice breakfast either a la carte or buffet

title: Excellent Hotel at a reasonable price!
text: Very nice option that is slightly more affordable than some other Hilton Hotels in NYC.  Amazing views from rooftop deck on 23rd floor.  Clean rooms, excellent staff, and good location!  Highly recommend!

title: Convenient location away from the Midtown hustle
text: Arriving into the Big Apple via the Megabus, we were seeking a close-by location from our drop off with luggage. Walking distance to Times Square and Chelsea was a plus. Standard, perhaps smallish-room. Due to a sudden snow storm, we had to stay an extra night that fortunately the hotel was able to accommodate outside our original reservation. Reception staff seemed busy and always with heads down working. Some good coffee spots close as well.

title: Hôtel  situé dans Manhattan
text: Hôtel bien situé, au cœur de Manhattan avec plusieurs enseignes alimentaires, bancaires dans le quartier, sans oublier les différentes entrées du métro New Yorkais. A mi chemin entre plusieurs quartiers.

title: Good Location for Sightseeing
text: Room clean.  Good coffee and tea selection in room.  Good shower.  Pillows comfortable. Decor gloomy, not what I expected from a Hilton  our room had a dismal  view of water towers.  I'd rate it a 7/10 - no frills, pretty basic - good base for sightseeing.

title: Excelente
text:
Una atención impecable, fueron muy atentos con nosotros, habitaciones espaciosas y muy bien equipadas. 

Fueron unas vacaciones que nunca olvidaremos.

Muchas gracias al equipo por hacer de nuestra estancia el descanso que necesitamos.

title: 50th birthday
text:
Spent Friday and Saturday night used the valet checked in early got an awesome room as a Diamond member. The staff was excellent very attentive and helpful. The location is great walking distance to everywhere and the price was very reasonable. Breakfast credit of $20 pretty much covers your breakfast buffet or ala cart you have the option. The rooftop bar is very cool and again very reasonable prices for NYC. Overall excellent stay. I'll be back to this location when visiting this part of Manhattan. 
Thank you to the staff at this location everything went extremely well.

title: A very good, reasonably affordable NYC Hilton
text: This Hilton is the definition of VERY GOOD. The staff is extraordinarily friendly, the beds are supremely comfortable, the housekeeping is superlative as the rooms are ultra clean and in good condition, and overall it is very nice. The negatives are that the location is marginal (walking the hundred feet to 7th Avenue is a gauntlet with the same four or five guys sitting on the sidewalk glaring at you and one of them loves to spit at you while you pass) but that of course is not the management's fault. As it isn't their fault that not more than 10 feet from the hotel I saw a cat sized rat dragging half a rotten burger. Another aspect that you can't blame the management for it the view from the room. It is a panoramic view of fire escapes across the tiny alley. To be fair you pay FAR less here than at other Manhattan Hiltons so overall it is quite acceptable!

title: A little dated hotel
text: In the center of Fashion district close to subway and Fashion Institute; conveniently located. The rooms are dingy and dated. Service is sub par. The roof top bar is worth visiting but service is spotty.

title: Great hotel in perfect location!
text: Loved this hotel. The room was slightly larger than other NYC hotels I’ve stayed in. Clean and a wonderfully helpful staff. This hotel is in a perfect location and only a couple of blocks from a subway station. Easy walking distance to Times Square and other midtown locations. Also easy to access downtown either by foot or by subway. It’s our new “go to” hotel in the city.

title: Not a four star hotel.
text: This hotel was the worst Hilton I have stayed in. No fridge (they say, if you ask they will install one - where?) no hairdryer. Small dark room, very limited guide in room, But there was half a chicken under the bed for the whole week I was there. Only discovered it when I was leaving. Not a particularly good area.

title: Not a Hilton
text: AS a Hilton fan It was disappointing to find an old hotel with small rooms ,dark, limited amenities. While the location was good( close to NYU),and the reception staff helpfull. .TYHe hotel did not live up to basic Hilton standards.

title: Great Location, nice hotel if you are out all day and only sleep there
text: We loved the location, great place to base yourself and explore the city. Far enough away from Time Square. We loved Chelsea restaurants and location. The hotel was OK, a typical corporate hotel, no fridge in room, only an electronic mini bar that charged you if you touched it. Staff at reception were lovely and helpful. The roof top bar was an attraction when we booked, disappointing when we got there. It was only open for a few hours a day, we had to line up and show ID to get into the lift. Only went up there once. The Flatiron room around the corner and the Oscar Wild bar when a must see experience for the decor and atmosphere.

title: Attentive service, nice rooms, terrific location
text: I stay in New York city all the time but it was my first time in the fashion district. First of all, it's a great area of the city (so accessible) and the Hilton NYC Fashion District is a terrific hotel. I was there celebrating my girlfriend's birthday and the hotel staff could not have been more accommodating or more willing to make her time in the city special. I particularly would like to highlight the assistant manager John who reached out to me before our trip, was always accessible during the stay, and even followed up after we left. Great overall trip made so much better by this terrific hotel. Absolutely recommend!

title: Great location for business, pleasure, and eating!
text: Hilton Fashion District is a great location. Close to retail and business districts. Great restuarants for sit-down and take-out. Across the street from great Ethnic and Traditional eating establishments.

title: Visit NYC
text: I’ve stayed at the Fashion Hilton many times over the past 10 years.  The hotel and the staff never disappoints.  The rooms are always clean.  The restaurant and rooftop bar are very nice and the view is sensational.

title: Great location - clean and comfortable.
text:
The hotel is in a great location with easy access to many attractions and transportation.  The room was clean, bed was comfortable, and amenities were comparable to an average 4-star hotel in New York. The front desk staff was pleasant but not very accommodating with a simple request, which was surprising to me from the Hilton brand.  It didn't impact my stay and I would certainly go back, I was just surprised that the Hilton brand wasn't more accommodating to guests.  
I would recommend a stay here and will certainly return.

title: Nice stay
text: I'm a Hilton Honors member so check in was easy via the app. My digital key didn't work so I had to be issued a physical key card. I'm hearing from friends that the digital key, while convenient needs some improvement because Hilton has many issues with it. I have used it in the past and it worked fine so this is my first time having a problem. The room was medium sized and good for no more than 2 people I would say. I stayed alone. The bathroom was a decent size. The room was clean overall. The only downside to my room was the refrigerator. It was full of beverages for PURCHASE only. No room for storing food you may bring from outside. Since this hotel is in midtown area there's very few parking options. You can pay for self-park or valet. The parking is NOT cheap. self-parking cost me $40(more for an SUV) and you CANNOT go in/out. Each time you leave you pay the full price again. If you choose valet parking you pay the flat rate $40 plus $10 each time you go in/out. The property is close to public transportation, Uber and cabs are everywhere, or if you like to walk there's some nice things to see close by such as times square(40th/42nd street areas). The staff was very friendly but were limited in granting me a late check-out because they said the hotel was sold out that next day, I was granted and extra half hour but because I utilize the Hilton Honors app I was checked out at the regular check out time. Overall this was a nice stay I just wish there were cheaper parking offered and hopefully they can resolve the digital key issues.

title: Great stay.....
text: Great Property in a GREAT location. The Hotel is quiet and comfortable. Special shout out to Sid in Reception. Friendly, Professional and ALWAYS  remembered my name during my stay. Made me feel welcome and special. Not always the case even though I am a Hilton  Diamond. Bravo Sid for the outstanding customer service.

title: Ótimo Hotel próximo Metro e atrações
text: Ótimo Hotel, os quartos são espaçosos e novo. Hotel em um rooftop com uma bela vista, fica bem cheio por causa dos happy hours. Do Hotel vá caminhando até o HighLine, Chelsea Market e Apple Store e caminhe pela margem do rio Hudson.

title: Terrible
text:
Front desk said " How about I return your... and you go find another Hotel?" At Saturday night. 
As we were told NICE QUIET room will be ready 3 pm when we early checked in 10am.  But when we came back at 6pm, we found out the room is the worst one.

title: Room with no view -
text: This hotel is in the Fashion District and close to the Peloton studio. I took the bait and went for a "Room with a View"  The rooms faced south and I looked at water towers on top of buildings. I learned this at check-in and there was no way to reduce my rate and give me a regular room.  Seriously, I don't know how they get away with charging extra for this.

title: Stand by your brand promise!
text: I have love the Hilton Brand for years. This has remained my Brand of choice for over 20 years. I was extremely disappointed with the cleanliness of this hotel and the management unwillingness to stand by the promise of the brand and make it right. Out of respect for the brand I choose to not go into details publicly. My concerns were made clear to the appropriate people.

title: Excellent
text:
I stay at this hotel often, several times a month over the past several years.  The hotel is located in the Fashion District off of 7th avenue.  Within walking distance to Times Square and immediately close to mid town, Flat Iron and Chelsea.

The front office staff is superb, very accommodating and they bend over backwards to make sure your stay is pleasant.

title: Outstanding service by the staff.
text: My only disappointment was no refrigerator in the room. A mini bar was installed, but no refrigerator. I was told that I can request a refrigerator, but I really do not know where it could fit in the room that would not cause me to trip over it when I get up during the night (and I always have to get up at least once). Otherwise, it is an excellent location for my travels to NYC and I will stay at this property again. The hotel employees provided outstanding service!

title: Great location and value
text: Got a great deal from an email.  Terrific location, and the hotel looks like it is brand new. For you shower fans, the shower is super strong!  The bar left something to be desired, the staff did not care about a couple who came in near closing looking for a meal. Would recommend highly.

title: Unreasonable Manager
text:
I was unable to cancel my reservation with this hotel prior to their deadline. Unfortunately we had a family emergency and spoke to the manager to try to cancel the reservation and instead get a credit or a reduced fee. But she not understanding and very rude despite the reservation being greater than 24 hours away and after explaining the situation resulting in us having to pay the full amount. 

My family and I have been a loyal Hilton customers but will no longer stay at their hotels after this incident.

title: GREAT VIEW, GREAT LOCATION!!
text: My husband and I traveled to NYC for July 4th. Our view as the Empire State Building. The room service is fast, called for ice within minutes it was there.  The In room dinning was wonderful the breakfast was delicious.  We also had a great meal at the RARE downstairs.

title: Good stay a couple of negatives
text: We had just come from a newer Hilton in Boston so maybe had been spoiled. The hotel was nice and helpful staff but maybe rooms looked slightly tired. Location great near to nice areas for dining and short walk to subway. We did not have a fridge but a minibar, you could request one on a waiting list but this did not arrive. In this day most people surely prefer fridge to store own drinks etc. Staff helpfully sent ice on demand though so not a big issue. Air con noisy so take ear plugs in summer! We managed to get late check out for a small charge which was great bonus as we had late flight. In all a good hotel for a short stay with nice staff.

title: Goed hotel op fijne locatie
text:
Zeer net hotel met voor NY ruime kamers. Kamer is netjes tijdloos ingericht. Mist een Wow-factor, maar is ook zeker niets op aan te merken. 

Locatie is erg fijn. Makkelijk te bereiken en in rustige veilige buurt waar veel leuke restaurants/bars in de omgeving te vinden zijn.

Wij hadden als Hilton member een free-late check out, maar dit hotel is erg soepel met het aannemen van koffers. Die je dus later op de dag kunt ophalen.

Personeel erg vriendelijk.

Groot restaurant waar ook ontbeten kan worden. Zowel a la carte ontbijt als buffet ontbijt. Prijs van het ontbijt erg netjes voor NY!

Trouwens bedankt dat er een leuke kaart met flesje wijn op de kamer stond vanwege mijn verjaardag! Dit zorgt ervoor dat je je echt jarig voelt al ben je niet thuis.

title: A good choice in Chelsea
text: Great choice for business and pleasure in the fashion district. Staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and generally quiet. Rooftop bar is 21+, and it is a shame that children can not be accompanied by parents to enjoy the view! Otherwise a good Hilton with a nice staff.

title: Friendly staff, great location
text: It was easy to navigate to the subways and there are plenty of restaurants around the area. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The room was the perfect size for two people. Will definitely stay here again in the future.

title: Nice Rooms Good Location Good Price
text:
King Bed. Full Bath. Clean hotel. Very relaxing. 
Black out curtains, AC , valet parking, 12 o clock checkout
Mobile app checkout
Digital key
Hilton honors 
Why a 200 text min?
Solid hotel
Nice hotel
Spent $100 was well worth it

title: Great location, convenient to/from Penn Station
text: We stayed on a busy weekend (World Pride Weekend June 2019). The front desk staff was very accomodating, friendly and attentive. The only reason I didn't rate this hotel with a top score was due to the accessibility of the hotel's rooftop bar and the room size. The rooftop bar was only accessible from the main floor/front lobby. On a busy weekend, you will need to wait in line in the lobby to go up to the roof top. We frequented the bar/restaurant directly across the street more than we did the hotel's bar. As noted by a few others who have posted, the rooms were smaller than other Hilton hotels.

title: Birthday weekend
text:
Was an awesome experience . We got our room early and were brought a bottle of wine and chocolates .room was very nice and clean. We needed ice and the staff delivered within minutes.
We will be visiting again great location between broadway and the village

title: clean, nice location
text: It's a good location decent price for the room size. Good service at the front desk and the room is very clean but too busy street. The window isn't blocking enough noises from the street. I'd recommend on general but if you wanna get a quality sleep you might wanna choose different side of the hotel

title: Great location.
text: Hilton New York Fashion District is a solid option for stay while in NYC. It is remodeled, and represents standard hotel of Hilton chain. Rooms are smaller than usual, but comfortable, clean and beds are great. This is a no thrill, but a very solid and good place to stay.

title: Decent hotel
text:
Location is great, food in the restaurant is also good, but rooftop bar closed at 11:00 pm which is too early I think.

Room is nice, kind of small but it has everything. Coffee in the room was ok not impressive.

title: Everything is good on hotel side, but not the restaurant one
text:
I would say that whatever hotel has to deal with - they’re doing great. Check in was smooth, luggage stored until our room was ready, complimentary water bottles given, instructions for breakfast stapled to the bag etc. Room looks new, liked the design, view was okay. 
Stayed on 12th floor, was relatively loud, all the noise from the street, plus came during Pride Parade and that was another noise issue, hotel has nothing to do with it. 
Fridge in the room is not designed to store any of guests drinks or food - had to just throw out some leftovers and drinks.
Rare Bar and Grill attached to the hotel is what ruins the Hilton Hotel nice impression and image a lot. First, was told during dinner that they are “independent” from the hotel, so I can’t use my 50% employee discount. Decided to have drinks at rooftop - happened to be closed at 10:15pm, quite early and unexpected.
During breakfast was seated by hostess who’s looking no other than any hotel guest (sneakers, hoodie, T-shirt, jeans, no name tag or introduction), ordered 2 eggs Benedict Duo, been waiting for them for good 20-25 minutes only to receive hard boiled eggs instead of poached eggs as for the recipe and menu.
On top of that, be aware that restaurant automatically charges you 18% gratuity for the service - didn’t deserve that at all for the service we received, that feels almost as a ripoff.

title: Stayed all over New York, would come back
text: We picked this hotel for a few reasons - proximity to train station, cost, and reviews.  I would stay here again above any of the other places I’ve stayed at in the city.  It’s really quit, given that the hotel is down a side street.  The double bed room is pretty spacious for New York.  It’s very clean and nice size bathroom.  The water pressure is amazing ! When have you ever had good water pressure in New York!  It’s easy to catch a cab and most things are less than 20 mins away.  Free WiFi and tv channels for the kids.  The restaurant, Rare, is super delicious - the wait staff is super kind and accommodating.  The elevator situation is a little strange - you have to get the right one.  But literally I have no complaints.  My parents also stayed here in a king room and my dad is using a walker - he had no issues with the walk in showers or room space.  Really great hotel.

title: STAY FAR, FAR AWAY.  I'd rather stay at the the YMCA!
text: Without a doubt the worst Hilton in the family.  I booked a "stay and parking" rate and the Hilton and their parking people severely damaged my car to the tune of $1,200 of damage and refuse to take responsibility.  They even attempted to cover up the damage with mismatched paint.  They claim the parking lot is responsible although the Hilton NY Fashion District got my money.  When I called the hotel manager Tim Peters about the $1,200 of damage, he hung up on me.  He has the proof that hotel/agents are responsible.  Never again at any Hilton.

title: While the manager is away, the rats will play.
text:
I have stayed at this property multiple times and for the most part, it has been a pleasant experience. However, this time around it was a total let down. 

**Beware of the following**
1. Pay attention to your folio at the end of your stay. They will try to sneak charges in your bill e.g. minibar, etc.
2. The food at Rare (house restaurant) is marginal at best. Pay close attention to the times they consider breakfast. Get this in writing. 
3. Do not allow them to place you on the 22nd floor. The music from the rooftop bar is extremely loud and so are the vibrations--so much so that not even the earplugs we bought made it better.
4. Elevators are in need of serious maintenance. 
5. Their business center is a joke so if you have work to tend to, forget it. 
6. Be prepared to be confronted and greeted with rudeness should you ask for clarification about your charges and concerns especially by the likes of Sade, a manager there.

Housekeeping did a great job. To be fair, it's in a great neighborhood but I would recommend Embassy Suites or Hilton Garden Inn around 35th St. 

John, the manager at the property understands hospitality and he's very professional. Unfortunately this trip around, he was away.

title: A weekend in New York
text: This is my second time staying at this property. I stay here because of the convenience, I normally take the Vamoose Bus from MD and the final stop is at 30th St and 7th Avenue, which is a 5-minute walk to the hotel. Since this hotel is located in the Fashion District and across from FIT, there are plenty of restaurants and shops all within walking distance. There are several Subway stops and the crosstown bus on 23rd is a convenient way to travel to the Eastside. I would recommend this hotel for a great weekend stay.

title: Short but pleasant stay
text: Thanks to an Amtrak snafu I arrived at the hotel a little before 3am after the short walk from Penn Station. I had used the Hilton app to check in early and select my room, so check-in could not have been any smoother - just what you want at 3am! I asked for a 6am wake-up call, and the call came at 5:58. Well done! My room (201) was nicely appointed, with a fully stocked fridge and all the attention to detail one would expect from a Hilton property.

title: Happy at the Hilton
text: Conveniently located with a great terrace top view of the city. This hotel is in the Fashion District. We were greeted by Friendly staff and helpful concierge. At check out the car service was waiting as arranged by the hotel to ensure we made it to the airport on time. The restaurant Food left a bit to be desired. We found several great restaurants within walking distance. Safe neighborhood

title: Good hotel, great location!
text: I stayed here last month with a friend in a 2 bed room. We were on a low floor at the back  which was good for us as it overlooked other buildings so no traffic noise, but there was noise from people using the doors to the stairs next to the room. Great location, not as busy as midtown and would definitely stay in this area and hotel again.

title: The best staff
text: Room is always clean and comfortable, but the staff makes this one of my favorites in the city.  They are super personable, have great tips on the area and remember repeat guests exceptionally well.  I always stay here when it's available.

title: Great location and helpful staff
text: Excellent Hilton property with a wonderful rooftop bar.  We thoroughly enjoyed our visit.  The room was clean and well apportioned.  The location was ideal, although there may not be any bad spots in Midtown.

title: Great location and modern room
text: This is a nice and modern style hotel.  Rooms are updated and the location is great.... Central to Madison Square Garden... 6 blocks away.... walked to Chelsea as well as Herald Square.  Very convenient to everything and rooms are very clean

title: Nice stay
text: This is a very nice hotel with great staff. Only stayed for one night but the room was cleancomfortable and the location was great. We were near everything we needed to see for the one night. Easy walking distance to Madison Square Garden, Times Square and Fifth Avenue. For NYC it was easy in and easy out parking provided only a few buildings away, they do validate so some savings. Did not eat in the hotel so nothing to say about that. Clean comfotable modern hotel for what was a great rate for NYC. Woudl stay again.

title: AWESOME STAFF/VERY CLEAN ROOMS
text: The staff is awesome (front desk, bellhops & maid service), however the MOST important is the cleanness of the rooms and they are very clean :) I stay here about 40 times a year and always enjoy my stay here

title: Convenient but thin walls
text: The hotel is conveniently located in Chelsea neighborhood with access to various subway lines. Rooms are nice but walls are very thin. I heard a baby crying early in the morning and could hear children in the hallways. Nice hotel and location but not sure if I would return.

title: BUEN HOTEL EN MANHATTAN
text:
Buen hotel cerca de todas las atracciones y metro.
Zona tranquila con muchos comercios cercanos.
La habitación que nos dieron, con dos camas de matrimonio, a nosotros nos pareció grande y espaciosa. Las camas fueron cómodas, pero a pesar de ser de matrimonio no eran tan grandes como uno espera. Tanto la habitación como el baño estaban muy limpios y nos la hacían a diario y nos cambiaban las toallas. De personal poco puedo decir ya que afortunadamente no necesitamos de su ayuda y tratamos con ellos para hacer la entrada y la salida, pero fueron correctos con nosotros. Del desayuno nada puedo decir, no lo teníamos.
En resumen y bajo nuestro punto de vista, en la media de los precios de Nueva York pero un buen hotel, cómodo y limpio. Lo recomendaría y volvería.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: For a Manhattan hotel, the location is excellent. Good value and lovely service. Go to the Highline, which is within walking distance. We enjoyed the restaurant at the hotel as well. Chelsea Market is also fun.

title: Disappointed
text:
This hotel is far from the best hotel I’ve been these last years. 
I do not recommend to stay over there as the personal at front desk are unpleasant and also the cleaning team.
Just the personal at the restaurant were polite and took care of the customers. 
Rooms were not really clean and I was literally surprised of the cold attitude towards the customers. 
It was my first trip in NY and for sure next time I will not go in this hotel . 
It’s a pity as the geographic place is interesting downtown NY.

title: Enjoyed Birthday Weekend
text: This hotel is in a perfect Location. Really enjoyed my stay. Room was a good size, great bed and the staff was very nice!  The parking garage was just a few steps away. This will definitely be my go to hotel within the Fashion District.

title: Service you expect from Hilton Brands
text: With Hilton you expect a level of quality and service above that of other brands, This hotel met the high standards expected of Hilton and enjoyed my stay and the customer service provided. I would stay here again

title: Great location and service
text:
The room and beds were clean and comfortable. The staff is friendly. The rooms are good sized and everything in the room was in working order. I requested and received a refrigerator in the room. The top floors are high enough that street noises do not disturb.

 The housekeeping staff was ok -> did not replace dirty glasses and did not restock coffee properly.

The gym did not have working A/C one day and the temps in there got close to 76 degrees.

title: Clean, comfortable and great service
text: Stayed over for an early meeting and chose this hotel for it's restaurant,rooftop lounge and proximity to my office. The staff was great, greetings as soon as I entered and checked in in less than 5 minutes. The room was clean, but a bit small. Food at Rare was great and reasonably priced. There was a private party on the rooftop lounge, so had to wait until after 9:30 to be able to go up. I was a bit disappointed by there claims for 360 degree views as part of it is basically from a hallway. But it is still rooftop bar in the city so I'm not going to grade it too harshly. Overall great stay, and will stay again.

title: Excellent Hilton in an off location
text: This hotel is a full-service Hilton in a sort of out of the way location.  Rooms are good sized and equipped.  Good elevators.  Has a roof-deck bar which uses one of the elevators during evenings.  Excellent front desk staff.  No executive lounge but fill breakfast provided. Clean and better than most hotels surrounding it.  And less expensive than similar properties.

title: Great Location, friendly staff, easy access to great restaurants and bars
text: Stayed at this property for a work event. Perfect proximity to downtown area attractions like the High Line and the Whitney Museum. Also close to many good restaurants and bars. Room is adequate, clean comfortable and not too small.

title: Good value for money. Good location.
text: Overall experience is very good but the room doors noise isolation should be better. Good location. Several blocks from the Penn Station. No breakfast but many places for breakfast around. Stayed only for one night.

title: 立地と値段が決め手
text: 出張先のオフィスへのアクセスもありましたが、他観光地へ出る地下鉄や空港へ行く電車が通るマディソンスクエア駅まで荷物を持って歩ける距離にあったのもよかったです。雨や曇りが多く最上階のバーにはいきませんでした。客室は古く、壁が薄くて近所の声が丸聞こえ。シャワーの水圧と温度は良く、ベッドもよく眠れたのでよかったです。歯ブラシやスリッパは最初から置いていないのでコンシェルジュに頼みましょう。

title: Great location.
text: Enjoyed my stay. Staff friendly and helpful. Location is great, walking distance to many sites, just a couple blocks from the Subway at 26th St Station. Beds, pillows, and room temperature/AC comfortable. Just remember to turn the vanity light on in the bathroom because the main light is on a timer and the room went dark while I was in the shower, which was reactivated as soon as I reached for the shower door. Ha ha. I had a street-side room and even on the Saturday night it was quiet. Also appreciate the flat-rate car service to the airports provided by the hotel, basically same price as ride-share companies but you can organize up to 30 minutes in advance of when you need it.  Definitely will return.

title: Hilton Fashion District
text: Excellent location, service and quality. Loved the neighborhood and nearby subway #1 train made getting around even easier. I travel by train to NYC and the hotel is only one stop from the train station.

title: Quick business trip
text: had to go to nyc for a conference at the javits center and location was great. It's away from the busyness and crazyness of time square and was about 15-20 minute walk to javits center. There's also a cool rooftop you can have a drink on.

title: Nothing special about this property.
text: Google classifying this as a 4-star hotel is comical. This is a basic Hilton with basic amenities. It has a bed that's not that comfortable, towels that feel like sandpaper, and a fridge that's stocked with expensive goodies leaving no room for you to store your drinks. The location is good, but not worth the money unless you really want to boost your HH status.

title: Great except
text: This is a well run hotel in a less congested portion of Manhattan yet still readily accessible to Times Square. It was not time consuming to get the elevator and the staff was very friendly. However, be advised the room is barely adequate in space, 1 queen size room, but the lighting is insufficient to read by.

title: An overnight in NYC
text: The location on 26th and 6th is pretty good because the hotel area is not as crowded as in the Theater District but still very walkable to Hudson Yards, the theater and hundreds of good restaurants. The rooms are very small and the staff is helpful, nothing surprising in NYC and the lighting is dim, hello mood lighting. All in all a perfectly fine place to stay. The staff is very helpful and pleasant.

title: Great Manhattan location, very frienfly staff
text: We were with family of 5 stayed for 7 nights end of April / beginning of May. We had two rooms on 21st floor - 1 king bed (for 2 pers), one double beds (for 3 pers). Nice, clean rooms, very comfortable beds (best sleep since long, and no lag :-) ), clean bathroom with spacious shower, everything well equipped: safe, hair drawer, iron and ironing board. Fridge only for hotel drinks (no possibility to place own stuff). Free Wi Fi, which however needs to be refreshed every day. We enjoyed nice view on Empire State Building (our kids less lucky, but still OK). I highly recommend higher floors (15+). Excellent location, just few minutes walk from Empire State and Maddison Square Garden (perfectly located on the 26th St, between three subway lines, between 7th Ave and 6th Ave. A comfortable and friendly hotel to stay to explore New York. The staff was very friendly and helpful. If you want to eat breakfast or lunch nearby, enjoying wide selection of freshly made ready food we recommend Sunac, just 100 m over the corner.

title: Excellent Staff.
text:
The big point of this hotel is the staff. All of those we met are great. We were in NYC for Easter Sunday and the next day. We stayed at 2 different hotels because we wanted to see both and one of them was this one. 

I am a bit disappointed with the quality of rooms at this hotel. We have had to call reception a few times for different things: thermostat that doesn't work, missing coffee in the room, no ice machine etc etc. 

I am just surprised that Hilton does not upgrade in such a prime location. We are used to the Hilton in Québec City and frankly it has much more class than this. 
The beds were not comfortable at all, it felt more like a trampoline than a bed. The bathroom was ok and although we could hear quite a bit of noise at night, not many hôtels in NYC have fully sound proof locations. 

I dont know, if I would go back to this specific location...

title: Great staff, very convient location
text:
In the past year, I have stayed at five different Hilton brand properties around Manhattan. I believe I have now found my new home for when I come to New York City. The staff was friendly and helpful.

The hotel is perfectly located between three subway lines -- 8th Ave (FM), 7th Ave (1), and 6th Ave (CE). It is also only a five minute walk to/from Penn Station.

title: Great stay
text:
Family of 5 stayed for 7 nights over Easter. We had two rooms. Both with two double beds. Reception very pleasant and very helpful. Rooms clean, beds very comfortable, shower spacious and rooms made up to a high standard daily. Hotel restaurant pleasant and staff wonderful. We asked for a fridge in our room. Wi Fi provided for our entire stay - a real bonus with three teenagers!
Hotel is central and only a few minutes walk from Empire State, Maddison square garden,Penn station and Maddison square park. A great clean, comfortable and friendly hotel to stay to explore New York. We also enjoyed eating in Wagamama’s at Maddison square park, good value and quick service.

title: Easy quick one night
text:
Hotel was very convenient for a one night stay. An easy walk from penn station and a good base for exploring the midtown area. 

Staff was courteous and pleasant. My friend left his passport in the room safe and they were quick to retrieve it which was very much appreciated. 

As a diamond member I received the following benefits:
-$20 per person for breakfast or 2,000 bonus points 
-2 free bottled waters at check in 
-premium WiFi usage
-no upgrade applicable (I don’t think the hotel offers more than a standard king or queen with view)

The room itself was clean and comfortable. I had room 1911 which offered a nice view of the city and faced the street. Bed was very comfortable. Standard size room for manhattan (re: small) but adequate. Though the diamond benefits were not mind blowing I would not hesitate to stay here again if need a convenient midtown base.

title: Très bon sejour
text:
Hôtel idéalement placé, chambre confortable et propre.
Nous avons passé un excellent séjour et nous recommandons cet hôtel. La literie est confortable, les chambres sont calmes et bien isolées du bruit de la rue.

title: Shavonne* was great
text: I stayed at this hotel 4/24-4/25.  Hotel is lovely,  my room was great, no issues.  The reason for my review is to compliment Shavonne (I think I am spelling this wrong, sorry!) she was fantastic and very kind.  She assisted me with all my bags including this huge, heavy box I had for work.  If it wasn't for her I would have struggled.  A big thank you! I will certainly be back given how I was treated.  Great job!

title: Great Customer Service
text: My rating for this hotel is based on the service provided by the staff.  Everyone was attentive and made sure that my needs were met.  I received emails before and after my stay asking about the hotel and how my stay was.  Attention to customer detail is important to them and I like this!

title: Rooftop Bar
text: During our stay, 1 elevator was torn up the entire time (4 days). They have a rooftop bar and at about 5-6 they dedicate one elevator to the bar. That left 1 elevator for all guests to use. Hotel staff was there and they ignored those of us waiting to go to our rooms and made the bar guest the priority. It was rude and totally not acceptable. I would understand if they had 2 other elevators going but they did not. Also, i arrived early and asked for an early check in. Nope! It was almost 3:30 before our room was ready. We sat at the restaurant next door for 1 1/2 hours waiting. Also, i asked for a quiet room because my daughter has health issues and needed to be sure she could rest at night. Nope! They put us in the room right behind the elevator shaft. Not okay! It was the worst experience we have ever had at a Hilton!

title: Disappointing
text: The good: The room was clean, shower was hot, and the bathroom was clean and everything worked well. The staff was friendly especially Mily at the front desk and John who helped me with car services. The bad: I paid extra for a higher floor and bigger room. Wow, it was like a bedroom and we were on the 22 floor close to the rooftop bar which I thought was going be fun but ended up keeping us awake. DJ on Saturday evening was loud. I am pretty hip for my age but we did a lot of sight seeing and walking. So the noise was a bit disturbing. When I called the front desk to complain they offered me eye plugs. When we tried to drink at the two hotel bars they did not have Jack Daniels, Captain Morgan, Absolute Vodka, or Riesling. Are you kidding me? Where in NYC? 1 out of the 3 elevators was broken and it made going up and down a logistical nightmare. Waiting as long as 20 minutes just to go up or down is ridiculous. The Keurig coffee maker in the room was on this high shelf which was strange and difficult to use and fill with water. I am 5'7 so not exactly short but it was almost impossible to use. This was a surprise weekend for my girlfriends 50 th birthday, and we got engaged on Saturday when we were there. Not exactly the best experience. Do you want to be in the bar business or the hospitality business? Because the noise from the roof top bar disturbed your guests and you didnt care. When we checked out NO ONE asked how are stay was. Next time I am in NYC I will stay at a Marriott.

title: Séjour impeccable
text: Hôtel très bien placé. Métro et bus pas loin. Après de longues journées de marche la chambre était très calme (sur cour intérieure) et confortable. Chambre pour 4 donc prix divisé par 2 et raisonnable. Rooftop génial. Excellente adresse en famillle ou amis.

title: Stay away.
text: Cleanliness of the room was poor, 2 out of the 3 elevators were out of service, and the email correspondence directly from the hotel manager (on duty) contradicted what was actually done, re: having a room key disabled with my wife unable to access a new key. This despite the manager assuring me that my stay would be uninterrupted form a split reservation stay. We are met with rudeness at the front desk when I voiced my complaints. Stay away.

title: Small but perfectly formed
text: You don’t expect large rooms in NYC but the room at the Hilton Fashion District was well laid out and met everything I needed for my stay at the hotel. Good staff, helpful and friendly and resolved a minor issue with billing for laundry very quickly. I would definitely stay here again.

title: A Hilton not worthy of the name
text: Going to a Hilton in NYC, I expected it to be luxurious and spacious, like other Hilton’s I’ve stayed in, but it was neither. Of course it was clean, and the staff were lovely, but the rooms were extremely small, the breakfast food was just atrocious and the walls let in all the sounds from everyone around you. I would whole-heartedly recommend looking elsewhere to stay, even though it is in a good part of town.

title: Great stay
text: I'm a former New Yorker - was back this week for a conference at FIT. This hotel is great - clean rooms, relatively quiet, and in a perfect location. Had a hiccup with the internet that was remedied immediately by Nick. Had room service last night - delicious burger with truffle fries. Bathroom is shower only - so if you're looking for a soaking tub you're out of luck. Love the digital key - works like a charm. Hotel is pretty tiny but it's NYC - if you're spending your time in the hotel you've missed the point of this city. Will definitely stay again if I'm back for events in this neighborhood.

title: Excellent with a Great View
text: I stay for a weekend to meet some friends and my experience was great.  All of us stay at this hotel and we like it very much.  I would stay here again.  The app makes the check out process very effective. The front desk personnel were welcoming, helpful, they speak several languages and very attentive. Located in the fashion district was very important for the type of trip I had. The view from room 2008 was great and loved observing the night lights from the room.  It was very clean and bed was very comfortable helping me to fall asleep quick. There are a lot of eating options around as well.  Love it!

title: A good option
text: Really great front desk staff, very friendly housekeeping staff. Rooms were a decent size, with a good king bed, small closet, desk space, drawers, nightstands and plenty of power outlets. In room Keurig. No clock in the room! Large enough bathroom with good sized shower and cubbies under the sink for storage – good lighting (for once) however, no magnifying mirror. Nothing special about the room décor, the shower tile grout showing some mold/discoloration that should be attended to. They missed our standing request for feather-free, but brought foam pillows quickly when requested - two decent, two overly firm; comforter was not feather. We were on the back (alley) side facing the office building next door (no view, limited sunlight), so completely quiet all night long, but you can hear room doors banging when people come back at night and leave in the AM (normal business hours, not late night and late rising folks). Location at the edge of Chelsea, but easy enough to walk to a number of sites and restaurants in Chelsea, Flatiron, etc. Parking is $45 for self park with no in/out privileges and $60 for valet with in/out (add $5 if it's a SUV). We did not take the continental breakfast offered to elite members. We did not get to the rooftop bar.

title: Clean hotel and friendly staff
text:
Staff was amazing. They were fast, always available, knowledgeable and super friendly. 
The room was small but very clean. Plenty of water pressure. I just wish it was a little quieter but it is a hotel (not my home) so no complaints.
Breakfast (I chose buffet) options were fresh and serving area clean. Servers and host were friendly and attentive.

title: Great location, super comfy beds - and an overall solid option for a basic hotel in Manhattan
text:
This hotel is fairly basic in terms of facilities and design, but is a great option if you're looking for a basic-solid stay in the city.

The location is great, room was super clean, the bed was especially comfortable and the fitness room is small but good.

A special shoutout to the front-desk team:
I stayed there for my wedding weekend, and even though it's not your typical honeymoon option, after we mentioned this to the reception, they sent some sweet treats and a bottle of wine to our room later that day - which we really appreciated.

title: Typical Hilton Property
text: Helpful and friendly staff, easy check in. Rooms are small but very clean and comfortable Hilton beds. Noise was not an issue and certainly can be in NYC. The thermostat didn’t work and the room was pretty warm. If you stay here, the location is walking distance to all kinds of food/sights/shopping but there are no views from the rooms.

title: Old hotel and dingy.
text: The hotel is not what you'd expect of the Hilton brand. It's incredibly old and dated - felt dirty. Only 2 elevators were operational and wait times were crazy. It just wasn't a quality experience for me.

title: 2 nights stay - enjoyed it
text: Stayed for 2 nights (22 - 23 Feb). Hotel location was great and there were amenities nearby for your essential needs. The staff at the reception were really helpful and nice. I will come back again if i am next in NY.

title: Good location with a good restaurant and bar.
text:
This hotel is well located near many restaurants near by. It has his own and if you like a great hamburger with a cold beer ,that is the place .
The rooms are averages ,a little bit old. Mine was fairly large facing an office building but no noise from the street.The complementary internet connections was ok
You get your money's worth for your stay.Try it.

title: Prima hotel, super locatie
text:
Prima hotel met een super locatie. Kamers zijn ruim en schoon en je merkt weinig van het geluid van buiten. Personeel is zeer vriendelijk en behulpzaam. Er is een mogelijkheid om je boardingpass te printen en je kan op de laatste dag ook nog je koffer achterlaten.
Wat echt super is, is de locatie. Je bent zo in de verschillende stadsdelen en binnen een aantal minuten op Time Square of leuke pleintjes/parkjes.
De metro is vlakbij en ook Penn Station is op loopafstand om vanuit daar met de trein van en naar het vliegveld te gaan.

title: Pleasant hotel south of Penn Station
text: Stayed one night during snow storm in February. Had high floor queen bed room with view down upon buildings in the area. Room was sufficient and compact, but smallish and lacked a comfortable sitting seat (albeit there was a desk chair). Also lacked a frig, which would have been nice. The cooler in the room was restricted to items in the minibar with no extra room for personal items (and note about incurring a charge if anything was moved). Also, strangely there was no ice bucket for cooling food items or access to ice machines (apparently ice has to be requested at the front desk). If you can get a decent price it is a good place to stay, but other Hilton family properties in the area can provide more value as they have more amenities. Staff were helpful and the location is a plus if you want to stay in this area, as it is loaded with places to nosh and shop. About short two block walk to #1 train, uptown or downtown. Has top floor bar area which is accessed via a separate and guarded elevator. Breakfast buffet offerings have broadened since my last stay a few year ago, but be aware that buffet items are in a separate room adjacent to restaurant. If you can get a good price, it is worth the stay.

title: Not loving this hotel
text: First off, I hated my room. Yes, I’m used to small nyc rooms, but this one was really cramped and dark. Also, it lacked a room service menu. And after calling for one in the morning, it took a really long time for one to be delivered. Since I’m here on business, not having a menu promptly delivered is a problem because then I don’t have enough time to eat. All in all, a hotel fail. Luckily I have lots of other options in the future.

title: Great location, and food was a step above standard hotel roomservice
text: I travel extensively and was pleasantly surprised. The room is small, typical NY. Clean, modern and well laid out. Liked Keurig coffee machine rather than the usual undrinkable swill and cheap machine in many hotels. I like room service because I work late. This Hilton still has it and the food was very good and the french onion soup was terrific. Scope of menu limited but ok. Service was friendly and quick.

title: Great location, but small and no fridge or microwave
text: This hotel is in a fantastic location for all of New York's "tourist-y" attractions - Times Square, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Statue of Liberty, 9/11 Museum are all a walk or a walk + subway ride away.  We also used Lyft rides a few times when we got too far away from a subway station or got tired.  The room was a bit small, but we haven't stayed anywhere else in Manhattan and maybe that's just the norm?  Would have liked to have a microwave and especially a fridge.  Other than that, great hotel and location for the price - we would stay here again!

title: Spacious and good service
text: My family and I stayed here at the last minute. Rooms were bigger than expected for a Manhattan hotel and very central. Service was good at front desk with bilingual staff. Would repeat again no doubt.  We stayed for one night at decent rate.

title: Zentral gelegen, typisches & einfaches Hilton
text: Ein Hilton, wie man es öfter antrifft: In die Jahre gekommen, dunkle Zimmer mit wenig Vertrauen erweckendem Teppich. Sauberkeit ok, mehr aber nicht. Sehr gute Lage, freundliches Personal, Frühstück nicht genutzt...

title: Definitely would NOT recommend this hotel -- for pleasure or business.
text:
I stayed at this hotel last week and the overall experience was horrible.  Here are some of the "low"lights from my stay ...
- issues during check-in
- only two of the hotel's three elevators were working, so usually had to get in line to get to my room
- the room, which overlooked 26th Street, was quite dark to begin with ... this was compounded by the fact that the lights in the pantry were out of order (service came up and looked, told me the lights were on backorder)
- no room service other than from the restaurant downstairs .... which, when I ordered a steak from them refused to substitute my mashed potatoes for a salad (seriously)
- garbage put outside of the room during the evening was still there in the morning (three times)
- no complementary water in the rooms
- coffee service is via Keurig (yuck) with coffee-mate creamers to go!
- shower ran out of hot water on one occasion
- ran out of Kleenex in the bathroom
- shower leaked on the floor (every time)
- elevators smelled like pot
etc....

The best part of my visit to this hotel was checking-out.  Don't go.

title: Only Wish Had a Fridge
text: My friend chose this hotel because of his work. The subway station is very close by. Also close to where a Wendy Williams tapes as well as Rachael Ray. Restaurants near by. Room was clean bed comfortable. Room has mini bar but not a fridge.

title: Hilton Fashion district
