text: Comfortable room and spacious enough.. Helpful staff at front desk. Handy location. Enjoyed the rooftop bar at RARE, Super views and well worth a visit. Beds very comfortable good nights sleep.Would return.

title: This would be my go-to NYC hotel!
text:
Fantastic! And Raquel & Zorabel at the Front Desk are OUTSTANDING!.

Room was great. Evelyn & Crabtree toiletries in the WC. Quiet AC. Great Rooftop bar ("Rare View") where the beautiful & fabulous "Ally" served us our happy hour drinks before we went elsewhere for a dinner reservation. GREAT views on the roof, both afternoon and evening! Just loved everything about this place. The room was the perfect size.  Great bed (bathrooms have showers only save for only a few rooms the FD told me) and you can have a fridge on request(!?).

This was a "chance" booking via the Hotels Tonight app; it was such a good deal, we went for it. GREAT location for restaurants if you are a foodie like me/us. Good neighborhood and plenty of street parking (hotel parking prices are too high!).

WELL DONE!

title: Excellent!
text: We've stayed elsewhere in the vicinity and this is now the favorite. Arrived on a Friday evening and bellhop suggested we park free on the street for the whole weekend after 7 PM! Excellent, friendly staff seems happy. (Front desk not so much.) Larger, newer bathrooms. Very good restaurant which is great if you don't have the time to walk somewhere.

title: Great Location
text: Great location, clean room and a good service at a good price. You can walk everywhere (from Central Park to Times Square and even to Battery park) and that's a big plus! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Fabulous
text: After reading the reviews we Stayed here for the weekend with my husband it was great! One to watch out for can’t rate it enough. We would definitely book again the next time we are on the East Coast.

title: Comfortable, city-sized rooms in excellent location
text: I've stayed here twice and have enjoyed both visits. They have clean and  comfortable rooms in a great location. Easy to get to Time Square but you aren't in the hustle and bustle of NYC. The hotel is on one of the quieter streets and we never heard anything from our rooms. They have a rooftop bar with some views. I would skip the breakfast and try one of the many, amazing restaurants in the city.

title: Hôtel bien situé
text: L'hôtel est bien situé. Nous avons rencontré un problème de fermeture de fenêtre dans la chambre, le personnel a été réactif. La réception est disponible et accueillante. La chambre était propre ainsi que la salle de bain.

title: Great location & comfy rooms
text: We stayed here on a Friday night. Great linens in a decent sized room for NYC. The rooftop bar scenery & crowd was fun as well! Not a bad walk to most of the sights. Parking was about a block away & they validate so $42 per day (24 hours). Staff were friendly & helpful as well.

title: Lied about early check in AND having a cot.
text:
Hotel was OVERBOOKED after I called three different times before leaving Virgina to verify I could check in when arrving by train at 2am. Could not check in until noon missing 10 hours of sleep, thanks Hilton😤 THIS IS NOT HOW YOU TREAT YOUR HONORS MEMBERS!!!
To add further insult to injury, the 800 number Hilton people told me I could check in their DoubleTree early for that day and transferred me (6:30am now), then DoubleTree said I would have to pay for the night before and I said no thanks... 20 days later I have a charge on my credit card for a stay at DoubleTree, went through numerous calls trying to get it resolved... Now waiting for a credit..Never again!! Hilton also told my sister they had a cot for her room before checking in NOT!!! Another lie!

title: Don’t compare to other hotels outside New York
text:
Before I start this hotel will not get a 3 on rating outside New York as there are much better hotels with bigger rooms and better amenities in other major cities 

So to start the room is in a reasonable size ( for New York) clean good bed . Bathroom is good for Hilton standards, good towels and the usual amenities 

There is a problem with the US with this floor type window AC which looks like it that the casing was not changed from the 70’s of last century and upgraded a bit to some electronic controls which works good as long as it on or off so the rooms gets too cold or too warm . We managed to control it by just covering ourselves and sleep as we are mostly outside during the day. 

The neighborhood was a bit noisy but we were on the 14th floor ( which actually more like the 7th or 8th comparing to another older building in front of us) so it was manageable 

Breakfast system was a bit strange as you can eat what ever you want as long as it doesn’t go over 20 dollars and you have to pay the difference we optioned the buffet which was 22 dollars so we paid the difference. There are other a la carte which is below that but eventually you will pay a bit over the fixed amount 

Over all we have been treated well and things were okay for New York standard

title: Good value; less than stellar service
text: The rooms here are a good value for the money and larger than many other NY hotel in a similar price range. I’ve stayed atbthis hotel before for work and had a solid experience. However, for this trip, the service of the front desk staff was underwhelming and makes me rethink staying at this hotel again in the future.

title: Quiet hotel in the middle of the Big Apple
text: This is a really nice hotel, quiet and comfortable in the center of Chelsea near lots of great restaurants and other fine establishments.  I stayed here a week for business.  The room I had was comfortable and clean.  It was also remarkably quiet.  There's a rooftop bar that closes somewhat early but still presents a great time, a nice lobby bar and restaurant with great food as well.  The staff was super friendly.  The rooms were priced nicely with respect to other rooms in the area.  I like this hotel.  Lots of great places to eat all around it.  Not much parking but there are parking garages on this street.

title: Fantastic Stay at a Great Price
text: After getting an absolutely amazing deal for an overnight stay via HotelTonight, I had to write a glowing review.  The room was quite large, the staff was welcoming and kind, and the location was perfect.  They even found my misplaced sunglasses and left them in my room.  Thank you to the entire front desk team.  Highly recommend.

title: Great hotel only a few blocks downtown from NY Penn Station
text:
This hotel is fantastic.

It is centrally located a few blocks downtown from NY Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. There is easy access to the different subway lines. This location provides excellent access to the Chelsea and surrounding areas. It is an easy couple of stops on the subway uptown to 42nd Street, Times Square and other uptown tourist hotspots.

My room was clean, tidy and average size for a New York hotel room. Shower was great.

Breakfast in the restaurant was well priced and good value setting up for a big day in the city. The RareBar & Grille also served great meals for lunch and dinner.

Very much enjoyed this Hilton chain hotel and will be staying again on my next NY trip.

title: VERY GOOD
text:
It's one of the plenty hotels we scrolled through while looking for a place to stay in Manhattan. We found a good offer (as cheap as a hotel can be around there, so not much) and went for it. As a matter of fact it was a very good choice: we found ourselves in the heart of Manhattan, very close to some subway stations and some very important landmarks (MSG, Times Square, Madison Square Park etc). You will also find a whole market foods very close by (that helps if you want to try some healthy food). Plus our stay was upgraded and we found ourselves at the 21st floor with a fantastic view, especially at night.
The room itself was very cosy and absolutely not small in size, with a comfortable queen-size bed.
Room service was very generous with soaps and towels and people where very friendly and willing to help.

title: Great location, great experience, amazing view!
text:
We had a top floor room with a view to the empire state building. 
The room was clean and comfortable, only thing we didn't like was that the mattress was slippery and if you leaned on the bed (put on shoes and such) it would move and you'll lose your balance. Though it didn't matter when sleeping.

title: Heart of Fashion District
text: I travel a lot for work, so I know a good hotel and this was great!  Rooms were clean, well appointed, loved having coffee in room, and the bathroom products were fantastic ... brand and all.  The room was not teeny tiny as so many are in the city. Front desk staff was friendly and efficient.  Great place to stay for a weekend in NY!

title: Great hotel, cool rooftop bar, lovely staff
text:
Lovely stylish hotel. Great sized rooms. Good location, not too far from Times Square. Friendly helpful staff who were able to recommend places to go in New York! Clean and tidy hotel. Great restaurant. 
Would stay here again!

title: Decent for Work
text: Have stayed here a couple of times for work, along with other Hiltons in NY - I like Hilton better than Club Quarters, the two hotel chains my corporation prefers.  Anyway, this is plenty nice for work, pretty clean and modern.  Good location, depending on what you need, but it is central for me.  Would stay again for work...

title: Muy bien! Volvería
text: La ubicación no es la mejor de todas, pero está muy bien. A pocas cuadras del subte. La limpieza y servicio excelentes, wifi gratis, buena predisposición del personal, hay un rooftop arriba que no fui. Volvería.

title: Great location and Staff
text: Overall, this hotel is fantastic.  Great location for shopping both lower Manhattan and mid town.  Staff is super friendly and the manager is Awesome.  Celabrated out anniversary here and the staff sent us champagne and chocolate strawberries.  Would definitely stay here again.  I'm a Hilton Diamond member so we got breakfast in their connected restaurant, Rare.

title: Wonderful Stay!!
text:
The Hilton Fashion District was a wonderful stay for our family over the long Memorial Day weekend. We arrived prior to check in time and had already selected a room on the 21st floor using the HH app. (By the way all double beds city view rooms face south, we were hoping for North facing Empire State Building for our young girls to enjoy. I did find this out when trying to select room for check in on the app). Having arrived before check in time we asked to store our luggage while going to get lunch, and the kind lady checking us in offered a room on the 19th floor that was already available. Our two girls were also greeted with crayons and activity pads by the front desk staff, which after a long day of traveling brought smiles back to their faces. We were thanked for being Hilton silver members and given a bag with waters. 
We were told about the rooftop bar, which my husband was able to go up one night and enjoy drinks and the views. Kids were not allowed up, but the front desk did say if we came down to the desk early they would take us up with our girls so they could enjoy the view prior to the bar opening. We tried at 4:30 on Saturday after getting back from a broadway show, but they said the bar would be opening soon & to come back down the next morning. It was storming the next morning, so I never made it up there with my girls. Maybe next time.
The hotel room had a view of water towers not much else; I would definitely recommend the higher floors. A positive, with the room facing south, it was very quiet as far as no street noise. The doors to rooms are extremely loud when closing though, so we could hear those during the middle of the night at times. 
The room was spotless (which is huge for me, especially traveling with little ones who are all over the place) beds were comfortable & room was cleaned & refreshed daily. The Keurig was a huge plus! Also requested a mini fridge & a couple foam pillows which were brought up. Loved the cotton balls in the bathroom for removing makeup, I would order those myself if I knew where Hilton ordered them from. Small, dense & soft :) the little things do make a big difference. 
The location is great. We walked to Google to meet a family member for lunch & a tour, walked the highline, walked to Chelsea piers so the kids could play, walked to Madison square park, & plenty of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. There’s a great coffee shop just around the corner & a Whole Foods a couple blocks away. Subway entrance was only a couple blocks away also, so that was easy to catch to head up to the natural history museum & Central Park.
We loved our stay at the Hilton Fashion District & I will definitely stay again. Thank you Hilton!

title: Great hotel!
text: The staff is top-notch.  Rooms are small but very adequate.  Clean. Great water pressure in the shower.  The location is very central and we felt safe walking in the area day or night. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Goede ligging.
text:
Goed hotel met ruime en schone kamers op een rustige locatie en toch overal dicht bij zeker omdat de metro op 4 minuten lopen is.

Vriendelijke receptie die je altijd met een smile zullen helpen. 
Restaurant bij het hotel (Rare) vonden we tegenvallen, beter aan de overkant naar de Ierse Pub gaan!

Hotel heeft op de roof ook nog een rooftop bar met een view, erg gezellig.

title: Great Staff and Location
text:
One of many small footprint hotels to open in NYC in the past decade or so.
PRO:  Great staff; well appointed rooms with plenty of drawer space, a safe, mini-bar; fast elevators; good location about 6 blocks from Penn Station, near stops on several subway lines, at the north end of Chelsea, so plenty of restaurants and services close-by including a laundromat with wash and fold service across the street. 
CON:  Rooms are small even by NYC standards (e.g. smaller than the Hilton Garden Inn W. 35th St and Hilton Garden Inn Chelsea), no refrigerator in rooms; more noticeable outside noise than other NYC properties; small lobby.

Has a small, but well equipped fitness room. The Rare Bar & Grill steakhouse is in the hotel – has a nice bar and serves a good breakfast (did not have dinner here).  Has rooftop bar which seemed popular.  I suspect some of the noise noted above came from the rooftop bar. 
BOTTOM LINE:  A good choice, but compare prices to other nearby properties.
FOR HILTON HONORS GOLD/PLATINUM MEMBERS:  The breakfast benefit is $20 credit/person at Rare. While there are several hot items available at this amount, it does not cover the buffet (there is no continental buffet option).  Food and service are very good.

title: She said YES to the DRESS!
text: What a great weekend dress shopping for my daughter's wedding dress.   The Hilton was centrally located to a number of the places we went and very close to Kleinfeld where ultimately.... she said yes to the dress!   Great hotel, clean rooms, very helpful staff and a great rooftop bar that has a great view of the city.

title: Hilton?? Nul !!!
text:
Chambre sale et sombre, en face de l'ascenseur malgré notre demande (validée) de calme. Des poubelles sur le palier laissées 12h... Vraiment nul, surtout pour ce prix. 
Ils sont souriants à l'accueil mais n'ont résolu aucun des problèmes.

title: Good hotel
text: I returned to this hotel recently because my first experience was really good.  The staff is nice and helpful and the rooms are clean and modern (enough).  The breakfast buffet was good and reasonably priced for NYC.

title: Grei overnatting, og relativt sentral plassering.
text:
Grei overnatting, og relativt sentral plassering.
Dersom en ønsker å bruke subway til å komme seg rundt i byen er dette hotellet er fint valg. Det er kort vei til rød subway linje, som er rask og har kun to ett stopp (Penn st. 34th. st. før Times Sq. 42th. St.

title: Hilton New York Fashion District
text: My husband and I have stayed at Hilton New York Fashion District hotel numerous times.  The location is perfect for our needs, the staff friendly and accommodating, the room clean and inviting!  Another excellent stay at the hotel!

title: Hilton NYC fashion district
text: Only stayed one night but Great location. Good restaurant on site. Lots of places to eat close by and places to walk too. Not too far from the subway. Nice staff and good accommodations. Great price and value.

title: Average
text: The hotel is nice and in a good area.  The rooms are small.  However, DO NOT venture into the restaurant.  The tip is added to all tickets which translates into horrible service.  I would have found another breakfast spot except it was raining. The food is not good.  I tried to substitute a little fruit for the gross potatoes and they refused...even at an up charge.  I had to ask for more coffee each morning and ask for the ticket in order to leave.  No one once came to check and see how my food was once it arrived.  Why do you force a tip allowing the wait staff to completely ignore the guests?  Seems ridiculous.

title: Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo
text: A New York è sempre difficile trovare un hotel decente a prezzi ragionevoli. Questo credo sia quello che si avvicini di più. Hotel in ottima posizione, a due passi dal Medison, pulito e tenuto in ordine. Personale gentile e disponibile. Consiglio.

title: Birthday
text: Staff and our room was amazing and the rooftop bar exclusively for guests was awesome! Husband and I celebrated our birthdays here in New York and the Hilton was great, housekeeping was amazing too. Would definitely book with Hilton again in the future.

title: Creat hotel close to everything
text: we had an event in Chelsea, so this was a convenient hotel.  It was clean and QUIET.  I had a room on the 4th floor and was a bit afraid it would be noisey, but it was great - no road noise, no elevator noise.  I got a great nights sleep!

title: good value for NYC
text: I stayed in this hotel for two nights on a business trip.  The room more than met my needs and I liked the decor.  The makeup mirror in the bathroom was a nice touch.  The elevators were fast. One thing I liked was that this is not a large hotel and there was never a crowd or wait for the elevators. The only negatives for me were the very small closet and the lack of in-room pay per view movies.  The closet was so small that the ironing board had to fit vertically in front of the hangers. The number of hangers was adequate, thankfully. The luggage rack, also stored in the closet, was about half the normal size. The room did not have a refrigerator per se, but did have an automated mini bar which did not have extra space to put your own items. There were soft drinks and food in the mini bar but no alcohol despite this being offered on the in room menu. You could order food up to your room from the restaurant adjacent to the hotel. I enjoyed my meal at this establishment. I went down to eat in the bar rather than order room service. Good gourmet burgers.

title: Very friendly service by the entire staff
text: Extremely friendly service. You feel really welcome. Rooms are not very big (but that's new york) but very clean and fully functional. Affordable breakfast options also. Subways are very close. We missed the rooftop bar because of the weather, but it is nice that they have it.

title: Very nice
text: I recently spent 5 nights at this hotel. The room very clean & comfortable. The free wifi, rooftop bar & gym added value to my stay.  The view from the rooftop bar is great when the city is lit up of an evening. The location is very good being close to downtown shopping and the Empire State Building.

title: Helpful Staff! Comfortable Beds! Good Location!
text:
On the date that we stayed, this hotel was an excellent value. Our room was large, by NYC standards, bathroom updated, beds comfortable. There was a work desk in the room, plenty of wardrobe and drawer space. My companion was especially enthusiastic about the makeup mirror. The wifi also worked great and we were on a higher floor.

The staff of both hotel and restaurant were helpful. We liked that they allowed us to store luggage in a secured area both several hours prior to check in and several hours after our check out. Especially nice was the Tip Jar on the counter, instead of having to tip the luggage attendants directly. It's not as ackward at having to hand someone a tip, directly.

The location is an easy walk to Penn Station or a couple of subway stations that have good connections. It's proximity to 6th and 7th Ave, make it an easy place to get a ride service or cab. 

Although we stayed on a Sunday night, we walked back to the hotel from about .5 mile away and felt safe in the hotel's neighborhood.

title: Clean proper hotel that is close to subway stations.
text: It takes about 2 minutes to reach to the closest subway stations which is very nice! The room is clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The toilet in the room however was very interesting, it flushes like the toilet on the airplane. Rooftop bar was kinda cool but cocktail selections wasn't many. The neighborhood is already a bit quieter than time square but still you can hear sirens and horns honking all the time.

title: Short trip to NYC
text: This hotel is well situated in the fashion district and was a good mid-point departure for long walks through the city uptown and downtown. This Hilton is a notch below hotels like the Hilton Millenium. It is in a category more like a Hyatt Place or Holiday Inn. Rooms are small but well appointed with excellent bedding. The in-room coffee machine is a plus. Ask for a room on the back side of the hotel. The street side is very noisy. The rooftop bar closed early, but offers a nice view. The staff was friendly and helpful.

title: 立地がよい
text: 立地が良いから値段と比較して良いと思うので何度か利用しているが値段がこれ以上上がれば他でも良いという質

title: Nice hotel for the price.
text:
Really clean and the rooms were great couldn't fault it really. Only thing was it only had dim wall lights so struggled to see what you were writing while sat at the table as the lights were also situated behind you next to the bed and one on the wall near the door and permanently needed to keep the blinds closed because there are office blocks next door and can see straight in.

I know it's new york but still nevertheless. Nice and quiet and really couldn't fault the location as it depends on what you want to do while you are there and how you want to get around.

If it weren't for them little details it would of got a five.

title: All in all an average hotel.
text: First off, the breakfast bar closed really early. It was a clean hotel and the staff was kind. However, my friend had left his stereo and I had left a dust bag for my purse in the room after we had left and neither one of us got our stuff back, which isn't shocking, given that it is New York. In addition, we had requested a room with two queen size beds and we got twin size beds, which wasn't great for sharing.

title: Good hotel with great rooftop bar
text:
Great service to make my room available for a early check-in to accommodate my fresh-up before my 2 PM meeting! The rooms are small but efficient en the beds are good. The rooftop bar (see photo) is great and the mini hamburgers are excellent finger food:)

Value for money in NY.

title: average
text:
For my experience, it did not reach my expectation of Hilton's standard. The room is small and the location is not convenient.
The woman of housekeeping service was rude and complaint my late checkout.

title: Love new york
text: La habitación correcta, las camas muy comodas limpias y grandes la limpieza en otras partes de la habitación como la moqueta cortinas y el mueble del baño deja mucho que desear, esta bien situado zona tranquila, el personal correcto a secas sin más y la habitación donde estábamos entraba frio por el aparato de aire acondicionado aun estando apagado y hacia frío. Si vas en verano supongo que no hay problema!

title: excelente hotel
text:
Pertenece a la cadena del Hilton lo que es una garantía, habitaciones comodas, cama confortable limpieza excelente, dejan todos los días jabón shampoo crema de cuerpo y toallas de más. Excelente funcionamiento del wifi y en el último piso un rooftop  con una vista excelente. Se encuentra muy bien ubicado a 2 cuadras de la estación subte y a 5 de Penn station.Cuenta con frigobar cafetera calefacción frío calor. Excelente la atención del personal y si bien el check in es a las 15 hs las maletas te las guardan sin costo alguno. Lo único que es pequeño es el placard para los que llevan mucha ropa 
Sin duda volvería

title: Very Nice Hotel and Great Staff
text:
I stayed here for 2 weeks while in NYC for work. In a Hilton loyalist but I just cannot bear staying at the Millennium— that property has desperately needed a remodel for years.
Anyhow, I actually found this hotel to be in a great area (Chelsea) and there are subway lines very close by. It’s also not that far to the High Line.
The rooms are not cavernous so don’t expect that but they are decently appointed and I liked the chocolates on the pillow each night!
The staff were very friendly, helpful, and accommodating. I just may stay here again the next time in town.

title: Lovely
text:
I spent a few days at the Hilton Fashion district and found the location perfect.  

The hotel itself was clean with a roof top bar and a restaurant and bar downstairs.

 Everything we ordered was delicious though we only had one meal there as we were spoilt for choice with so many places to eat around.  It’s off 7th Avenue and a walking distance to Penn Station, Madison Square GARDENS.  

There’s a Macy’s store not to far a DSW and some other high street stores dotted around it was also were we caught the tour bus for our sightseeing.

The staff were very friendly and helpful too.  Surplus towels, hot and powerful shower as well.

I did find the room decor a bit dark.  Looked like dusk all the time even on a bright and sunny day.  However,  it’ll definitely be my go to for any trips to NYC.

title: Muy buena opción para visitar NY
text:
Excelente atención y servicio, limpieza. Desde el primero al último minuto todo 10 puntos. 
Está ubicado lo suficientemente cerca para caminar o tomar el subte hasta los lugares claves pero en una zona mucho más tranquila

title: Great staff make for a Great stay
text:
I have stayed at this property on multiple occasions, including last weekend.  While the hotel is showing its age a little bit, the lovely Hilton team makes up for it with their personality and hard work.    We were there for a Peloton Event (indoor cycling) and we were treated so well by the entire staff.  We were a very rambunctious bunch and they handled it all with good humor and great service.   
Well done!

title: Great location!
text: We liked the location because we can usually find weekend on street parking.  It is also quite close to Midtown and the Village for walking/dining purposes.  The staff was very helpful and the room a little larger than many midtown hotel rooms.

title: Lots of little inconveniences
text:
WHERE IT SHINES
+ It's a Hilton, so you know what to expect, more or less. 
+ Modern decor that was relatively new; not dated.
+ Nice bathroom with good shower pressure and bright lighting.
+ Shower enclosure had a 3-inch curb and glass door, so no flood on the bathroom floor.
+ Mini-fridge delivered to my room upon request. 
+ Well located.

WHERE IT FADES
– No wOw! factor
– Modern decor is dark and room is not well lit. My middle (12th) floor room with a back-alley view didn't receive much natural light so, dark decor + dark room = cave, even on sunny days. 
– The in-room refrigerator is a motion activated ($) mini-bar with zero free space and a “No Refunds” sign. It’s for Hilton’s use, not yours.
– There are zero USB ports in the room. The only nod in that direction is an iHome clock radio featuring the long obsolete, 16-pin iPhone connector and no adapter. 
– The narrow yet deep closet is in the darkest corner of the room, far from the lone ceiling light, and without its own interior light. I always needed the flashlight app on my phone to see my clothes. It drove me crazy!
– Wall thermostat is locked and temperature is controlled centrally, like an office building. Too warm? Too bad.

title: Another great weekend at the Hilton
text: We always choose the Fashion District Hilton for our stays in New York. It has a great location, the staff is friendly, the restaurant is good and never too crowded, and the price is reasonable. We stayed on the 16th floor. Not a great view, but a decent sized room, the room service was fast and good, and every staff person did their best to be of help.

title: Bem localizado em região tranquila próximo de metro
text: Hotel novo e bem localizado (2 quadras do metro 28th Station). Atendimento muito cortês e com boa infraestrutura. Tudo funcionou direito. Gostamos bastante e recomendamos. Ponto negativo é a demora nos elevadores. Dependendo do horário e demanda, o tempo de espera pode ser grande.

title: Clean, relatively quiet, good value and nice service
text: For NYC, this is a go to hotel if I just want an easy and reasonably priced hotel. It’s always clean, pretty good size rooms, the people are so nice and you can ask for a quiet room. Not all rooms are quiet, but many are. It’s NYC so for those complaining about noise...honestly, even at a 5 star it’s nearly unavoidable; loudest city in the world! The service was lovely, and in fact, I had a bizarre allergic reaction one night and couldn’t even walk to a pharmacy. The front desk sent someone from the engineering department out to pick up some medication for me. The guy paid out of pocket.  I didn’t have cash, and he couldn’t put it on my room. He literally said don’t worry about it, and it was $25! Of course, the next day I left him the money at the front desk, but the gesture was so kind and really over the top. I had to transfer to another hotel my last night as my plans changed, and the Hilton was booked. It was a terrible experience and so happy for only one night. And that was a more expensive and hipster hotel. Highly recommend, though reluctantly, as I don’t want everyone to find out about this little gem!

title: Noisy, Awful Breakfast, Fraudulent Charge - Never Again
text: I expect my hotel rooms to be clean, comfortable, and quiet.  It was clean and comfortable and I know it is hard to accomplish the "quiet" in NYC but this hotel/area seems more noisy than usual with loud bangs and trucks during the night.  I felt like I was sleeping with the window open.  Strike One.  As a Diamond member, I get a free breakfast, which was good because if I had to pay for this food I would have been outraged.  I ordered the $17 Western Omelette.  It came with no ham, raw peppers/onions, and no cheese.  Basically it was scrambled eggs.  The toast was so dry it was inedible.  Strike Two.  When I got the bill it had a minibar charge on it even though I didn't use the minibar.  I had just checked out and the room couldn't have been serviced in the two minutes it took me to get the bill.  I did call the hotel and they took the charge off right away but where did this charge come from?  Strike Three.

title: An OK hotel on a good location
text:
My wife and I were visiting NewYork for a short break to do some sight seeing and to catch a concert at the Madison Square Gardens.  The hotel was in a good location with Madison Square Gardens, Macy’s and Time Square all within easy walking distance. The reception staff were courteous and helpful as were the other staff that we.encountered.  We did not eat at the hotel as we chose to use a local diner for breakfast and to visit nearby restaurants for dinner.  

All in all this hotel was suitable for our needs and we would recommend to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel that provides clean and comfortable accommodation without the frills.

title: Literally don’t go here
text: Suppose to get corporate discount ... nope not available. Check in ... terrible. Roof top bar ... terrible. Rare bar... terrible. Never had a worse experience. And I’m a diamond. He figure. Go somewhere else.

title: Visiting family in Manhattan
text: The Hilton in Fashion District is close to the train station and was centrally located for our family visit and taking in a Broadway show.  We have stayed here before and were not disappointed. We will stay here again.

title: Rooms Were Flooding
text:
We had to pack up and move rooms at 11:30pm after an air conditioning unit broke and flooded several rooms. The room where the ac unit broke did have a do not disturb sign on it... but it was very clear that there was an issue in that room, the water spilling out from under the door and the condensation from the steam were giveaways. The staff didn't go into the room and shut off the ac unit until another hotel guest and I told the hotel staff that we had pinpointed the issue. When the hotel staff opened up the room, there were several inches of water covering the floor. Several rooms were effected, at least two rooms adjacent to the flooded room were filling with water, as were rooms below the flooding. 

It took about 30 minutes to get a new room - the floor of our room was quickly getting soaked and we were told to move. We were given a new room, and we told that new room keys would be slid under the door for us (they never were). When we got to the new room, the window was open, which was not ideal since it was 42 degrees outside. We were exhausted after having to get out of bed, helping the hotel staff identify the source of the flooding, packing, and moving. We didn't want to move yet again, but it sucked that the new room was ice cold.

The hotel felt outdated and has no frills, and I wasn't a big fan before the flooding issue. We just feel lucky that it wasn't our room that flooded, and that we were able to move to another room. We did receive points to cover our stay the night of the flooding. 

The issue that concerned me is that the hotel staff was slow to react - they hesitated to go into the flooded room even though we could hear water running and there was water flowing from under the doorway.

title: Bel hôtel et très bien situé
text:
Idéalement situé, proche de tout les centres d’intérêt. Nous avons beaucoup apprécié l'amabilité du personnel. Notre chambre était tout à fait à notre convenance avec un seul petit bémol qui est le bruit venant de l'extérieur! les New-yorkais travaillent très tôt!
Le rooftop vaut vraiment le détour.

title: Great place to stay, close to everything
text: Great place to stay, very close to everything. Easy check in and check out. The bathroom and shower were much larger than most places I've stayed in NYC.  My only complaint was that the pillows were the size of throw pillows. Next time I will stay there again but I'll bring my own pillow

title: great stay in heart of chelsea
text: This hotel is in a great location, all local attractions are nearby.  Times sq, empire state building are close by.  There is also a subway station a couple of blocks away so you can get pretty much anywhere.  The room was clean and comfortable, pretty small but hey its NYC.  Staff are super friendly and accommodated all our requests.  The rooftop bar is beautiful and a great addition to this location.  Would stay here again.

title: Great Hotel in Great Location
text:
This hotel is very nice and located in a very convenient location for Chelsea, fashion district, Madison Square Gardens, Empire State Building and the High Line (a few blocks of walking).  The rooms are small but very nice and well equipped with everything you need.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating.  

The restaurant on site is good offering burgers, salads and other entrees.  In addition, the hotel has a roof top bar that I can't comment on as I did not visit it on this trip.

The hotel promotes fixed price transportation service to JFK for $73 or $74 including tolls and tip in a town car.  It's a great option during rush hour when taxi's and Uber/Lyft are applying surge pricing.  However, you should know that it is cash only (found out only after getting to the airport).  Would be nice to know that in advance.

title: It was going well until...
text:
Came here for a long theatre weekend.  The location is fantastic- right in Chelsea, a short walk to many great neighborhoods, including the theatre district.  

Check in was pleasant and easy.  The front desk staff were helpful and pleasant.  Room was comfortable, although housekeeping had the room stifling hot when I walked in.  

Good amount of hot water if you don’t shower during peak times, Sunday morning  was cold!  

The worst thing was the fire alarms went off at 230 in the morning due to a malfunction, and the intercom kept waking people up.  While malfunctions happen, the concerning thing was that NO ONE on the night staff knew what was going on.  It was very evident that none has been trained on operating the fire panel and had no clue what was going on.  They also never communicated to guests standing outside at 3 AM.  We got more info from the fire dept.  Very concerning that it seems there is a lack of training regarding emergency procedures and leadership overnight.  They ended up comping the night(probably for the whole hotel).  While this was a nice gesture, knowing that there is adequate staff in-servicing would be more reassuring for future stays.

title: Fantastic Location, great for business and families
text:
This hotel is in a fantastic location, away from all the Times Square noise but close enough to walk there and see the sites on the way. Excellent bar and restaurants nearby.

Rooms are very clean and comfy beds, wifi is also very good.

Has an amazing rooftop bar with great views, I would definitely stay here again for business and would have no hesitation in booking this for my family.

title: Lovely People Working there
text: Very nice hotel conveniently located.  The room was lovely..but I wanted to call out the fine service.  We moved rooms because we wanted a quiter one, we asked for a fridge, we needed help with a sewing kit, we had to store baggage, order a towncar etc.  You name it, we did it!  even though we were needy guests, everyone was absolutely super and I can highly recommend a stay!  Plus the roof bar is great with friendly staff (including the door guy downstairs and the lady who was running the lift) and super drinks.

title: New York trip X-mas and New Year in Hilton
text: Nice okay easy to reach Hotel in the Fashion district of Manahattan. The Hotel is nice and with the new year a great rooftop party. The Personal is helpfull as seperate persons they do there best. The restaurant on the side is I think a seperate lease. The resaturant was for us a complete desepcion. We had to give our credit card before ordering, they kept it and at the end of your dinner or just drinks you get it back. At our first visit this was not the case, obviously we did not give our credit card to complete strangers. Than for the New Year party they double charged us. Lots of work, finally the great people of the Hilton helpdesk made them return our double charged money (over $700). Overall great hotel with terrible restaurant.And yes, I did get a itchy back from the bed sheets...and yes the answer was: that can happen some times... :-).

title: Excellent hotel
text: Fairly centrally located a few blocks from Penn Station with metro round the corner. Newly refurbished rooms and baths. Fast wifi internet access. Restaurant serves a nice breakfast buffet for 22$ (excluding coffee/tea, tax and service). The roof top bar is a must visit for the sunset view. Good beer and nice drinks and smaller bites for hangry guests

title: Great location!
text: We love this location: it is walkable EVERYWHERE. Staff is very friendly, extremely accommodating. Room is good size for NYC, clean, nice decor. We'll look forward to staying here again, and definitely will recommend to family & friends.

title: Flott hotell med sentral plassering
text: Dette hotellet ligger så og si midt i suppa, og det er bare noen minutter gangavstand til både soho, broadway, madison square, penn station og mer. Rom med helt grei standard (virker som de oppgraderer nå). Har også rooftop bar og restaurant, men vi fikk ikke besøkt disse.

title: Situation intéressante
text:
Nous sommes arrivé vers 20h de l aeroport ....overbooking....nous sommes redirigé aimablement vers un hôtel du groupe . Hampton by Hilton (il a fallu cependat reclamer la prise en charge du transfert). Nuit dans un chambre un peu petite mais bonne literie et au calme avec vue sur la tour one world(plutot sympa).
Retour le lendemain au Hilton ou on nous specifie que pour s excuser du probleme de la veille, ils nous offrent les petit dejeuners sur les 3 nuits restantes. J'ai apprécié le geste et les en ai remercié. 
1ere surprise en decouvrant notre chambre devant les ascenseurs....comme toute personne habituée aux hotel je sais que c est une des pires chambre au niveau sonore.  Ca n'a pas raté avec les aller et venues des clients et une tres mauvaise insonorisation au niveau de la porte. Nous avons entendu nos voisins aller uriner et tirer la chasse d eau pendant 3 nuits......plus les travaux nocturnes dans la rue car pas d insonorisation aux fenetres. L hôtel n est certe pas responsable des bruits extérieurs mais l est de son insonorisation. Les vacances doivent etre reposante parrait il...nuit tres courte au final ....
Nous etions clairement mieux dans l'autre chambre d hotel.
Chambre correct mais pas du niveau Hilton, sdb correct et classique, bonne literie.
Nous avons utilise la petite piece de sport mais qui a quand meme l interet d etre la avec plusieurs materiels de bonne qualite.

Rapport qualite prix insatisfaisant

title: Great value!
text: We spent a week in New York and stayed at Hilton Fashion District. The hotel was within walking distance (with luggage) from Penn Station and there is also a subway station close to the hotel. The room had an ok size and was nice and clean. There was also a minibar, safe deposit box and a hairdryer at the room. The air-conditioning didn't work when we arrived, but the front desk was able to fix that within five minutes. The free wifi at the hotel worked fine for normal internet use. The location of the hotel was very good. The street in front of the hotel was quiet and the subway station nearby was very handy. There were also plenty of places to have breakfast in the vicinity. The wardrobe in the room was very small, but we managed. The sound-isolation between the rooms were very good, but the sound-isolation from the corridor could have been better. Thankfully we had a room some distance away from the elevators so weren't bothered by noise from the elevators. The beds were very comfortable so we woke up fresh and rejuvenated every morning. So, would we stay here again? Absolutely, but we would ask for a room away from the elevators.

title: Goed hotel, uitstekende locatie!
text:
Goed hotel in Chelsea op de hoek met 7th avenue. De locatie vind ik uitstekend, het ligt bijzonder centraal in Manhattan en je bent net ver genoeg weg van de gekte op Times Square. Metro ligt om de hoek. Loop je de straat uit richting Madison Square Park dan kom je diverse leuke restaurants tegen. Leuk park/plein ook Madison Square park, met het iconische flatiron building.  De kamers zijn redelijk ruim en netjes/schoon, de badkamer had iets groter mogen zijn. In mijn beleving is het echter meer een Doubletree dan Hilton hotel. Dit geldt  eigenlijk voor alles, de bar, het restaurant en de kamers. Zelfs de toiletartikelen horen bij Doubletree (Crabtree and Evelyn) in plaats van Peter Thomas Roth bij Hilton. 

Probeer een kamer op een hoge verdieping te boeken,  dan heb je een mooi uitzicht op Manhattan. De kamernummers  ..5 t/m ..11 op elke verdieping  kijken uit richting Central park, de overige kamernummers richting lower Manhattan, mits je een kamer hoog genoeg hebt. 

Het personeel in heel het hotel is bijzonder vriendelijk. In de bar is het echter meerdere keren fout gegaan, bestellingen worden niet, of niet compleet gebracht.  Of ze gaan nadat je besteld hebt eerst uitgebreid met elkaar kletsen en pas daarna je drinken maken. Dit zijn wij niet gewend en komt niet overeen met de service die we uit Europa gewend zijn. Ook vragen ze continu om je creditcard en/of legitimatie, hierdoor voel je je als gast van het hotel absoluut niet gewaardeerd. Op basis van je naam kunnen ze je uitstekend verifiëren met je kamer. 

Ik zou dit hotel zeker aanbevelen en als ik zelf weer in NY een hotel boek, dan zal ik het hotel zeker overwegen. Wellicht als Doubletree dan….

title: New York pas au top
text:
Hormis l hôtesse d accueil agréable ( dame parlant Français) l hôtel n est pas à recommander. Hôtel très vieux, douche pas fonctionnel.
Et je ne parle pas de la vue .. vous avez une vue sur un mur... pas du tout ce qu annonce le site de l hôtel.
Bref, déçue ...nous devons tenir 6 jours 😩
Je m abstiendrai de photos pour cet avis.

title: I Love New York
text:
Pro's 
- Location is great (Couple blocks from MSG) 
- Friendly Staff 
- Rooftop Bar 5/5 Stars 
- Decent Price for Room 

Con's 
- Room was a bit Small 
- My view was right across from an Office so there wasn't much privacy

title: Would never go back, awful experience.
text: I liked some of my past experiences in Hilton Hotels located in different cities, but definitely avoid staying in Hilton Fashion District in New York. Rooms are small, staff are impatient and rude, carpets are dirty, there is always noise coming from other rooms and outside and so on. Might consider staying in other Hilton Hotels but not this one, not again.

title: Nice hotel for tourists
text: Nice rooms - what you come to expect from a Hilton.  Be prepared for a really busy lobby area as it is close to Times Square and there are a lot of tourists.  Large hotel with lots of rooms, so you may also be in for a great view on the upper floors.

title: Great location
text: I had a perfectly nice stay at this hotel. The location is good (walking distance to Midtown, Penn Station, MSG, Chelsea, the Village, etc) and the service was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are a good size and were nicely furnished and were always clean. I would recommend this hotel when the prices are reasonable.

title: Great service
text: I’m a frequent visitor to this property - love the location! Easy checkin process, and reasonably sized rooms for NYC. Shoutout to Chitra in housekeeping! Such a pleasant and dedicated team member, who works hard to ensure we have a terrific stay!

title: Perfect hotel close to Amtrak, the Village and other destinations
text:
Yes Hilton is a chain but it was very accommodating to a person with accessibility issues. 
We stayed a few nights and had everything we needed in the hotel. The concierge was helpful and helped us get tickets on short notice for a play. I thought this hotel was perfect (for us)!
I will definitely stay there again.

title: New York Trip
text: I had such a great time at the Hilton Fashion District. The front desk staff, (Mily, Caroline, and Martha) made our group feel welcomed and were very helpful. The location is great and I highly recommend this hotel for anyone.

title: Centrale, ottimo rapporto prezzo qualità
text: Albergo centralissimo, a due passi da tutto e soprattutto a 300 metri circa a piedi dal Flatiron Building, colazione a Eataly Flatiron e via in ufficio, prezzi buoni per essere in centro a NY, pulito, ottimo materasso, silenzioso, Wi-Fi ovunque, per chi vuole c’è anche la palestra, unico difetto stanze un po’ piccole ma se sei a NY non starai in albergo tutto il giorno, o no?

title: Very comfortable, quiet room.
text: We got a great deal on Travelzoo for a Sunday-Tuesday stay. We arrived before check-in so they stored our bags and then took them to our room because we were returning late in the evening. The front desk staff was very pleasant and professional. We had a room up on the 18th floor where it was very quiet, even in close proximity to the elevators. I'd have given them five stars, but the pillows were a little hard for me and my husband. But that's the only slightly negative thing I have to say. The cappuccino was delicious in their restaurant, Rare, as well. Definitely would stay there again.

title: February Weekend Getaway
text:
We recently spent an enjoyable weekend at the Hilton New York Fashion District. Check-in was handled efficiently by the friendly desk staff. Our room was on the 21st floor across from the elevators. 

We were pleased with our room's layout and amenities--it was small, but well designed and met all of our needs. The space was clean, the bed was comfortable, the room temperature was easily adjusted to our preferences. The city view from our window was unexpectedly impressive. We've stayed in NYC many times--often with a view of a brick wall or something equally uninteresting. In this case, we were pleased to find a gorgeous city skyline with a view of the Empire State Building--a very nice plus! 

The only downside--at one point we could clearly hear the conversation of a group who was laughing in the hall right outside of our room. This could have become a big problem if it had occurred more frequently, but fortunately it only happened one time. (Note to maintenance - there was a noticeable air gap at the edge of the door which probably lets sound travel quite easily.) 

The hotel's location turned out to be very convenient in several ways. We enjoyed the on-site restaurant for breakfast, where we opted to eat twice. We ordered from the menu. Everything was tasty, and there was a nice selection. We also visited the ale house directly across the street in the evenings, which was a very convenient location. The subway station was only a short walk from the hotel. There were numerous additional options for breakfast, coffee, or dining within walking distance. 

Based on the rate we paid, we were extremely happy with this choice and would not hesitate to stay again.

title: Just fine
text: Nothing to write home about. Stayed here on a business trip. Room was small, but comfortable enough. Good iron and hairdryer. Just dont expect the staff to go out of their way to help you. Realized I forgot a cellphone charger. Saw the alarm clock radio had a dock. Hoped it would also charge my phone. No luck. Called down to the front desk and asked if they had a charger. All I got was a no sorry. Seriously, i assume people just like me forget their chargers on a daily basis. You serious down offer them for rent or purchase? Your concierge doesnt have one? You personally dont have one that I could borrow if I charged my phone at the front desk. Way to help me problem solve at 11pm. I won't be staying here again.

title: Buon hotel
text: Hotel comodissimo per visitare New York poco distante da tutte le attrazioni camere non enormi e moquette sul pavimento che non sempre facile da pulire.. Comunque mi sono trovato bene non sono riuscito però a provare tutte le comodità dell'hotel.

title: Above average hotel in the fashion district
text:
If you are a Hilton Honors member and need to stay in the fashion district or Korea Town, this hotel is above average. They renovated the hotel about 7-8 years ago, when they turned it into a Hilton property, so the rooms are relatively modern. 
The restaurant and the bar are decent, with good drinks and food. They have changed the breakfast policies for HH members and I really don't like them: any BF charge up to $20 is on the house, but the breakfast beet is 22 plus tip (they charge the tip upfront). I hope they reverse this policy!

When open, the rooftop bar (terrace and covered) offers excellent views or both north and south parts of the city.

title: Nieve en Manhattan
text: Un muy buen hotel, habitacion comoda y baño amplio. Falta espacio de closet ya que en la pieza para tres personas no habia lugar suficiente ni para dejar las maletas. El personal muy amable y excelente ubicación

title: Excellent emplacement, accueil formidable
text:
Excellent emplacement, pas loin de times square.
Un personnel aimable et à l'écoute ( une hôtesse parle bien le français si besoin ).
Les chambres sont confortables et très propres, la literie est de très bonne qualité.

title: Disappointed
text: I booked this hotel for a work trip, as I normally stay at the Double Tree in Jersey City & have had pleasant experiences with other Hilton properties. The hotel itself is in a good location & had mostly positive reviews on Google (4.1/5). The staff was very friendly upon arrival & professional. Understanding that you're in mid-town NYC, it's going to be noisy, there was construction going on at a lot 2 doors down. The construction continued until about 3-4 AM in the morning. Not the hotel's fault but they should complain based on construction permits & noise ordinances. Additionally, the sheets in the room were very scratchy & likely needed to be thrown away. The rooms are mostly outdated to begin with. While I'll likely stay at another Hilton, I likely won't return to this property.

title: Awesome Hotel
text: Awesome Hotel.  Great customer service and clean rooms.  The staff was very friendly and gave great restaurant referrals.   I was nervous about traveling to New York but they made our stay very comfortable.

title: Average stay
text: My stay was average at best staff was friendly. There are a lot of places within walking distance. Beware of additional fees. Was offered early check-in through booking which the hotel had to approve they offered the check-in based on availability but never metioned that it would be a nominal fee. Though it wasn't really much it just would have been great to know prior to arrival.

title: It was great!
text:
The room was clean, and situated at a super convenient location.  The restaurant downstairs, Rare was really good as well..  
The only complaint I have is that the employee (shorter fellow) who took our luggage into the storage room for the day was not very friendly.  He really looks like he dislikes his job.

title: Perfectly fine; nothing special
text: Have stayed here twice, both times it’s been just fine. The rooms have little things that are a little old or don’t work well, but the important stuff all works fine. But, nothing special. Staff are friendly.

title: Wonderful stay, Incredible staff!
text: I truly enjoyed this hotel!  It’s really centrally located with easy access to Madison Square Garden.  The hotel and rooms are immaculate but it’s the staff the truly makes the hotel shine.  The wait staff at Rare for breakfast, the Bartenders at the Rare bar in the evening were truly exceptional.  The front desk crew was professional, engaging and truly made me feel welcomed.  This was one of the best Hilton properties that I have stayed in.  The city can be a tad bit noisy in the morning, but this little inconvenience was overshadowed by an overall outstanding Hilton stay!!

title: Great location with great rooms
text: This small hilton in chelsea area is great for quick in and out. I usually stay at the Hilton New York which is huge and it can take 5-10 mins to get out of the hotel. This hotel is in a quiet lane and their is no traffic noise on any floor. I would stay here again.

title: excellent trip
text: It is a beatifull hotel whith situated in the center of Manhattan / NY. My room was enough big with comfortable bed. There are coffee-machine, iron, iron-desk besides standard things. I find one flaw - it is a view from window to the wall of other building.

title: Perfect location for girls trip!
text: The Hilton in the NYC Fashion District is in a wonderful location for walking. It is only a few blocks to Macy’s and shopping in Herald Square and we always felt very safe. It’s also only a few blocks to The Highline which was a new adventure for us. We even walked down to The Village area and then over to Chelsea Market. The staff was very helpful and super friendly. We ate breakfast every morning (Hilton Gold perk!) and it was a great menu full of options. Our waitress was a delight! The drinks in the bar were also very tasty and appetizers were yummy and plentiful. We would definitely return!

title: Great Hotel
text: We stayed here for the weekend and the hotel is friendly, clean and convenient. Great if you want to walk the city in either direction and convenient to NYU and Union Square. The room was very comfortable for two people.

title: Renewed my faith in Hilton
text:
My stay at the Hilton Fashion District was excellent. I had given up faith in the Hilton brand after bad experiences in NYC and Italy.
The assistance with some issues and changes by Christine from the front desk were very well appreciated.  Felt like being an Honors member was actually worth something. Great Service all around. Excellent location to get just about anywhere.

title: Great for NYC weekend getaways
text: Stayed here Friday-Sunday. Picked it to be close to the Peloton studio, but wound up being central to all of our weekend activities. Rooms are a good size, especially in NYC. Nice staff. Comfortable beds, good bathroom, in-room coffee. Coffee/tea shops nearby, as well as a Whole Foods. Neighborhood is quiet on the weekends. No complaints.

title: City Visit
text:
This hotel was definitely a good choice for our recent family trip to NYC. It was located close to Penn station, major attractions but set back away from too much chaos. 

We were able to do most of our travel on foot, which was nice, and also a central location so UBER wasn't too much of a cost when needed!

The room was clean, the staff was wonderful and the hotel was beautiful. They also have a luggage hold for if you check out before you're done in the city!

Thank you!

title: Business hotel near Penn Station and subway
text: This Hilton is in the Fashion District - close to Penn Station and subway stations. It is a fairly short walk to Time Square. The restaurant and bat in the hotel are very good. The security is great and the room are decent size and clean.

title: Excellent weekend stay with perfect location
text: Stayed this past weekend with my wife for our 30th anniversary. Arrived at 9 AM and received call at 945 AM that rooms was ready. We were on 18th floor and had very nice view. Room was spotless and team members were extremely friendly. They have a nice restaurant and great rooftop lounge/bar. Hotel is in the perfect location and very close walk to Penn Station for train back home. Times Square is very close and you are mid point to many locations. As Hilton Honors we always stay at Hilton branded properties - This is one of their top properties . We will absolutely return when heading back to NYC. Great job Hilton. Thank you

title: dobra poloha
text: Velmi slusny a cisty hotel v principe za dobru cenu a na vynikajucom mieste. Hned za rohom je 5guys a hlavne par blokov je madison square garden, metro, vsetko na skok. odporucam a isiel by som tam zas.

title: Event stay
text: Hotel was fine asks for the area, price was very good.  Found the good inn the hotel bar and restaurant to be excellent.  A little pricey, but worth it.  Clean rooms, don't plan too check inn before the allotted time, every time I stay here, I have to wait to check in...other than that, excellent stay.

title: Much Like a College Dorm: Tiny Rooms, Questionable Cleanliness
text: I stayed here based on a recommendation from colleagues, specifically because of location.  Based on my experience, I would not stay here again.  The lobby is tiny and cramped, however the staff is pleasant and accommodating.  Each floor is very small, so every room hears the elevator in the tiny hallways.  The rooms are extremely tiny and barely adequate for one.  The bedspread was scary stains on it, which was outright disgusting to say the least.  The ventilation system is loud, waking you up each time it turns on.  The bathroom is tiny, with a shower that is barely large enough to shower in.  Cruise ship showers are larger.  The mirror in the bathroom had optical distortions, which was interesting as well.

title: Just like home in NYC
text: Arrived tired and sick. But staff at the Hilton made me feel special and cared for.  Room service for breakfast, tea service was phenomenal.  Very timely with awesome food! Thank you! One day resting and other 3 working.  Enough time to to get me back on my feet!  Thank you!

title: Good location in Midtown, and nice gym.
text:
Stayed four nights for business and chose it for location nearby the office. The rooms were pretty descent size and aircondition work well (it was very cold in New York -20C /-4F)
Not far from Chelsea, Madison Square Park and a lot of good restaurants and bars to chose from. (Belgian Beer Cafe).
I like to run and always try to book hotels that has a descent gym.  And the gym has 2 treadmills, one step machine, a bike, some weights and multi gym.

Order dinner from roomservice (and the friendliness was not much to talk about, just took orders, and couldn't wait to hang up). So a better option is to dine in the restaurant Rare in the same building.

title: Excellent
text:
Wonderful stay in this prime location Hilton. Walking distance to everything you could possibly need. Friendly, courteous staff, immaculate clean facility, swanky rooftop bar. The rooms are small as it is NYC; however well laid out and Cozy. 
I generally choose Hilton for the Honors rewards program, and I generally enjoy my stay. Especially their new app. 
Cheers

title: good hotel in the heart of Manhattan
text: The hotel is new, the interior is fresh, room is OK, relatively new furniture, the bathroom and toilet are new. the hotel staff was friendly, of the sensors of the door locks in the rooms should be checked because they either are not sensible or the system is not working properly.

title: pessima esperienza
text:
siamo stati in questo hotel dal 22 dicembre al 5 gennaio , l'albergo è un lontanissimo parente dagli altri Hotel Hilton europei , stanza molto piccola , in stanza avevamo solo 3 cassetti e un'anta piccola per mettere tutti i vestiti .
Stanza  irrespirabile , problema con i riscaldamenti troppo vecchi , un'aria cosi secca che ogni 30 minuti avevamo bisogno di alzarci per bere , abbiamo fatto notare questo in reception , ci è stato risposto che il problema era in tutte le stanze e dipende dall'impianto vecchio di riscaldamenti . 

Problema incredibile , io soffro di allergia alla polvere , e ogni notte era una sofferenza incredibile  , decidiamo quindi di pulire la stanza personalmente , spostando il letto , abbiamo trovato una situazione mai vista nella mia vita , il tappeto sotto il letto era coperto da uno strato di 3 cm di polvere ,a questo punti arrabbiatissimi , chiamiamo la cameriera che in fretta si mette a pulire sotto il letto . 

in 15 notti ,
le lenzuela , le copertene e  le fodere NON sono mai state cambiate .
la cameriera si limitava solo nel cambiare le tovaglie , sistemare le cremine del bagno e a rifare il letto , MAI una pulizia  della camera , che dal primo giorno è rimasta inpolverata .
un hilton di bassa qualità che si salva solo per la posizione

title: Not the Hilton feeling
text:
The location of this hotel is quite nice and there is absolutely nothing wrong with it but doesn't live up to the "Hilton experience". The lobby is small and crowded and we had to spend quite some time waiting by the lifts. The rooms are very standard and small as you'd expect in a Manhattan facility. 

Breakfast was quite expensive and ok but nothing that added anything extra to your hotel experience. 

Assuming this hotels sells by it's location. There is nothing wrong with it but keep your expectations moderate.

title: Travel hotel in NY great location and view
text: This hotel is located in fashion district between 6 and 7 avenue. 15 minutes walk to times square. From our room we had an amazing view on the empire state building. Great place to stay for visiting NY

title: Holiday
text: Cheeky visit to new york and stayed. At this. Lovely hilton. Dont normally enjoy hilton but this did nit dissapoint and maybe turned my head. Will deffinately return and hope the service is fantastic again

title: Holiday
text:
Stayed for 4 nights as a 60th Birthday treat from my husband.  My son and partner also travelled with us.  Check in was quick. Day we arrived was my husband's birthday and on entering our room was pleasantly surprised to find a bottle of champagne and a greetings card for him, compliments of the hotel. Also my son and his partner received a bottle in their room aswell.  Room was small but adequate with everything we needed. Complimentary toiletries and tea and coffee. Hairdryer and iron provided, also a mini bar but we didn't use this. Ate breakfast in hotel once during our stay. It was okay. Plenty of places to eat out and about. Highly recommend Ellen's Stardust Diner, solely for the experience of singing waiters and waitresses.
My son and partner got engaged, whilst in New York. They were further surprised with flowers, balloons and bottle, in their room, again courtesy of hotel. Throughout our stay, staff very friendly and helpful. Room cleaned daily. 
We thoroughly enjoyed staying at this hotel and wouldn't hesitate staying again.

title: Tranquillo
text: Non si trova proprio in una posizione centrale però ha fermate metro nelle vicinanze camera abbastanza confortevole ma non particolarmente pulita (sotto i letti l'aspirapolvere non si passa) comunque nella norma

title: Good Location for what we were looking to do
text: Enjoyed the place and the staff was warm and welcoming. I found the rooms a tad small but what can you expect from a hotel in new york. If you're doing things in the area this is a good option vs stayin higher mid-town

title: Great place
text:
Great hotel to stay in the city. Bed very comfortable. Awesome hot water for a shower. Yes it is compact but very efficient. 
The downside was the cold weather. The cold was coming through the room window and the sliding front doors were not working so the restaurant door was working but not a great weather baffle. But I would add that these concerns only really cause a problem when it is like 10 degrees outside...
Coffee maker worked well. The housekeepers were friendly and helpful. The front desk was awesome.

title: Comfortable stay
text: This hotel is in a nice location. It is 2 streets away from a subway station making it easy to get around. On the whole the staff were friendly and helpful. We were missing hot water on 2 mornings but we were compensated for the inconvenience.

title: Great location but average room.
text: We were a family of four staying for one night. The location (Chelsea) was great. Many restos and coffee shops around (Chipotle and Whole Foods). The beds were comfortable enough. No noise coming from the street as we had an office building as our view.  Downside :  shower in our room was bizarre. You had to reach in to turn it on and a glass wall was blocking the faucet which made it really hard to adjust the temperature before getting in. I'm not sure why most hotels have not switched to handheld showerheads to avoid these problems. The room was quite dark and even with all the lights on you cannot get proper lighting. I don't know how housekeeping can even get the room cleaned with so little light. That would explain why there were forgotten socks in the closet.

title: Friendly service, excellent location
text:
If anyone asks you where this hotel is, say Chelsea.  No one calls this area "The Fashion District."  :)

Great location. Nice, clean hotel.  Rooms are a bit on the small side, but that is common for rooms in Manhattan.  Make sure you know what type of bed you're booking.  Don't just assume you'll get a queen or king if you book a standard room.  

The staff was very friendly and helpful.  We discovered not long after checking into our room that there was an infant next door to us that really enjoyed screaming.  A lot.  Mily was extremely helpful and offered to switch us to a different room.  We felt like valued customers.  It was a very positive experience.

title: Excellent location!
text: We've been to NYC well over a dozen times: this was our first time at the Hilton Fashion District. We'd definitely stay here again.  The location was truly perfect: within 5-7 minutes of five different subway lines, tons of markets and eateries, and out of the way-touristy parts of towns.  We could get to Theater District in less than 15 min, up to Lincoln Center in less than 25.  Staff was friendly; rooms were clean and fairly spacious; and rates decent.

title: Is This Really A Full Servic e Hilton
text: From check in to check out, my experience at  hotel was not what expected from a full service Hilton.  Checking in on a cold and snowy Saturday, I was told, by a very apathetic person at check in, that I would get a call when my room was available.  That call never came. My Hilton Gold Honors Status was never acknowledged, my room, which was supposed to be an upgrade, was interior with a view of a brick wall.. shall I go on?  I am puzzled by the better than average reviews.  This was not the case in my situation.  From the unwelcoming check in to the invoice at the end that was not the right size for the envelope that was handed to me, everything was subpar.  Hilton sends a survey a day or two after check out.  I gave my honest opinion and was contacted by a member of the hotel staff who stated they would review my comments with the hotel's Executive Team.  That was over two weeks ago and I am still waiting for a response.. Never again!!!

title: Comfortable and enjoyable stay!
text:
We arrived at the hotel at around 1pm, and were allowed to check in early which was a bonus after a flight from London! The staff on the desk were always friendly and helpful. The rooms were a good size for NY, were lovely and clean, with a nice view of the Empire State Building. The beds were soooo comfortable, I slept even better than I do at home! The coffee machine in the room was great as well, and restocked everyday. There is a mini bar in the room, although pretty high prices so we didn't use it!
The location was also very good, with plenty of places to eat and drink nearby. We would recommend Malibu for a good value, large breakfast! Also close by to 2 subway stations making it very easy to get around, and a short walk from madison square garden.
Would definitely return to this hotel if I'm ever back in NYC.

title: Hidden charges and uncomfortable beds!  Go somewhere else!
text: We are HHonors members.  First problem - received email invitation to check-in and pick room day before arrival. I clicked to do that - was given map of rooms available - not many left, but I picked one.  Get here and my bill is $100 higher than I agreed when making original reservation online.  Now I have to go argue with them about it, but I'm betting they will say I picked a high floor.  For $50 more per night?  But when I checked in online, I never agreed to any higher charges.  MISLEADING!  Can't wait to hear what they say, but seriously, I hate that I have to go hassle with the front desk instead of enjoy my vacation!  Second problem - the beds, at least in room 1210, are horrible.  My arm actually fell asleep and this morning my back is killing me!  There is no free breakfast, not even continental, and slow internet (unless you want to upgrade that for another $14 per day!).  This is picky, but the tissues are poor quality (like in the cheapest hotels), even the shampoo bottle was only 1/2 full. It's easy to get more, but again, this is supposed to be a luxury hotel, right?  It IS convenient to Penn Station, but too far south to walk to many attractions like Rockefeller Center or Central Park and too far north to walk to Battery Park or the financial district, so now you'll need to spend even more money on taxis to get anywhere.

title: En el corazon de Manhattan
text: Fue un hospedaje muy cómodo, la habitación estuvo fabulosa, las almohadas son demasiado cómodas y no tengo ninguna queja del lugar, todo muy bien, lo único es que no nos incluía el desayuno, fuera de eso estuvo espectacular... Me volvería a hospedar ahí cada vez q vuelva a ir a NY!

title: Nice Stay and Great Location
text: It was our first time to stay at this Hilton location but we will definitely consider for future stays in NYC.  Liked the location a lot...plenty of restaurants near by and it was always easy to get a taxi.  Staff was professional and friendly.  Felt more like a nice boutique hotel.

title: Good location near Madison Square Garden. Poor Lifts and Customer Service and late charge imposed.
text:
Book this hotel when I book a flight from Bermuda to New York. I had always preferred to stay in Hilton in my travels but will likely think otherwise after this.

First of all, the lifts were slow/congested and I have to wait 10mins to get down from 12 floor. Secondly, when I checked out on 26 December, I was late for 2 hours and I was informed that I will be imposed a late charge ($75?) even though the check in time for others was 3pm. 

Anyway, I was running late for my flight and can't be bothered to argue with the service staff and just need my key to be operational again. After I bring down my luggage and returned the keys, there was no mentioned about the late charge nor was I offered a receipt which in my mind was terrible service. At the very least, I should be offered the receipt or for it to be sent electronically.

This is the first time I was imposed a late charge by Hilton for running late and never had that experience when I stayed Hilton in Asia.  I am a  HHonours Member who should have some slight discretion on the late charge when that is one of the benefits of the membership.

The only good thing about this hotel is that it is a stone throw from Madison Square Garden if you are catching an event which I did on Christmas day on the NBA match between New York Knicks and the Sixers. Room is reasonably spacious and clean.

Overall this is the worse Hilton experience for me

title: A nice hotel but be prepared for $200 hidden (but refundable) fee
text: The hotel was pleasant with a nice coffee machine in the room to use free of charge. When we checked in we were asked for  $200 upfront insurance for any damage caused to the room refundable 3-5 working days after the visit. Had to exchange more money in order to pay this.  It may well have been in the smallprint somewhere though so I can only blame myself on that.

title: Un hôtel agréable très bien situé
text:
J'ai séjourné pendant 2 nuits dans cet hôtel pour un déplacement professionnel. Il est très bien placé au centre de New York proche du FlatIron. La chambre dans la quelle j'ai dormi était rénovée avec un lit très confortable et une salle de douche très fonctionnelle. La chambre était plutôt petite avec un vis à vis très important. Surtout l'insonorisation n'est pas terrible on entend ses voisins comme si on partageait la chambre avec eux.
Côté petit déjeuner le buffet est sympa sans plus on doit pouvoir trouver meilleur dans le quartier mais je n'ai pas cherché.
La réception est accueillante et serviable. Je n'ai pas payé ma chambre directement je ne peux donc pas juger du rapport qualité prix.

title: Value for money
text: Not the most spacious Hilton, but for the convenient location in midtown Manhattan it is certainly good value at the price.  Room was clean; restaurant was very good for breakfast, acceptable for dinner.

title: Great location
text: I was very impressed with the hotel location and the friendly customer service. The food at Rare was outstanding. It is very convenient to the subway and restaurants. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Great hotel for this area of Manhattan
text: I have stayed in this area of Manhattan multiple times and this is one of my favorite hotels.  The rooms are larger than most in the area and the hotel is clean and updated.  The elevators are quick (which is a big deal for hotels in this area).  The rooftop bar is also nice for a quick drink at the end of the day.  The staff has always been friendly and helpful.

title: 5 night stay in December 🇺🇸 🗽
text:
A decent hotel, in a good location. Situated a short walk (10mins) from Macy’s, Empire State Building and Maddison Square Gardens (basketball etc). A bit longer walk to Times Square, but still walkable (20 minutes). 20 minute walk to Chelsea Market & 10 minutes Walk to the High Line. 

For Battery Park, Central Park, Wall Street and 9/11 Memorial, subway is recommended. Nearest one is one block away, a 5 minute walk. Within walking distance there are shops, cafes, fast food places and places for breakfast. The area is fine and well placed for walking to attractions, but very busy. Our room facing the road (16th floor) was a little noisy during the busy hours outside. Ask for inside facing room if don’t like noise. The views are poor anyway, so you won’t be missing much. I think if you are looking for an area that’s a little less busy, more classy and you don’t mind a 10 minute subway ride in to mid town, then Central Park area is where we would recommend.

The hotel is about an hour’s drive from JFK airport. Use the yellow cabs at the taxi rank. Fixed fee of $52, + tolls (I think it was $6.50 for the tunnel) and then any tip you wish to give. 

Now the hotel is fairly business like. It’s situated very close to 7th Avenue. The lobby is small, but due to the glass front, allows lots of light in. But what more do you need in a lobby then a check in desk and lifts. There is also a restaurant (fairly large) within the hotel if you want to eat there. Rooftop bar, which we didn’t experience. Appears out of the 3 lifts in the hotel, one is dedicated to the rooftop bar when it opens. If wish to us it, have to return to lobby to get lift back up, no matter what floor your room is on. Breakfast wasn’t included in our room rate and is an extra. Free (basic) WiFi. Free maps of the city. Luggage storage after check out.

The rooms were fine. Clean, comfortable and all we needed for our 5 night stay. Large bed & comfy. Safe to use for valuables. Desk with chair. TV. Mini bar (charges to your account when remove items), free bottled water on our first day, iron & ironing board, coffee making facilities (no tea), wardrobe, chest of drawers and bedside drawers / lights. Bathroom was fine too. Clean. Fresh towels daily. No bath, but walk in shower.  Hairdryer provided. The rooms are quite small, but seems to be standard for NYC. Was still large enough for the two of us and large suitcases, but not spacious. We found the interior lighting very poor. Was fine during daylight hours, but during hours of darkness, the lighting in the room was rubbish. The heating unit was also quite loud when it started up. 

Staff were good. Mostly helpful, friendly and happy. Provided good service. One fault with the staff, is the cleaner that decided to start hovering outside our room at 6am. Not cool! Allowed us an extra hour in the room after our check out time (1pm) on request. 

I would recommend avoiding the hotel’s own airport transfer service. We got ripped off. Wish we took a yellow cab now. The sign on the desk states fixed rate of $73 from hotel to JFK. I was told by staff this includes tip and tolls.
