This is more than a yellow cab (fixed airport price of $52), but when you add toll and tip, it seemed acceptable so i didn’t have to faff about hailing a yellow cab. Staff told me a yellow cab would be between $60 and $70, depending on the taxi meter, which is a lie, as it’s a fixed price to the airports, as set by the local government. Clearly wanted me to use the hotel airport transfer service. 

Firstly, the driver spent the whole journey on his phone. Secondly he took a detour around the tunnel, to avoid the toll (which was paid for in our fee) increasing our journey time to around 90 minutes. Thirdly he was nipping in and out of traffic, coming on and off the main roads to kangaroo jump traffic queues, fourthly he charged me $80 when I paid, claiming ‘tax’. He was quite insistent I paid cash, but I didn’t have any so this wasn’t an option. I challenged the fare, but he was adamant $80 was the price. Not wanting to get in an argument over $7, I paid this. This complaint is currently being managed by the hotel reception manager, but not yet resolved. 

***avoid the hotel airport transfer service***

Overall, this hotel was great for what we needed. Clean, comfortable, safe and a good location. Very pricey (£200 a night) and definetely not value for money, but it was xmas time and all hotels were expensive.

title: Convenient place to Stay
text:
We (family of three including a toddler) stayed four nights in December to take in Christmas sites around New York.

Pros:
Location - while not a whole lot in the immediate vicinity, it is easy to catch at least 3 subway lines within 2-3 blocks, and also walk 15 minutes to MSG, Penn Station, Empire State Building, Harolds Square.
Rooms - Were good size by NYC standards and in great shape.
Staff - We didn't have a whole lot interactions with the staff, but check in and check out were quick and efficient and room was incredibly well cleaned/maintained each day.
Value - Booked about 9 months in advance with free cancellation.  Price was around $215 a night (pre-tax) which I found to be a bargain as I saw prices for comparable hotels in the $350 range.

Cons:
Very little negative to say, just a few minor quips.  This is a bit more of a business hotel than something for a family vacation, but we knew this going in and made it worked.  The rooms have large showers as opposed to tubs; our 4 year old thought she was being such a grown up learning to shower instead of having a bath.  Also, no breakfast at the hotel, which we were fine with; ended up going to Whole Foods (two blocks away) each morning to pick up milk, juice, fresh pastries, etc.
-Wifi was pay per use.  Did not end up using it, but with smart phones, it was not really needed.

title: My favorite place to stay in NYC
text: I stay at this hotel 10 times a year (as long as they are not booked out).  The staff always has a warm welcome and make me feel like family.    The same is true for the breakfast team!    The rooms are very clean and comfortable too!   I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Wonderful Staff and Location
text: Found this location on the Hilton website. Did not know about this hotel as I usually stay in mid-town or above. Wonderful find. Small boutique atmosphere. Staff were friendly, efficient and so helpful. Restaurant in lower level was convenient with excellent food and service. Felt very comfortable being solo. Definitely would stay here again especially since location so close to Madison Square Garden.

title: Hilton Fashion District
text: This is a great, safe location. The hotel room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The front desk associates were very friendly and informative. We did not have hot water one morning and maintenance was already working to resolve the issue before we called the front desk. I will definitely recommend and stay at this site again.

title: Great Location, Great Hotel, Great Staff.
text:
Ive just returned from NYC, where we stayed at the Hilton New York Fashion District hotel. 

We had two rooms, one for my partner and I, the other for my parents. 

Location
It is very well placed for the main attractions, walking distance from Times Square, Empire State Building, the High Line and many others. 
If shopping is your thing then it is great as Fifth Avenue is not far, with Macy's just 8 blocks away.
(I was told there are c.25,000 cabs in Manhatten and they are pretty reasonably priced if you dont want to walk everywhere). 

The Rooms
We stayed in a King Room which was a decent size with a good size bathroom. A coffee machine with coffee capsules, iron with ironing board, a safe and WIFI were all included in the room price. A good size tv with plenty of free channels to choose from was also a plus. 
The room had a well stocked mini bar, though that was chargeable. 
The room did have a really good heater, that warmed things up very quickly but heat also escaped quickly once the heater was off. Fair's fair though, it is December!

Negatives
The only real negative for me was that one morning there was no water. Reception did provide a couple of bottles of water and whilst it was an inconvenience, these things happen.  
They had resolved the issue within a few hours and things remained ok for the rest of our stay. 

Above and Beyond
I have to say that where the hotel really excelled was the additional service they provided. 
I had been in touch with them prior to our arrival to let them know that we arrived on my fathers birthday and that the next day I planned to propose to my girlfriend, so could they give me a price on a bottle of champagne on each day to mark the occasion. 
We arrived to champagne to celebrate my fathers birthday and the next day following my proposal we came back to our room to flowers, balloons and wine to celebrate our engagement. 
It was an incredible gesture and one that made our stay all the more brilliant. 

I would not hesitate to recommend staying here to anyone, though one tiny recommendation would be to add teabags and milk to the coffee welcome plate as some people love a cup of tea, especially the Brits!

title: New York Hotel próximo de todas as atrações
text:
Não sendo económico, este hotel encontra-se próximo de todas as principais atrações.
Quem procura visitar a cidade a pé, sem os grandes engarrafamentos de Nova Iorque, este hotel é sem duvida uma boa solução.
Durante 4 dias, de uma forma fácil, não utilizei um unico meio de transporte.

O hotel está bem conservado, limpo e com um staff extremamente atencioso onde todas as principais comodidades são asseguradas. A dimensão do quarto excedeu as espectativas, onde não tenho nada a apontar.

A internet standard é suficiente.

title: New York City
text: Excellent location. Good size rooms for New York. Good price. Close to everything. The subway was very convenient. Located next to several Starbucks. Walking distance from Rockefeller and time square.

title: good hotel
text:
the location is great very close to everything. there is big supermarket one block from the hotel.
Parking is pricey without in & out. 
Wifi is free for members and good,
the room is good, comfortable bed, and the size is reasonable to this area.

title: Fashion District -NYC
text: If you need to be in the mid-town area and want to be away from the crowds...this is a good location. You can walk to many of NY City attractions easily. It has a very modern look and has an onsite bar and restaurant. The roof top bar has a great view...but is very noisy at night.

title: Gute Lage, sauber und freundlich
text: 5 Nächte haben wir hier verbracht. Unser Zimmer lag in der 2. Oberste Etage: tolle Aussicht!! Zimmer klein aber sauber. Grosser Fernseher. Leider wird auf der Kreditkarte doppelt belastet. Habe erst eine Woche später das Geld zurück bekommen.

title: Small, but we liked this hotel and it was a good location
text: We had a nice stay.  The rooms are small, but nice and we did like the stay.   The rooms were nice and clean and we liked the location.   The breakfast was enjoyable and we looked forward to it.   This hotel is just south of Times Square and a easy walk in the summer.  In the winter you will want a cab.

title: Stay away and save your money
text: Slow elevators - Out of 3 elevators, 1 is reserved to access the bar. You are left out with 2 slow elevators during rush hours.  Food is terrible.  Rooms small and outdated. Bathrooms are Very small and do not fit more than 1 person !

title: Girls weekend in New York!
text: Myself, Mum and sister stayed here for 4 nights the first weekend in December! The hotel is in a good location, very close to Macy’s and within walking distance to Times Square and other attractions! We didn’t eat in the hotel, but did have some drinks and the bar service was good.   Room was small and with 3 girls in the room with 2 cases each there wasn’t a lot of room! But considering you don’t spend a lot of time in the room, its fine. The hotel is clean  and the room was serviced everyday.

title: Honeymoon Set Back
text: Better designed for business, perhaps. Not a romantic setting. Close to mass transit. Staff always with smile, unfortunately not enough to make up for the very small rooms, the price point and the amenities provided.

title: Good service, nice room, OK value for money
text: Room is not big, but well designed. Air conditioning is a bit noisy, but tolerable. Bed is very comfortable. Lacking USB recharge outlets but has plenty of regular power outlets, easy to access. Good to have coffee maker in the room. Bathroom and shower are small but usable. Not much space around the sink. Nice common areas. Very friendly and welcoming staff. OK location (can walk from Grand Central or Times Square).

title: Fabulous hotel
text:
I stayed in the Hilton for three nights while I attended a conference. I didn't have any extra time to spend at the hotel, so can't comment on things like food, gym/pool, and rooftop bar. However, the room was spotless and quiet, despite facing a busy street. The bathroom was large and well-stocked with towels and toiletries, there was also a hairdryer and a coffee machine.
Just one small issue: the heating/air conditioning system switched on in the middle of the night and woke me up with its loud noise. I could've turned it off though, so it's not a big deal.
Overall, the Hilton is absolutely recommended for any business travellers who want the perfect spot in Midtown, Manhattan.

title: New York - amazing once again!
text: Lovely hotel, very modern and spotlessly clean. All staff we spoke to were lovely with no exceptions, nothing was too much trouble. Daily housekeeping was great, always cleans towels and fresh bed linen. Complimentary toiletries including cotton buds and cotton wool balls!  Hairdryer in bathroom so no need to take your own and the best illuminated magnifying mirror I have ever seen. Coffee maker in room (a bit like a Tassimo with pods) which was a lovely touch. Safe in wardrobe which was easy to use and proved invaluable for our stay. Directly opposite is a fantastic Subway outlet and an Irish bar. About five minute walk from Penn station so if you’re flying into JFK get the air train and LIRR which will cost you around $20 for two adults - it starts your adventure and you can use the dollars you save to spend on yourself!!  We did it there and we’re going to get a car back to JFK but we had loads of time to kill between vacating the room and getting to JFK so did it back too - such an easy way to travel. Overall, hotel was brilliant and we’d definitely stay there again.

title: Superb break, Super location, Super place!
text:
We just came back from 5 nights at the Hilton Fashion District hotel NYC.

Dial 7 Car from the airport $68.00 plus tip, organised from UK before we left.
Although Penn Station is 10 minutes walk away where you can get a direct train to/from the airport.

The Hilton Fashion Hotel is on W26th St between 6th & & 7th avenue.
Ideally placed to walk to the sights of Times Square Rockerfeller Centre Etc.
Nice bright large Reception area
Very Attentive reception staff on duty, quick easy checkin.
17th Floor by a choice of 3 lifts.
Room 1701 exceptionally clean & a good size.
Very comfy bed, lots of storage Apple charger/clock radio on bedside cabinet.
Free large safe above wardrobe area.
Our window view was of an office block opposite so not so good but we didn't spend much time in the room anyway.
Lots of Restaurants/cafes round about within 2 minutes walk.
I had ordered some parcels from within the US prior to arriving & they were in the room on our arrival.
Nice big clean shower room with W/C & Basin, Very clean & bright.
Free complimentary wifi that worked fine for us. Large flat screen TV that we never watched as were to busy out walking.
Used The Rare Restaurant within the hotel on one occasion but wasn't to our taste, reasonably priced but the food was a bit bland & over cooked.
There is a roof top bar on the top floor that over looks Manhatten, we went there a couple of evenings after coming back from our days out, nice relaxing atmosphere,
Reasonably priced & well used by locals & guests by the looks of things.
Over all a very good place to stay for a reasonable cost. Would certainly stay again on our return trip.

title: Enjoyable Stay
text: This is an excellent hotel at this particular price point in NYC. Check in went very smoothly and Mary at the front desk was very nice and helpful throughout our stay. The room was clean and seemed to be a good size, we have stayed in much smaller rooms in New York. The Rave Restaurant was perfect for breakfast each morning, a great way to start the day. We mostly walked everywhere, but it is very close to the subway. Overall this was a very pleasant stay. We typically travel to NYC 2-3 times and year and will most likely use this hotel on future visits.

title: Great hotel
text: Friendly and attentive staff, clean rooms check in was easy rom was comfortable and did not experience any issues during this stay. I would stay here again if I am I nyc again. Restaurant was clean and food was good as well

title: Good / decent hotel near a lot of restaurants
text:
I was here for a business trip in November, 2017.  There is a fancy restaurant on the first floor.  The lobby is kind of small.  My room was small, but the wifi worked well and the TV worked well.  The bathroom was well lit, but the rest of the room did not have enough lamps (and with dark décor, it was on the dark side).  The shower worked well, and the bed was comfortable.  There was a large in-room safe on the top of the closet, but it was 6-6.5 feet off the ground, so it was hard for me to reach it (and so I could not use it).The staff was friendly, and helped me catch a cab when I needed one.

The gym was small and just had one bike, one treadmill, one elliptical, and some free weights.  The equipment was in good condition.

Also, it was one of the more reasonably priced hotels and close to my meeting.  There are many dining choices within walking distance.

title: Great!
text: Great place to stay! Great location! Walking distance to everything. Lots of places to eat close by. Hotel was very clean and the staff was very nice. I will make reservations at this hotels the next time I come back.

title: Below par stay
text: The hotel was average, the room was OK, but we had a few problems with hot water running out 2 of our 3 days stay, plus noisy guests waking us three times during Saturday night. I wouldn't stay here again.

title: Great stay in NYC
text: Great hotel close to restaurants and shops.  Easy access to subway. Nice and clean rooms. Very nice staff too. Enjoyed the rooftop bar inside the hotel. There is a wash and fold laundry across the street that we used. Overall a very pleasant experience.

title: Just ok
text: I’m a Hilton Honors member and was a little disappointed in this property. Small, oddly configured lobby which is annoying when everyone’s checking in & out. The rooms are small as they often are in Manhattan but these rooms were very worn on top. However, the location was good. Rare, the hotel restaurant, can’t seem to be able to make a decent Moscow Mule, but the brisket quesadilla was tasty.

title: A Good Choice
text: Stayed here last week for 4 nights - in room 1215 - a good size room, spotlessly clean. All staff encountered were pleasant and friendly and they very kindly sent a bottle of champagne to the room for our anniversary. A good choice for people used to New York and like to stay away from Times Square.

title: Great Location - But that's where it ends.
text:
Smallest King room I have ever stayed in. The same goes for the bathroom. If you stay here, you are staying because of the location and nothing more. They do have a very nice rooftop bar with solid drinks yet mediocre food. I have stayed at Hilton properties consistently for about 3 years. From a service standpoint, this was below expectation.

But, if you are in town for a weekend and you just need a place to sleep at a good price - this is a good option.

title: Disappointed
text: I’m a bit disappointed that I was charged half day rate which is $99.00 for being late to come back in my hotel for 1 & 1/2 hrs. I was hoping they are just more considerate and just charged me pro rated instead  since I stayed 2 days and arrived late than the  check in time. The hotel was expensive and breakfast is not included. I will never go back here and would rather stay in the 34th street area.

title: A good choice
text: This is a modern, comfortable hotel with a great staff. The folks at the desk are helpful, friendly, and welcoming (look for Caroline). The hotel's location is ideal - in Chelsea, convenient to mid-town, Greenwich Village, and The High Line (all an easy walk away). Our room had a fine view of the Empire State Building. The price was right and included breakfast (that was okay, but our server, named Blessing, was terrific). The amenities were fine. I would return.

title: Nice!
text: Tennessee & Maryland visitors! First time staying at hotel and won’t be the last! Well kept hotel! Staff was great especially Peter R.  They have a nice roof top bar. Enjoyed breakfast in the hotel restaurant. Close to Madison Square and subways stops. Great view of Empire State Building from hotel.  Nice Irish bar/restaurant across from hotel. Most important the rooms were clean and nice.

title: New York weekend
text: Hotel was clean, service was good. Had drinks on the rooftop bar but we closed the place. It was not close to Times Square but we didn’t want anything close to the noise. We are walkers so the distance didn’t bother us. Affordable

title: Great spot
text: I stay here about 20 nights a year and never leave disappointed. The location, service, amenities, and rooftop bar are always top notch. I walk over a mile to and from work just to stay here when in town. It’s just closer to all my favorite restaurants and bars in the village and other lower Manhattan neighborhoods.

title: Average
text:
Was there for a couple of nights. Nothing great to say about rooms or facilities. Very average and mediocre. 
Staff was helpful. 
Was hard pressed to stay near the office else would ave totally skipped.

title: Recommended Stay
text:
Stayed here for 4 days post NYC marathon and we were really impressed with our stay. 

Overall -

+ Was able to check in at midday for a Level 2 room, it was a bit noisy with street noise at night but that's to be expected on Floor 2.
+ Staff were excellent
+ Great location, so handy to so many things, particularly 28th street and 23rd street subway stations. A good place for NYC first timers, the Flatiron / Chelsea area isn't as overwhelming as other neighborhoods!
+ Room was large by NYC standards
+ Bed was comfortable
+ Room and common areas very clean
+ Very reasonably priced for NYC

- Shower leaked, not deal breaking though
- A few times cleaning staff or other people tried to get into our room at weird hours?
- Room was always a bit cold, even if 'heat' on in the themostat and set at 72 degrees, it was always chilly and we couldn't figure out how to fix it. Warm air just wouldn't come out of the ventilation system
- Ventilation system was a bit noisy, again not a deal breaker
- Room was a bit dark, could have used 1 more light!

I would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone coming to the city looking for a reliable, comfortable stay.

title: De lo mejor
text:
Comodidad, buena ubicación y atención.
Tiene una vista inmejorable y la habitación son de lo mejor. En el primer piso venden unas hamburguesas, que delicia. Cerca de todo lo importante en NY
El rooftop es sencillo pero impactante la vista

title: Average - one very helpful staff
text:
Location is good within walks to restaurants and supermarket. The room size is decent but I find the shower area a bit small. Room is rather basic, and i find it pricey for what the hotel offers. Hotel staffs are rather overwhelmed with the group at check-in and assigned our guest to an  occupied room. However, make-up with the extra effort to get our breakfast pre-packed by 6am. We really appericate the extra mile service from the lady at the front desk. Thank you.
I would give a average rating.

title: Comfortable stay!
text: Stayed in room 1211 and enjoyed our stay.  Booked a King bed room and the size of the room was adequate.   Regular amenities such as an automated mini-bar, in room coffee maker, etc.    This location features the new Digital Key service where you can download the Hilton App on your phone and unlock your room key from your phone.  The elevators are secured so you need either your "digital key" or a regular key card to unlock the elevator to get to your floor.  We appreciated the security that this gives so that strangers aren't running around on our floor in the middle of the night.   Check in process was a breeze and we appreciated the two bottles of water and the complimentary hot breakfast due to me being a Hilton HHonors Gold member.    When we reached our room, the room was at a comfortable temperature.   We were trying to find the ice machine, we called down to the front desk and advised that they would bring us a bucket of ice.  There's no ice machines on any of the floors at this hotel.   I found a small 1 inch stain on the left sheen drapes of the room, and my partner mentioned that the room was a bit on the dark side as the lighting doesn't have the ability to fully light up the room.  This is probably due to the style that this hotel is trying to bring to the room, but I wanted to mention this for those who don't like a darker room.  I understand the area this hotel is situated and that's why it's called "fashion district", so if that's the vibe you like, this hotel would be for you.

title: Great hotel in an excellent location
text:
Stayed here for four days and couldn't believe how handy it was for so many different things. Chelsea Market, the high line, 34th street, madison square gardens and Penn Station all within a 15 minute walk which made my first visit to NYC a lot easier.

Staff were very helpful and he room itself with nice with a lovely shower. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Downward slide
text:
I used to think this was a nice hotel. It's probably been about a year since I've stayed here, but wow, totally not the same. We were given a dark, dank dirty room, perhaps because we booked with points. Room faced the back side of bldg and we were on the second floor. I don't mind the low floor, but very dark and just really dim yellow bulbs in crappy old light fixtures. Room was beat up and no one bothers to vacuum close to the mopboards. Also, they are no longer dusted mopboards anyway. Icky old carpeting, nasty mattress and tired old bedding. The comforter inside the duvet cover was stained. 

Staff very nice. Food in restaurant (Rare) is still good, although decor looks very tired. We did not complain about room. Looking around the place, we didn't think another room would be any better. But highly unlikely we'll stay here again, either. Too many better places to stay in NY to consider this one again.

title: Good hotel, but a bit noisy
text: Stayed 3 nights, 10th floor, HH Diamond member. Room was good and clean, comfortable bed and pillows. Problem was that even the 10th floor was really noisy, lots of trash trucks and other vehicles. Will give it a try again. Good breakfast. I'd have given 4 stars if not for the noise

title: Great hotel
text: Useful location, helpful and friendly staff, rooms clean. Walking distance to all the key areas and restaurants. Good value. Honars breakfast just ok - no healthy option. Roof bar, downstairs bar can get noisy

title: Great Hotel and Location
text: Customer service Outstanding!! We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Hilton Honors is the way to go..they really take good care of their members. If visiting New York City you must give this hotel a try...you want be disappointed

title: Centralized NYC location to many things
text: Hotel staff was great and very helpful at all hours of the day! Rooms are small, but nicer than many in NYC. Easy access to the Subway. The bars Schafer’s and Black Door  across the street were fun and there were lots of food options nearby.

title: Nice
text: Very nice facility with personable, professional staff.  Great location with access to the real New York.  Valet parking was great and the quick response to get the car was great.  Check in and check out was quick and simple.

title: Great hotel rooms and awesome location
text: Stayed here for one night for the weekend of Halloween, the staff were very polite and prompt whenever we requested something. The room was very nice and clean, a little small but does the job. There is also the Rare rooftop which is open all year and very nice. Close to a supermarket, a liquor store, and Penn Station/public transit

title: Medium range hilton
text: We stayed at the Hilton fashion district during October 2017, front desk staff were lovely and very helpful as well as one of the doormen. Unfortunately we had another doorman who wasn’t so friendly and an air conditioning unit that wouldn’t stop..so overall not the best stay. I would recommend the Hilton a few blocks over, rather than this one.

title: Hilton Fashion District always shine!
text: It never ceases to delight me when I stay at the Hilton Fashion District.  First and foremost, there's Zoribel Torres.  She is professional, kind, generous and just a fabulous person.  It makes my day when I see her and she is always very very helpful.  But the whole staff is always very professional and lovely to deal with and talk to.  I am there quite often and I have never had a bad experience.  It has always been a very positive experience even when things in the room don't work the way they're suppose to.  All I have to do is call downstairs and someone comes up right away to fix it, whether it be more towels or the A/C isn't working right, etc. This hotel is my go-to hotel when I am in New York City.  And it's because of Zoribel and Marian and John and Miley and Christine and everyone there (I'm bad with names so forgive me for forgetting to mention more of you by name). Thank you!

title: Bring Your Ear Plugs
text:
This hotel is squeaky clean, modern and attractive. I ordered room service from Rare, the adjacent restaurant and the Cobb salad and onion rings were both excellent.

The bed and linens were comfy as expected...but the sound insulation was horrible. I could hear every word from people passing in the hallway and the door slams drove me crazy and woke me up several times during the night. Even on the 21st floor, street noise was heard loud and clear. If the sound proofing was better, my review would be at the 4-4.5 level.

title: Nice hotel and close to lots of things
text:
This hotel isn’t cheap, but not a bad location. 10 min walk to penn station and Madison square gardens. Time square isn’t too far either. Grand central about a mile and half or 20 mins in a cab!
The rooms are small but clean and comfortable, nothing fancy and besides the other rooms door opening and closing they seemed to be quite rooms. 
They have a great burger restaurant on site and rooftop bar, but it was closed for a private event, so didn’t go up. 
Overall not a bad hotel.

title: Easy to get to from Penn Station
text: Great hotel for what we needed it to be - easy to get to from Penn Station and easy to get around elsewhere in the City. It's in a nice location, it was quiet at night, but there were still bars around the area to go to. Room was clean and bed was comfy. Would stay here again.

title: Quelconque
text:
Hôtel sans saveur sans odeur
Quelconque
Petite chambre bruyante
Accueil Leger stricte minimum
Par contre bel emplacement
Roof top sympa

On n’y retournera pas!!

Je ne le conseille pas. Il y a beaucoup mieux à New York pour le même prix

title: Great service!
text: Stayed at the Hilton recently for a work trip. When a hotel is chosen for you never know what you are going to get.  But the staff at the Hilton was super friendly and accommodating.  The front desk was very helpful upon checking in and Nick went above and beyond when I ran into a wifi issue.  Highly recommended!

title: Disappointing experience!
text:
This is Hilton!
It used to be an example of the best customer service and quality of accommodations. Now I can't even recommend it to my friends.
With one exception, all the front desk staff, was acting as if doing us a huge favor, and we had minimal requests and usually are very easy going people.
Even so we are Hilton Honors members, we'll never stay in this hotel again.

title: A lovely stay
text: This was our second time at the Hilton in the Fashion District...intimate hotel, not overly congested neighborhood. Perfect location, near the High Line, Whitney Museum, Tribeca, SoHo, Chelsea and Greenwich Village. Subway accessible. Nicely decorated rooms, small but comfortable.  Excellent service, front desk, problem w flat screen that was attended to immediately. We love NYC, it's our hometown, definitely recommend the Hilton.

title: Boutique feel and great service hotel!
text: We had the best stay and it was largely due to the friendly and accommodating representatives including: Zoribel, Marina, Mily, Christine, Raul, Sid, Martha, Brandon, John and Jose. Every time we came to the lobby everyone at the front desk had a smile on their faces, offered us water, and went out of their way to help us with whatever we needed.  It rained our last day and they even gave us umbrellas so we could walk to a dinner and have breakfast.  Such a great intimate and boutique hotel feel, and situated in the heart of the fashion district.  We will definitely be returning to this property the next time we come to New York!

title: Great Choice! Modern and Nice Location!
text: My husband and I like Hilton Hotels when in NYC since there are many in great locations.  This HIlton is a great choice if you do not want to stay in Times Square but still want to be close to great restaurants and things to do and see. We had a room around the corner from the elevator and never heard it.  Yes, the rooms are small but big enough to contain everything you want.  The bed was one of most comfortable we have ever experienced.  Unfortunately our view consisted of fire escapes and the back side of other buildings but it didn't matter as we did not spend a lot of time sitting around.  The hotel is within walking distance of Eataly, Macy's and across the street from FIT.  Lobby was nice with, the adjacent restaurant RARE, but did not offer a lot of seating. In keeping with the Fashion District, the decor was very modern.  Staff was attentive and we were thrilled they had a room available for us at 11AM.  Once again a great Hilton!

title: My trip
text: This hotel was very convenient and close to everything I was doing in New York. Close to the attractions I wanted to see and to a book signing I was going to and working. The room was excellent and the breakfast as good Overall an excellent stay.

title: Strict terms, Inflexible
text: Please don't book for leisure trips with family. Hotel is very inflexible to real-life scenarios and shall stick to the terms and fine print. Shall throw the book at you at any instance.  Great for business traveller because of the location and if the employer is willing to pay.

title: Cute hotel, modern and trendy, nice location
text: I've stayed at this hotel several times.  It's usually the first place I check when making reservations in New York.  It's in a great location at 26th and 7th.  The rooms are always clean and are relatively spacious for New York.  Everything is modern and the staff have always been friendly.  The beds are comfortable and I always sleep well.  The walls are a little thin so noise from other rooms can be a problem (a baby screaming for 4 hours without a break gets old fast), but that's true of many hotels in New York.  Overall, this place is always a nice stay.

title: Great Stay!
text: My daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay and plan to return with my parents in a month. Mily who is part of the concierge staff was fantastic!! The lighting in the room could have been better. When the shades were down, the lighting was poor.

title: Basic Room - No hot water
text: My husband and I stayed for one night as we had an event nearby. The hotel has a small modern lobby, good restaurant and is in a very convenient location if you want to be in Chelsea or close to Midtown. The room was very basic, on the smaller side and fairly dark. Unfortunately, the building had an issue and there was no hot water all morning. For $200 per night, one would hope for a hot shower. It never got resolved before I needed to leave. Based on our overall experience and the underwhelming room for the price point, this may be our only stay at this location.

title: Good Choice
text: Rooms are nice; what you expect from Hilton. Nice little bar on the ground floor. Good location -- a couple blocks from the subway station to access the 1 (red) on 7th and then a couple blocks away other stations with access to the FM (orange) and then the RW (yellow)

title: Fun FIT visit
text:
Visited FIT for the weekend! Great location! Right across the street.  Hotel is a little ways from 5th and time square but the perfect for the purpose of our trip!! Hilton always impresses and the staff was wonderful! 
No complaints!

title: Great location.  Nice hotel
text: Stayed here for one night with my daughter to attend comiccon.  We were happy overall with everything.  Room was slightly small, but understandable for NYC.  Most all staff was friendly but some were to the point.    Had breakfast in am and it was pretty good.    Loved that we were able to leave car in valet and luggage at hotel while we attended the show.

title: Perfect Boutique Hotel
text: My stay at this hotel was wonderful; the staff was very friendly and professional, they will answer my questions at all times no matter if it was the morning crew or afternoon crew they always greeted me with a smile. The rooms are clean.

title: Good Experience
text: Stayed one night recently and found the front desk team very helpful and friendly.  I asked for a quiet room and was given one on the ninth floor.  I heard no noise from the other rooms or hallway; only the usual outside NYC sounds.  The room was clean and well equipped; a smaller size but adequate.  The shower was kind of tiny and it was one of those that you have to walk into to turn on the water; don't know why they plan them like that.  Not a big deal though.  Breakfast eggs were not real eggs as far as I know; at least not freshly prepared eggs.  I'm a stickler - maybe others would like them.  Potatoes and bacon were good.   Would stay again.

title: One Night Only
text: I stayed here on September 9th 2017 for one night. Location was good handy for subway and a pleasant walk to Times Square. The room was very comfortable. The only issue was that there was no hot water for showers. The hotel didn't inform us and I only had it confirmed at Breakfast the next day when a waitress told me. The front desk could have been more helpful. The breakfast was wonderful.

title: The only good thing about this hotel is the location.
text: Rooms are very outdated. Not up to Hilton Standards at all. I had an emergency and needed to check out early, the staff charged me for an additional night. I usually like staying at the Hilton Brand. This was the worst I've ever been to

title: Great Hotel!!
text: I stayed here for two night on business in NY. This is a great hotel from top to bottom. Service in all areas was above average and the room I got was very comfortable. I'd stay here whenever I need to be in this area of NY.

title: Excellent location and great service
text: Staff was very welcoming and pleasant and always ready to help.  Hotel was clean and well kept and certainly felt safe.  The room was a little small - but we were not in there often (other than to sleep) so it was perfect.

title: Ughh the noise is so bad
text: Rooms are bad, so small and you can hear everything. We were on 2nd floor and had a very bad view, basically looking at another building wall. Walking distance to everything bars, clubs, restaurants u name it. Roof bar was ok, very limited space. Came here to for a relaxing weekend, but didnt happen coz we werent able to sleep with everything we hear in the other rooms and hallway.

title: Average
text: We visited over new year.i liked the view from our room and it was more spacious than other hotels we have been to in NYC. The rooms felt a bit dated and I think my credit card details were compromised at this property-I had a card that has only ever been swiped at this property (as they do upon check in) and the card was used some months later in a New Jersey Walmart! (this was reported and customer service were helpful).i liked location of hotel too but for next trip I think I would pay a bit more and stay somewhere more stylish

title: Not up to Hilton standards, but very good housekeeping.
text: No exec lounge for diamond members.  Restaurant not part of hotel. Room service sometimes ok, sometimes terrible.  All-day menu consisted entirely of some sort of beef product (hamburger, steaks).  A chicken item was on the menu but not available any longer.  Desk chair very uncomfortable (literally painful to sit in, not adjustable).  AC very hard to control.  OTOH Housekeeping and engineering were very accommodating, even beyond what was requested.  One bed was comfortable, the other too hard (plywood board under mattress).

title: SECURITY COMPROMISED - DO NOT STAY HERE
text:
During my stay I ordered breakfast from room service - it was $48 - it was terrible, but this was not the problem.  When in-room dining decided to call to ask how my breakfast was, I let them know that it was terrible, but no need for a refund.  My purpose in telling them was 'well, since you called, I'll tell you the truth'.  We hung up and I went on about my day.  

A few hours later, after returning to my room I receive another call.  The person on the other line is addressing me by my full name and is calling to apologize for my breakfast having been bad and that they are going to refund me (note: this means that they were advised as to my experience on breakfast)- I said 'Great but really no need, it's OK'.  Then they proceeded to informed me, 'We accidentally charged your card $480 instead of the $48 so we will just refund it all’ I of course said OK got it.  They asked me for my card number to process the refund. I asked why they couldn't just void the transaction and for an unknown reason they weren't able to, so they requested I either provide my card number or to go to the lobby and give them my card there.  I went downstairs and no one had any idea what I was talking about.  This is when I realized someone was trying to steal my identity.   

After speaking to the front desk and asking multiple times to speak to the manager, which he didn't come out until about an hour later, and speaking to the restaurant manager, I realized that I was dealing with a bunch of incompetent buffoons.   I went upstairs to let my coworker know what happened, when her phone rings and the exact same scenario is happening to her.

We both walk downstairs to what are still a bunch of incompetent buffoons.  Finally the manager comes out - head master of buffoons.  After HOURS of his inspector gadget skills - it's been discovered that someone in the kitchen did 'accidentally' provide both me and my coworkers full name, room number and receipts of orders to someone outside of the hotel....

Said head master of buffoons -  I assume is attempting to protect the magnitude of this ordeal - A.) It’s illegal to provide an 'outside' entity a paying customers full name and room number without their consent as this is a very direct and clear safety issue. B.) it was NOT done by accident as the person on the 'outside' knew that I has unhappy with my breakfast and had been advised that I had previously indicated the food was terrible.  C.) with the amount of information said theft has (full name, last four digits of CC, Room number and duration of stay, they are now able to access each of our rooms via downloading of the Hilton Digital Key App.  Does your hotel and brand understand the magnitude of personal security that has been compromised?

title: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL
text: This is hands down the WORST Experience I have ever had at a hotel.  One of the employees at this hotel is attempting to steal identities.   Someone from the kitchen staff provide me and my coworkers full name, hotel room number, and receipts of purchases at hotel to someone on the outside.  This is an attempt at stealing identities and having their ID Stolen.   Please also be advised that with just this information someone may then access your hotel room via the digital key.  This puts each customers security at risk while staying at the hotel.   It's terrible that the hotel is now aware that this is 'stemming from the inside' however they brushed this instance off as if it was done by mistake.

title: Nice and convenient
text: Everything was great from checking in to checking out. All the staff was very nice and helpful. The location was within walking distance to the hotel. I would stay at this Hilton again if and when I return to New York.

title: Wonderful Staff Makes It Feel Like Home
text:
I travel a good bit for work, and I think I've finally found my "work home" in New York thanks to the wonderful staff at the Hilton Fashion District.

When I check in, I'm greeted with smiles (even if it's 11pm). Jose, Moises, Marian and Zoribel (I asked for their names!) have become friends to me, warmly welcoming me and making sure my stay gets off to a great start. You couldn't make a better impression when you check in than with this dream team.         

Every morning I get a chance to talk to the housekeeping staff either on the elevator or on my floor, and every night, I return to a perfectly cleaned room. I love catching up daily with my new friends whose warm wishes lead to a great day. The hotel staff that does the breakfast service in Rare is also wonderful. They never make you feel rushed and are very friendly.        

All in all, please keep up the great work! I could go on and on about how wonderful your staff is, but if you keep hiring people like them, I'll be coming back every time I'm in the city.

title: Good location, friendly staff
text: I've stayed in this hotel two times and have enjoyed the service I've received. The location is convenient, the room is clean, staff are courteous. The digital check-in and digital key on your smart phone is very convenient. Will definitely stay again.

title: Lovely
text: Wonderful hotel with a wonderful view. Had the pleasure of staying here this past weekend and enjoyed myself. Soft pillow, comforters and a BOMB shower. I would definitely plan on staying here again. There is a restaurant inside the hotel called RARE and the hotel also has a rooftop bar.

title: Great!
text:
This place was great! It was very centrally located, clean, and the staff were gems. My internet went out twenty minutes before I had to be online for a meeting and Nik from the Hilton Engineering team had it fixed in under five minutes! Really top notch staff.

Would gladly stay here again thanks to Nik - thanks again!! :)

title: HOTEL IDEAL POUR VISITER NYC
text:
Cet hotel est un tres bon rapport qualité/prix.
L'accueil est professionnel et sympathique , les chambres confortables et fonctionnelles.
Air conditionné individualisé et efficace (indispensable à New York) et bonne isolation du bruit exterieur (permanent a New York....)
Attention aux bruits nocturnes des clients bruyants dans les couloirs et qui claquent les portent de chambre......
La situation geographique de l'hotel est ideale pour visiter la ville,( y compris a pied qui est la meilleure façon de visiter cette ville )
Bar / restaurant au rdc pour petit dejeuner ou repas et les bar ouvert le soir pour un dernier verre sont fort pratiques, avec un personnel là encore agreable et sympathique.
Bar en "roof top" au sommet du batiment à decouvrir imperativement !

title: Poor Service
text: We arived at hotel, very disorganise. Gave reception my HH number as did not have and agreed to put points on reservation, still not done. In the morning was going for a meeting, no hot water. Agreed to refund room rate on my card, as already pre-paid, still not received.  Found a sock under bed.Room not cleaned properly.

title: Great Hotel Central Manhattan New York
text: This Hotel was a great place to stay, very central, only a few minutes walk from underground railway, supermarket, bars & restaurants. It has a great rooftop bar, very friendly/helpful staff, rooms very pleasant and for New York reasonably priced. Would highly reccomend.

title: Perfect hotel
text: I love the Chelsea neighborhood, so this hotel is perfectly located. The rooms are great (not too small), the staff is friendly, the email I received before check-in made me feel welcome, I could check-in early, Wifi is very good and we could connect our 4 devices for free. And one more thing : it is 2 blocks from Brooklin Bagel & coffee :)

title: Fine, no real complaints
text:
I don't have any real complaints about this hotel. The staff was friendly and the lobby was nice. The room seemed clean. I had no issues. That said, for the price, you can find a nicer hotel. 

The walls and windows are VERY thin. I could hear my neighbor's tv as if I was in their room. And I could hear every sound on the street (and it's a side street). Sound doesn't bother me at all - I even sleep with the tv on. But it would definitely bother someone more sensitive than me. 

I'm not a large person, and the shower was very narrow. Just washing my hair, my arms banged the sides of the shower. Again, this is nothing to complain about. But there are other options with larger bathrooms.

Overall, it was a good location when doing business in the garment district. It's certainly not cheap, though, and for the money, you can stay at a newer/larger hotel. 

I'd stay here again if I needed to.

title: Nyfw stay
text: We love, love, love the staff here!!!  The young ladies at the front desk were very polite and accommodating.  We enjoyed eating at the restaurant Rare and the bartender Tiffany is the best!!! She made us feel so welcomed and relaxed after a LONG day of delayed flights and rerouted planes. Shevonne the hostess was also wonderful and went out of her way to be accommodating to us. The hotel staff member Krishnek was also extremely helpful and we really appreciated his assistance and how polite and respectful he was. We had one issue with hot water going out and left before we could find out if it was resolved, but other that a perfect stay! We will definitely stay here again and the location was also awesome!  Loved the bar across the street and the rooftop bar at the hotel was super fun and had a DJ and everything!  All the ladies we were traveling with enjoyed their experience.

title: buona posizione, ma nessun entusiasmo
text: Nella zona di Chelsea, comoda sia per muoversi a piedi che con mezzi pubblici. Ho dormito due notti in una camera abbastanza confortevole ma non grandissima (ovvio, direte, siamo a NYC) e poco illuminata, pulizia non impeccabile, moquette a terra, bagno con vasca (e tenda doccia). Prenotato con expedia in forte sconto, non mi ha però entusiasmata.

title: Quick Stay
text: Great location.  Very residential and much quieter than Times Square.  Staff was very personable and welcoming.  Best customer service we have experienced in a long time.  Staff extremely helpful in getting transportation to airport.

title: Great location
text: The hotel is in a great location, it's really easy to get from it to the main sites and there are some great restaurants near by. The staff are all extremely helpful. The rooftop bar is great if the weather is nice.

title: La Gran Manzana
text:
Hotel bien ubicado en el barrio de Chelsea, con variadas alternativas para comer cercanas y muy cercano a dos lineas de metro (promedio dos cuadras). Su decoración hace honor al sector donde se encuentra con diseño interior moderno y fashion. Las habitaciones pueden parecer pequeñas, pero en el contexto del lugar donde esta, es la norma.
No está cerca de nada, pero se encuentra en medio entre Central Park y Wall Street y si utilizas el metro subterraneo puedes moverte muy bien para turistear por todo Manhattan.

title: Buon compromesso a New York
text:
Abbiamo pernottamento qui per 2 notti. Camera pulita, servizio cortese con possibilità di lasciare i bagagli dopo il check-out gratuito. Il punto di forza è il roof bar situato al 22 esimo piano dove si può sorseggiare un buon cocktail con vista Empire. Unica pecca snack scaduti nel frigo bar, abbiamo ricevuto le scuse senza alcun addebito sul conto.
Nel complesso è un buon compromesso qualità- prezzo a Manhattan. Consigliato

title: Excellent Hotel Experience
text: Stayed here a full week and loved every minute of it. The  location is excellent allowing for easy access to the subway for travels to the museums and other tourist spots. The staff and concierge were always friendly, helpful and eager to assist me with my daily travel plans. The hotel is also within convenient walking distance to many interesting sights like the Flatiron building and Eataly.

title: Money missing from Room
text:
I stayed at the hotel the weekend of August 4 - 7th.  After returning to the room on Saturday the 5th I realized that money I had hidden in a Calendar book which was hidden under clothing in a drawer was missing.  Roughly $280.00.  I know exactly the denominations of the bills.   When I reported this to the front desk they did not fill out an official complaint.  They said I had to wait until they viewed the security for the room access.  Finally Monday upon check out they said the security only show the maid entering the room.  And all of their employees were long term.  They said they would submit a claim to their insurance company.  Three weeks later and I still haven't heard anything.   
I travel 26 weeks a year for Business and I doubt I will ever choose Hilton again.

title: Convenient location
text: This hotel is an average business hotel in NYC. Rooms are not too small for one person. The windows are not noise canceling so you might experience some noise from the street at night, specially garbage trucks. Staff is friendly and the check out was quick.

title: Hilton mit Roof top Bar
text:
Das Hotel an und für sich ist Hilton Standard. Das Spezielle ist die Bar auf dem Dach des Hotels. Als Gast muss man nicht anstehen, sondern wird sofort in den nächsten Lift begleitet. Vom Dach aus hat man eine schöne Sicht auf die umliegenden Gebäude, u.A. auch aufs Empire State Building, besonders wenn es beleuchtet ist. 
Drinks sind ok, Musik auch, allerdings kann es etwas eng werden, wenn an schönen Tagen auch andere Gäste sich einen Sundowner gönnen möchten.

title: Disappointing Stay
text: My husband and I were in Manhattan for my birthday weekend, and selected the Hilton Fashion District, given its location and it was a named Hilton. I have Gold Status with Hilton and given that the hotel was not fully occupied expected an upgrade. Checking in, I was not recognized for my status and was specifically told I would not get an upgrade. Additionally, my profile has requests for a higher floor and away from an elevator, but we were put on the 3rd floor right across from the elevator, which kept us awake with noises from the bar across the street. While I could understand if the hotel was booked up and our reservation was made right before our stay, but I booked it nearly 3 months in advance. I would not recommend this hotel.

title: Great hotel and service from start to finish!
text:
From the very first day we reserved, we received exceptional service. Hotel front desk answered every question and request we had. 

Check-in was a breeze, thanks to the Hilton Honours app. We were lucky enough to get the room we wanted (2202 - Beautiful view of the downtown skyline) and we also checked in early at 9am. Checkout took no longer than 10 seconds. (Literally)

The room itself was great. Bed was very comfortable and room was very clean upon arrive and every day after housekeeping. 

Only downside would be the expensive room service. 22% service charge and 5$ (if I recall) in-room service. But it is room service and it NYC. The food it self (Rare resto) was okay. Defintely better choices elsewhere. 

The Rare Rooftop gives you a great view of the skyline. Pricey drinks but they taste great. 

The hotel is in an amazing location. Not in a  loud area. Subway is just around the corner. Penn Station, Highline, Chelsea Market and Times Square are a few minutes away by walk and you're in between 6 & 7 Avenue which is terrific for walking. 

All in all. We were very happy with everything. Would definitely recommend to anyone!

P.S: Book with Hilton.com and the Honours card! Well worth it. Free wifi, digital key, online check in and more... and it's free!

title: Leisure and Location
text: Good location, in a good area of NYC.  Rooms are nice and are a decent size for NYC, not large but comfy for 1 not roomy for two or a  family. For business purposes the rooms are very dimly lit and make it difficult to work but large desk. For leisure the lighting works fine as you can certainly sleep in after a night on the town and there is a coffee maker in room,

title: Second Stay
text: The hotel is perfectly situated far enough from the tourist hot-spots, that if you feel like venturing over to them it is a quick walk.  It is far enough that you don't have all of the noise and pedestrian congestion so that you can wander around the area with restaurants and plenty of other places of interest.   The staff is always wonderful at this hotel.  Even just general greetings as you are coming back to the hotel after a long day, are genuine, sincere, and make the experience at this hotel stand out from others.   I was in New York for business, and the bar area was the perfect place to setup, enjoy a decent menu, have some drinks, and get some work done.  I will have to say that a lot of times, many hotels have not figured out the necessity of high speed wireless internet, and here, I never have an issue with speeds whether I am just doing general web based research, or uploading or downloading files from Dropbox and other storage clouds. Each morning and each evening there is always someone in the lobby either wishing you a good day, or asking how your day was when returning.  Those little things do set this wonderful hotel apart from other hotels that I have stayed at in New York, and this is why I will continually stay at this property and help move more of my companies travel to New York to this hotel.   Keep up the great work!

title: Encantado
text: Era mi primer viaje a NY y la verdad es que estoy muy satisfecho con el hotel elegido. Muy buena ubicación, en pleno barrio de Chelsea en la W26 con la 7th y a tan sólo 5 minutos a pie del Madison Square Garden y 10 minutos a pie de Times Square. Hotel moderno, habitación limpia, wifi gratis y excelente atención de todo el personal de recepción para todo lo que necesité (varios trabajadores hablan español). Por poner alguna pega quizás el armario se queda muy pequeño para estancias de una semana. Por lo demás, excelente opción.

title: Hilton Fashion District
text: Great neighborhood  a lot of stores, food options within walking distance. The staff is very accomodating. The roof top bar is exceptional and affords great views day and night. A 10 dollar cab ride to Chelsea Piers or Chinatown.

title: What a wonderful place!
text: I stayed here on my wedding night and was completely satisfied.  I found this hotel on a list of the top 10 hotels with the best rooftop bars. The room, while smallish, was completely modern and simply gorgeous. The views from the room were stunning especially at night.  Unfortunately, I didn't get a chance to visit the bar.  The one thing that stood out the most was the service. The staff went out of their way to accommodate us. The hotel is right in the heart of everything.  The only caution I would mention is be prepared to pay a pretty penny ($45-60) for a valet or to park in the garages. You can always take your chances self parking on the street but......yikes!  The bathroom was very nice. The bed was uber comfortable.  The TV was humongous. We will def be back for day trips and date nights.  Cannot wait to go back.

title: Fantastic location, comfy bed!
text:
Having just returned from a stay in NYC we were very impressed with this hotel. Firstly the location is super! A short walk from Penn Station and as it's mid town we were able to walk all over Manhattan to explore! Check in and out were both effortless with friendly staff who gave us help with our train journey back to Newark airport. The room was extremely clean and compact with everything you need available. The shower was probably the best I've had in a hotel for a long time! The bed was huge and so comfortable! My partner enjoyed a cup of tea from the tea/ coffee maker in our room and a minibar was also available but like all hotels pricey! We stayed on the 11th floor but had no issues accessing elevators during our trip. Our rooms were serviced daily with fresh linen and we couldn't fault the service we received. 

We did visit the rooftop bar which has an amazing view of the Empire State Building so would recommend that to anyone staying.....plus the cocktails were delicious!

A funky, stylish and quirky hotel with is great for explorers like us....you won't be disappointed!

title: Nice hotel, great location
text:
We come here on holiday and what an Excellent hotel, in a fab location too. We booked bed and breakfast and to be honest we were disappointed in this and wouldn't recommend it therefore won't do it again but I would definitely stay here again. The staff were friendly enough

The roof bar is lovely with great views of the empire but as a family of 3 with a minor (16 year old) we couldn't all go in it together which was disappointing but this may be down to the laws instead of the hotel itself

title: Nice midmarket hotel
text:
One of the less expensive hotels in MAnhattan.  But it represents good value.

The rooms are not massive, but if you are visiting NYC then you shouldnt have much time in your room.

Beds are okay.  Bathroom is just a shower, no bath.  Again its sufficient.

Very dark rooms.  Dont want to really open blinds too much as the outlook is likely another building.

Staff are very friendly and helpful.  Use the limo service to the airport it is good value.

Best part is the location.  Midtown, walk to chelsea and the village.  Close to lots of subway lines including penn station.  Lots of stores and cafes near by.  A dry cleaner across the road.

Would recommend

title: Nyc art museum visit
text:
NYC has extraordinary art museums. I was able to visit the Museum at FIT, the MOMA, and the Whitney all in one day. 
The location is fantastic to walk to FIT. I was also able to walk to the Rubin. I will stay here again.

title: Fashion District Hit!
text: Loved this property in every way. Loved getting out of cab, straight to front desk,off to elevator with my rolling bag, all in a matter of minutes. Staff was friendly and helpful in every way.service with great smiles. Clean, efficient room and bathroom. Loved e bed and linens. Lighting could have been just a tad better but that's it. Great experience!

title: Decent hotel
text: Located in the Fashion District. Easy access to restaurants, subways. The restaurant on site RARE is very good. Good food and good drinks and good service. Our room was on the 18th floor, highest floor in hotel. Close to elevator but couldn't hear much elevator traffic. Three elevators are available so not much wait to go up or down but one elevator becomes reserved in the evenings for their Rooftop Bar which means a longer wait for elevator after 5pm. Clean room but housekeeping never replaced our dirty drinking cup. But this is not a major issue we just dealt with it. Love the coffee machine and I appreciated the hot tea K-cup since that is what I prefer in the mornings. Front lobby staff is helpful. Best feature is they kept our luggage after we checked out in the morning till we left for airport late in the day at no extra charge. Only downside--room felt a bit dated, peeling wallpaper but generally clean. It was ok for a quick weekend visit to NYC

title: Business
text:
Stayed at the Hilton Fashion District hotel on Sunday, August 20, 2017 for one night.
Let me tell you, not impressed. I have stayed at this hotel in the past.  I think the toilet was haunted, it kept flushing all night, at least it didn't give up its dead.  When we walked into the room on arrival, it smelled like an arm pit that had not been washed in weeks, i'm not kidding.  In addition, the light over top of the sink in the bathroom was burned out.  At least hey fixed it after we called down to the front desk.
The air conditioning was more like a fan, not that cool, we were kind of hot the entire night.  In summary, we were highly disappointed and the arm pit smell, that was 4 of the pillows that were in the room.

title: Weekend birthday visit
text: Went to visit NYC to celebrate my daughters 20th birthday. Great location away from the noise of time square. Room was clean, updated, modern .Was on the third floor and had no issues with street noise. Would stay there again.

title: Great Stay
text:
I usually hate staying in NYC. You know your room is going to be small and loud and your probably not gonna get a good night sleep.

This hotel was great. On the Hilton APP I picked a room away from the  elevator facing 26th street.. and yes the room is still a small NYC Hotel but I was completely comfortable. It was quiet and clean.

Great place!

title: bel établissement bien situé
text: Hôtel bien situé entre la 6av et 7av, près de time square, empire state building... Métro à 2 blocs. Chambre familiale spacieuse, bonne literie, propre et confortable. Roof top sympa avec bonne ambiance et superbe vue. Petit négatif le bruit de la clim.

title: établissement très satisfaisant
text: Accueil sans reproche. Qualité et propreté des chambres. Personnel à l'écoute. Ensemble très satisfaisant .Une adresse à recommander. Possibilité de consommer sur la terrasse avec vue panoramique sur New York

title: Good customer service!
text: Visiting New York City for the weekend. The Hilton is a nice and clean hotel with good customer service. We were able to check into our room a few hours early. Mily and Martha at the front desk were great!

title: Fantastic employees and customer service!
text: Our stay on the 11th floor was amazing! The front desk associates Mily and Martha were so nice and helpful they even let us check in early! The rooms were clean and tidy and I would absolutely recommend to anyone looking to stay in the city for a good price to check this place out.

title: Já me hospedei 3 vezes e melhorou!
text:
Esse típico Hilton nova-iorquino,  entrega o standard da marca para as unidades estadunidense, ou seja, hotéis upscale sem luxos, nem mesmo um Executive Lounge há aqui. Inclusive existe apenas uma unidade Hilton na Grande Maçã com o serviço e mesmo assim é um lounge extremamente espartano (New York Hilton Midtown).

Voltando ao Hilton Fashion District, você encontrará quartos muito pequenos, (atenção viajantes com muito bagagem), elegantemente decorados e com um bom banheiro apesar de pequeno.

Mas o mais bacana é a localização, Chelsea é tudo de bom, assim como os vizinhos Village e Lower East Side, ótimos para uma desbravadora caminhada, além disso o hotel está próximo das linhas 1,2,5, A, C e E do metro, ou seja, é extremamente fácil e pratico ir do hotel para  o aeroporto JFK, utilizando a linha E, o trajeto é direto sem conexões ou trocas de trem. 

Para minha felicidade o grande problema do hotel foi resolvido! O serviço de café da manhã gratuito para clientes Honor Diamond (acho que se estende aos clientes Gold) foi aperfeiçoado, agora o hotel oferece a possibilidade do cliente escolher entre um  voucher para ser utilizado em um café, próximo ou buffet completo no restaurante terceirizado no subsolo do hotel. 

*Espero que esse breve relato tenha contribuído na sua próxima escolha de hotel! 
**Meus relatos são baseados em experiências reais como viajante a trabalho e lazer, em mais de 200 diferentes hotéis em 4 continentes, principalmente das redes Hilton e Accor. 
;)

title: Great Location
text: A great hotel in a great location if you want to explore NY. Rooms are small however clean with good beds. Great rooftop bars with stunning views of the Statue of Liberty lite up in the evening. Good value for money.

title: Great Hotel and Great Location
text: Stayed here on our last 3 visits to NYC - located for exploring all areas of NYC with great shopping, landmarks and quirky independents of Soho and Chelsea within a good walking distance- tidy, clean and great value stay with friendly staff and great concierge for assistance with luggage storage, travel arranging etc - recommended

title: Clean and Good Location
text: Clean hotel, helpful staff and excellent location close to several subway stops and Penn Station. Good restaurant if you cannot venture out and roof top lounge with good views of city skyline. Two great coffee shops just around the corner (Variety and 7 Grams).

title: Great location and rooftop bar!
text: This stay was the final leg on a two week journey up the east coast, the hotel is well located and alot of sites are easily within walking distance. The bar and restraunt in the hotel are great and the best part is the rooftop bar! Fantastic views of the city! a great way to start a night out. The concierge was very helpful arrangin our taxi to the airport.

title: Great overnight visit
text: Had a great overnight visit here with my niece. Our double-bedded room was scrupulously clean and very comfortable. The staff was very welcoming on arrival, throughout the stay and on departure as well. The only slight complaint I have is that we had a long wait for an elevator to go back up to our room one afternoon. The location was great - within blocks of many subway lines. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Day in new york
text: Was a fantastic day, the hotel was in a great location only 10 mins away from time square. The hotel staff were very helpful and made us feel very welcomed. Great eateries near by too which was nice due to then time we had arrived in the evening.

title: What a gem!
text: We stayed last weekend (two adults, one child) in a room with two double beds; it wasn't huge but by NYC standards it was more than adequate space-wise, and the bathroom was quite big. Check in and check out we're painless and quick, and the luggage storage was welcome. All of the front desk and concierge staff were friendly and informative, and special mention to Charles at the front desk who went above and beyond to make our stay great. It was most appreciated! The hotel was in a great location, very close to convenient subway lines and about 8 minutes tops from Penn Station. We easily walked all over Manhattan with the hotel as our home base. The breakfast buffet at the hotel restaurant was adequate and tasty and had enough choices for everyone, and the relatively long hours for the buffet were great. Beds were comfy, water pressure was good, zero complaints -- and we're picky! Very happy with this hotel.

title: Quick overnight trip
text: The room was quite small...as expected but the bed as very comfortable and the room was clean. There is a rooftop bar with an AMAZING NYC view...one of the best I've seen. The hotel is located close to a subway stop and there is tons of tourist-y things to do around this area.

title: hôtel bien situé
text: Bel emplacement, proche du flatiron building de la High line, de Chelsea market ... chambre petite mais confortable, bonne literie, serviettes de toilette de bonne qualité, une petite salle de sport Roof Top accessible seulement à partir de 21 ans, dommage ! Accueil un peu froid

title: Amazing views
text: We had a wonderful time celebrating a birthday on the Rooftop!  With a sliding glass roof, you needn't worry about the weather. Great drinks, awesome music, with a fun vibe!  Put it on your list, if you are in the area!

title: I don't recommend this hotel.
text:
I book this hotel because 4 star hotel, but it is not 4 star like others.
I book two double bed(they don't have queen double)  one blanket has horrible sweet smell, room is small and staff was not kind enough like other 4 star hotel.
My wife and daughter sleep without blanket .
The thermal state cannot control. So, we sleep with cold temperature.
I don.t understand how this  hotel get 4 star and Hilton family.

title: Great hotel for the price
text: Stayed yesterday on the 11th floor of the Hilton. Front desk was awesome - was able to check in early which is always nice when you are traveling. We got to the RARE rooftop bar early -right at opening and was able to sit- soon after it got crowded but drinks and food were good. Room was clean. Overall great stay!

title: Horrible property, not worthy of the Hilton name or price.
text: The worst Hilton I've ever stayed in. Bed was horrible, room was never vacuumed, internet was slow or didn't work at all, maid service was substandard. Only benefit was the location. Do not select this property, even for the price.

title: As good as it gets!
text: Convenience to shops, restaurants, FedEx Kinko's (color or b/w printing using your DropBox account available + great & helpful staff), Whole Foods, Pret a Manger (1 within a block and another one on the second block), Starbucks (plenty on 6th and 7th Avenue). Easy to catch UberPool going Uptown or Downtown by walking a few steps to 6th or 7th Avenue.  Only guests can access elevators to the rooms. Hairdryer, shampoo, conditioner and soaps are all top! WSJ & USA Today newspapers available for guest plus daily water bottle per guest. Smiling and efficient staff awaits you! Great & relaxed stay! Thank you!

title: Muy buena ubicacion
text:
Este hotel está muy bien situado: a dos calles de metro, a 15 mn andando de Times Square y Teatros d Broadway, y a menos de 10 mn del Edificio  Flatiron. Muchos locales cerca para comer y desayunar.
El ambiente del hotel es muy agradable, así como sus trabajadores, todos muy educados y serviciales. Hablan español, por si es necesario.
Como único inconveniente, las habitaciones dobles son muy pequeñas, no tienen armarios adecuados para familias, ni espacio para dejar las maletas. Tampoco dejan muchos productos de aseo, pero si los pides, te los dan.
Nuestra estancia, ha sido agradable, unos ha permitido llegar a todos los sitios de interés con comodidad.

title: Perfect location in Chelsea
text:
Wanted to stay away from Times Square and stay somewhere a little less her, but central and with lots of good stuff locally.  When looking, the roof bar seemed a really good idea as there was a group of us going, and be nice to have somewhere local to chill out before heading out for an evening.
The bedrooms are a good size, especially by NYC standards, close to subway stations, hotel clean, plenty of amenities and friendly staff.
Next time i go to NYC, i'll be staying here again, great location, lots of local bars and eateries.

title: Weekend Visit to NYC
text:
We spent the weekend of June 30th to July 2nd at the Hilton Fashion District. Location of this hotel is excellent – easy access to the Subway, walking distance to many attractions and restaurants in the Chelsea district.

Check-in was quick, got the higher floor king-bed room I had requested and as a bonus we were able to do an early check-in (around noon). Room as quite large by NYC standards. Relatively modern look but the furniture was starting to show some age. For the price I paid, I could not ask for better.

Room was cleaned early during our stay, concierge and front-desk were very helpful. 

We really enjoyed our stay and this property will definitely be on our list if it is in our price range for future visits to NYC.

title: Good, well maintained hotel in the Fashion District
text: The hotel had nice rooms with comfortable bed and enough space in the room for a short visit.  The roof top bar is a nice place for a night cap with some good views.  If my travels take me to this part of town again, I would certainly stay here.

title: Great option on Chelsea
text: This is my second time there and the hotel is great, the rooms are not that small, and it is very well located, a walking distance to the Chelsea market and Meatpacking. The metro station is also a two blocks away.

title: Great location and rooftop bar
text:
I had not been to NYC in many years, I mainly was looking for a Hilton property where I could use my points and a hotel that had a rooftop bar. So lucky I found the Hilton NY Fashion District. My husband and I loved the location, convenient to tourist attractions without being in the middle of them, easy access to the subway. The rooms were nicely appointed. The rooftop bar was wonderful the views were amazing (I would have liked to had some regular domestic beer options). 

Our room faced 26th St. and had a nice view of the Empire State Building but there is a lot of activity and you can hear the street noise. Our flight got cancelled and we had to come back to the hotel for another night, this room was on the back of the building it was very quiet, but the view was of another building.  

If you are not wanting to be in the middle of everything this is a great place

title: Average experience
text:
Spent 3 nights at the Hilton.  
Check-in was very easy, room 1104.  First mistake after entering room, should have changed room!  The room had an odor which I noticed immediately, but I assumed that it would dissipate once the AC was running.  I really only spent the evenings there, but should have requested a change. Bed was not very comfortable.  On the plus side, bathroom was roomy with a nice stall shower.
Probably would not stay here again!

title: Enjoyed my stay
text:
I enjoyed my one night stay at this hotel. The hotel is fairly new, location was perfect for our visit to the flatiron district and herald square without the hustle and bustle. The room was a bit small but probably standard size for nyc. I key word searched "breakfast" here on tripadvisor and read that the breakfast for hilton gold/platinum guests were below standards. Having experienced the unsatisfying breakfast myself as a hilton honor gold member, I can understand the poor ratings. Hotel Management should read and find ways to improve. 

My only other complaint is the bed is very close by the air conditioning unit, which was very noisy. I had a hard time sleeping because if the noise.

The rooftop bar is great. If given the opportunity, I would stay again.

title: Location location location
text:
This hotel offers an incredible convenient location in the heart on Manhattan where Times Square,Broadway,Herald Square and the Flatiron building are nearby.
The hotel has a modern and trendy look,well appointed rooms, extremely comfortable beds and the shower has an excellent water pressure (always an important point in Manhattan!)
The bistro restaurant offers quality cuisine, I particularly enjoyed the spicy calamari.
Overall it was a very pleasant stay and the price range offers value for your money.

title: Very nice
text:
Nice place to stay 
Staff is good, clean rooms, elevators are activated by room key
Roof top bar and one in lobby 
Front desk staff is helpful
Small business centre is also located in lobby, you can get ur printouts and all from there
I enjoyed the stay
* try to get room at higher floor and ull get view of empire estate- good but not amazing view

title: Above Expectations!
text: Great stay. This hotel far exceeds NYC expectations in every sense, comfort, room, quality, service, etc. The location is super convenient to NYC attractions, like Penn Station, Time Square, shopping, dining, and much more.

title: Well managed, reliable HGI brand hotel
text: The Hilton Garden Inn fashion district is a little more hip than your standard HGI property, but it still provides a reliable and enjoyable experience.  I found the front desk staff to be very friendly, the elevators were quick, and my room was comfortable will all of the expected amenities -- desk and good chair for working, lots of power outlets, pretty decent sized bathroom, climate control that I could set, and a very comfortable bed.  The location (near Madison Square Garden) is ideal for going up to Times Square or down toward the village.  The only downside I encountered was the incredibly expensive breakfast.  I paid $35 for Eggs Benedict with fruit, and when I asked if I could sub the fruit for the home-fried potatoes that came with it, I was told "No".  HHonors gold status members don't get many options either, and unfortunately there aren't many other breakfast options nearby.

title: Just right!
text: Second stay at this hotel-- I requested it from our business travel dept. Not extraordinary, but very, very serviceable. Clean room, nicely decorated, small (though reasonable by NY standards). Arrived on a late (2 a.m.) train into NYPenn station, and was very comfortable walking down 7th to get to the hotel by myself. Front desk graciously found me a room on a high floor on the back of the building-- one of the rare times I heard nothing from the street in NY.

title: Convenient and Easy Access to Restaurants
text: Our stay was short but we were quite pleased with the service and the efficiency, cleanliness of the room, as well as the ability to check-in early. Staff were pleasant and friendly. Just overall a great experience. We would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Very comfortable room and bed
text: Great example of a well run Hilton property from the staff, the rooms, the cleanliness and the overall experience. The only negatives were the water pressure in the shower was more like a power washer.  May want to adjust that.  Also, the room is pretty dark, so a brighter hall light would be nice by the coffee maker and the closet.  Other than that, it's convenient, clean, comfortable and the bed was a dream!

title: The cheapest selection was not bad
