text: I choose this property due to its price.  For my purposes, the hotel was good, but except for the comfort of the bed, nothing stood out.  If you are looking for a place to rest your head while exploring NYC,

title: Brilliant hotel - great location
text: Fantastic hotel - clean, spacious and very well located. The staff are very helpful and the restaurant serves the most delicious steak!! Can highly recommend this hotel and will be back to stay next time I am in NYC!

title: Great hotel with great staff
text: We have stayed here several times and never had a bad stay. The hotel is excellent and in a really good location . The staff are really nice and helpful and the hotel is really clean with really good rooms . I strongly recommend this hotel.

title: Pleasantly surprised.
text: When we checked into the hotel the front desk was so nice and accommodating.We were so surprised. Then again when we checked out they were very nice again. We were not expecting this in New York. It was so nice. I would definitely stay there again.

title: Great Location - Great Hotel
text: Walking Distance from the Penn Station. Very clean Hotel, Great Roof Top Bar, Great Restaurant. Great Service. We ask to get the room early as possible and indeed we've got it at ~10:00am. We visit every night the roof top bar and it's really great (amazing view of the empire state building and great experience)

title: Convenient Hotel
text: This hotel is located in the Fashion District.  It is close to a number of subway lines and far enough away from Times Square so you don't have the crazy crowds.  Rooms are on the smaller side.  There is a very popular rooftop bar, the food in the restaurant is better than expected.  You can easily walk to this hotel from Penn Station.

title: 1 night stay
text: Good hotel for short stay. We were in town for a function at St Francis Cathedral & the location was great. It was just a few blocks to walk.  The room was clean, bed was comfortable. No issues from our end. I would stay there again. Only complaint would be that it was on the pricey side.

title: Great Hotel in Fashion District
text: The Hilton Fashion district is a really good location on 18th just off 7th ave. Very nice clean modern rooms some with viewa other no. Decent little gum in basement. Good breakfast. Has a very cool roof top bar with great views. But call to check if open. Shuts down many times for private events. The hotel has restaurant called Rare with excellent food. Especially burgers and steaks! Really priced well under $30 steak dinners in NYC

title: Great location and friendly staff.
text: Spent a comfortable few days at the Hilton Fashion District. We had a room at the back of the Hotel [not facing 26th Street] and it was amazingly quiet. The room is a fair size by New York standards and the bathrooms are functional but small. Lots of restaurants around the Hotel and walking distance to Time square and Union Square. The hotel staff were super friendly and the housekeeping service was particularly efficient and good. My only gripe was that it was half the price on a travel site so missed booking it on my honors program.

title: They have done it again
text: The service at the Hilton Fashion District is superb!!  It's nice that the front desk staff know me and make me feel so welcome!  You can't go wrong with the location and friendly staff who want to make sure you have a great stay!  there is also a rooftop bar that has fantastic views of the city!

title: Perfect for our weekend stay!
text:
Stayed over the Hilton Fashion district this past weekend and just loved it!  It was centrally located and our room was much bigger than most NYC hotel accommodations.  The gym had even better grade equipment than the one back at home and the rooftop bar was a great bonus!   As a Hilton Gold member, we also got the choice of free breakfast or an extra 1000 points.  Awesome, awesome awesome!

Prices are totally reasonable for what you get.  Would totally recommend!

title: Idéalement situé
text:
L'emplacement est vraiment super, au centre de New York , près de Time Square , non Loin des musées, de Central Park ...
Facilement accessible en métro vous trouverez des restaurants , bars, boutiques dans le quartier , le personnel est sympathique , les chambres sont propres .... seul petit bémol, le bruit de la rue était assez présent,  mais quand on arpente les rues New yorkaises toute la journée , et que l'on rentre épuisés on dort quand même comme des bébés :-)

title: Wonderful place to stay!
text: I went to NYC for my birthday with family. All of the staff were so friendly and wonderful. Special shout outs to Milly at front desk, who checked us in, and Sid who helped when i realized I forgot my toothbrush. The staff at the rooftop bar and the bar on the first floor were also great as was the waiter at breakfast and the nice staff person who held our bags. I cannot say enough about the staff. The room was a great use of space. I would definitely return.

title: Service was Topnotch!
text:
My husband and I spent our honeymoon here at Hilton Fashion District. Check in was breezy! 
When we arrived in our room, we smelled something really weird and called the Front Desk right away. They apologized and immediately the cleaning lady arrived to find where the smell was coming from. A few minutes later, the manager came up with Nick, the engineer/technician to help out find the weird smell. Nick graciously offered us free drinks at Rare Bar after finding out that were on a honeymoon. He also hooked us up for free buffet breakfast. He offered that we can ask for a change of room if the smell persists, but my husband and I decided we'd just stay since we didnt want to pack our stuff again.
We felt like we were staying at a friend's house. They were warm and helpful.

title: Love it
text: We are currently staying at the Hilton Fashion District, checked in yesterday.  Some of the negative reviews had me skeptical, but let me say the rooms are nice. Check-in was great.  Mariena (I think that's her name, I'm not good with names. She was excellent and friendly .  They were a bit busy and yes they are having elevator issues, but they are handling it well, getting guest to their rooms quickly as possible. The bathroom and  rooms are clean complementary waters. This is a gift for my husband's birthday, and he loves the hotel and location. This is our first time trying Hilton so this may become a favorite.

title: A week in New York
text:
My wife and I stayed at the hotel for a week for my niece's college graduation.  I had never stayed in this neighborhood before.  I chose the hotel because they seemed to be the only of the big chains that didn't jack the room rates to the sky during the week. 
 It was about 1/3 the cost to stay at this hotel compared to Times Square or the Financial District.  The rooms are small, but no smaller than any other Manhattan hotel.  It's in a great location, a short walk to 2 subway stations and Penn Station.  It's also a short walk to the High Line.  The hotel is on a lightly traveled side street so getting a taxi can be a chore, you're better off walking out to 6th or 7th avenues.  The bellman has access to a car service so getting to the airport is easy and the rates are competitive with cab fare to LaGuardia.  Dining options in the immediate neighborhood are little limited.  The front desk staff was very friendly and always helpful.  We had a problem with the water pressure in our sink and they sent an engineer up right away.

A couple of things that need improvement.  Hilton has a Digital Key system where you can check in before you get to the hotel and use the Hilton Honors smartphone application as a room key.  But if you don't select that option before checking in at the desk, it can't be added.  Additionally, the hotel charged my credit card for an extra $50 per day for incidentals.  That wasn't disclosed in any of the reservation information.  I expected a hold when I checked in but the charge was put through the night before I arrived.  Despite the hold, charges from the restaurant and bar were also put through on my card over the course of the week.  It all settled correctly at the end, but if you're close to your limit, you might have a problem.

Much is made about their rooftop bar.  Despite staying on the 22nd floor, right below the bar, we had to go all the way down to the lobby to get on the dedicated elevator to the bar.  When we got to the bar, the open areas on both ends were reserved for private parties, the only area available to hotel guests was in the middle of the bar, which is under a roof and not open like the ends are.  If the hotel is going to advertise the bar as a hotel amenity, it should be more accessible to guests than it is.

title: Super staff at this hotel
text:
From the moment I arrived early (11 AM), this staff was accommodating.  I overplanned the day by scheduling a 2 PM Broadway show, and I was concerned I wouldn't get to drop my stuff and refresh before the show, but they put me right into a room.

When I was in the elevator, a staff member asked me how my stay was, and he sincerely wanted to know.    

The housekeeping staff was also warm and friendly.  I worked out in the gym, and I heard them in the next room.  It sounded like they were having a morning staff meeting or something.  Whatever it was, they were clearly a happy team.  Then, I saw them in the hall.  There was lots of laughter, but they took the time to include me by offering me water.

The rooftop bar is not to be missed.  GREAT views and again...warm, friendly, efficient staff.

It's not the most convenient for walking to Broadway shows, but I purposefully chose it to stay away from the craziness of the theater district but still have easy access.

The gym is very small, but you can get a workout done if you know what you are doing.  Lots of smart choices were made by the designers in terms of space usage.

The rooms are NYC size (small), but it's well-decorated and in good shape and are clean.

title: Smiley
text: Hotel was in a great location, it was very clean. The room was small but comfortable.  The staff was very nice.  Parking a little bit expensive, but it was located close to the hotel.   My only issue was I was charged twice for my deposit and they couldn't figure out why and I had to wait a couple of days  before it was returned.  All in all a nice stay!!

title: Had a great time
text: Elevators only worked some of the time. Of 3 elevators 1 was out , 1 was restricted to only the rooftop restaurant leaving one for everyone else. Also, ice had to come via room service. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

title: This place has so much going for it!
text: Amazing location! Second time staying at this hotel and it doesn't disappoint. At check in, I was offered two room choices: upfront near the elevators or perhaps a quieter room in the back. I picked the first option and would encourage people not to shy away from that option! The only noise was from people getting off the elevator late at night and my recommendation there is that if you're going out drinking at night, please be considerate of your neighbors when you get off the elevator. Compact rooms but you get all you need, comfy bed, a nice desk and good sized bathroom. The restaurant is delicious. I would stay here again in a heartbeat...clean with friendly staff and a funky vibe.

title: Great Location, Friendly Staff
text: Arrived for a client event and they let us check in a bit earlier than usual so we could go explore New York.  Staff friendly.  I left my phone charger battery pack in the restaurant, the restaurant staff delivered to the front desk for them to ship back.  Don't have it yet but will update when I receive.

title: Great Location and Food Value
text: The hotel is updated and the restaurant is excellent. The roof top bar is pricey but the view is good. You can walk to Times Square and Madison Square Garden as well as a number of nice restaurants...

title: Wonderful stay!
text: Really enjoyed our recent stay here on the 17th floor. It's just a few blocks from the Flatiron area, 5th avenue shopping, tons of restaurants etc. Walking the opposite direction takes you to Chelsea Market. We had a King corner room and also another room with double beds. The King room had a decent view, with a very comfortable bed and pillows. I had requested a mini frig because they don't come in the rooms and I like to keep a few drinks cold. It was brought to the room upon check in. The double room had a very close up view of an office building in an alley. The plus to this is you don't hear any street noise. Everything was very clean. For some reason  the A/C in the hallways was extremely cold during our stay. If you don't like Keurig coffee, there are lots of places to get great coffee nearby, Seven Grams, Toby's Estate, Perpetuum Cafe and more. If you are looking to not be in the middle of the insane crowds of Times Square, this is a great spot. The staff is very nice, in particular Noel was extremely welcoming and kind. We enjoyed our stay

title: Fashion district Hilton is not very fashionable and needs some mending.
text:
This fashion district Hilton is not very fashionable and needs some mending.  

Lots of little things were broken or worn out:  The buffet breakfast was minimal and not even as good as Hampton Inn servers up; The shades in the room were shabby and did not close properly. letting in the morning sun; The elevator took forever to arrive; The room key card maker was broken; There were discarded beer caps under my bed; The TV did not get all the channels; The magnifying mirror in the bathroom had no illumination;  The room had a view of the next door office building.....

I will not stay here again when I'm in New York, because this does not live up to Hilton standards and is not worth the high price.

title: Excellent stay - as usual
text:
Well located and kept, this is my favorite place to stay at when need to be in the Chelsea/Flatiron area. 

Rooms are smaller than other Hiltons, but are cozy, clean, well maintained and sooo comfortable. 

Restaurant has great burgers and the roof top bar is great for a drink and relax after a busy day. 

But what really keeps me going back to this hotel, is service. EXCELLENT SERVICE! Zoribel, Martha and especially Marian Rock, will make you feel at home, every time. They really make an effort to ensure you are treated as the most important guest. Keep it up!!

Thank you for a great stay, again!

title: Weekend stay by mother/daughter coffee enthusiasts
text: This was a fun weekend stay in NYC  with my daughter. This hotel was clean and the staff was nice. The location was a little farther walking from our activities than I realized (5th ave area shopping, 30 Rock, etc), but once we started to learn our way around, it didn't feel quite as far as it had at first. The restaurant breakfast was lacking, as the menu was verbal and limited (3 or 4 items) and didn't open until 7:30 or 8:00. Further compounding this, there was no  hospitality in the form of immediate access to coffee or tea in the lobby (I don't care for Keurig coffee - there was a Keurig machine in our room). On the other hand, the beds were very comfortable! The mattresses felt newer and the pillows were great. I'm not typically someone who sleeps well, and I slept well both nights. I'd say my overall suggestion to this hotel is to start providing coffee or tea, around the clock, somewhere in this hotel! I think the lack of this, or a coffee shop across the street, tends to add to the feeling that this location isn't as convenient as a tourist would want.

title: Nice Stay
text: Overall, it was a good stay. Great location and I had a beautiful view of the Empire State Building. Diamond status was recognized and front desk at check in made sure I was accommodated well. He gave extra water bottles as my friends came with me to go to the rooftop bar. He even proactively offered three drink vouchers on Hilton to make me feel very welcomed, so I can share it with my friends. He did explain that the rooftop bar was not operated and owned by Hilton, so it is not Hilton's fault if it seems that many people come and go and wait on line to go to the bar. It is opened to everyone as it is by Rare Restaurant. Rooftop bar experience was great. Beautiful view of the city and good house wine. Breakfast was great actually. Huge portions and lots of choices on offer served by Rare. Service here at the hotel and restaurant were all quite nice and friendly. The room was fine and the bed was comfortable. Loved the amount of towels and pillows they provided. I appreciate that and even the set up was elegant. Although, the maid did not clean up some soap residue in the shower area, but the room was clean and good besides that. Loved the Keurig coffee machine and so easy to use and the instructions and reminders were a neat touch. I learned how to use Nespresso, now, but this machine was much easier to use and in a way it a bit more high-tech. I do wish they had an executive lounge for their gold and diamond members. Also, I do wish they were more proactive and accommodating to allow complimentary late check out for its gold and diamond members even if it is by an hour or two. A little gesture can go a long way. Other than that, thank you very much. I had a much better stay here than my two previous Hilton stays. This Hilton is quite good and I really appreciate it!

title: Nice hotel, good location
text:
My family recently stayed a couple of nights at this hotel.

Pros: The room with two double beds was a decent size.
The hotel has a little driveway to pull into which is much better than parking on the street.
The rooms were well decorated and clean.
The staff was friendly.
There was a rooftop bar (we never made it up there).
There is a good restaurant across the street and a good pizza place about a block away.
It was fairly easy to get there.

Cons:
I had a kind of weird reservation. I had two rooms for two nights and 4 reservations. I had to explain this to the front desk on 4 different occasions. It would have been nice if the first person was able to make a note or change in their computer systems so I didn't have to do this. I understand that it was my fault for making the weird reservations, but 4 times explaining it was a little much.
Parking is super expensive, but it was nice to have my car valeted and not have to worry about it.
There is a mini bar and the drinks were ridiculous. $4.25 for a soda. 
The rooftop bar was not open due to a special event on the one night we were able to get up there.
There is not a ton of stuff to do around there. I would not say it's walking distance to any of the main touristy areas.

Overall, I would recommend this hotel. It was a pleasant stay. I felt safe there and that's important when staying in a big city.

title: Trying hard but...
text: Having come there from a similarly priced full service hotel where I hace equal status, the depressing nature of the small and crowded lobby and small and modest room were striking.  The staff were pleasant enough but they don't have much to work with given the hotel's layout.

title: Week in New York
text: The hotel is excellently situated within easy walking distance of Madison Square Gardens, Times Square and Fifth Avenue. It was kept very clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful, I would stay again.

title: Great central hotel
text: We had a good 2 night stay at the hotel whilst on a business trip to NYC. Location was excellent, nice area with lots to do in the evening. Rooms clean and well appointed. Service and staff friendly. Definitely recommended

title: Very noisy, poor breakfast, not up to standard for a Hilton
text:
I travel to NYC once a month for business, staying somewhere between 3 to 5 nights.  I've staying in this particular hotel twice now this year, and possibly even reviewed it on here.  I am a Diamond HHonors member.

I took the option to pay extra for a "high floor".  This is a 22 floor hotel, so given I was paying extra was expecting floors 19+.  I got 16 (room 1611 to be precise).

I have 2 reasons for wanting a high floor - in NYC the higher you are, the quieter it is.  You also have some chance of not looking straight across into someone else's room. 

This was singularly the noisiest hotel room I have ever had the misfortune of staying in.  I arrived on a Saturday and the noise from the street below was extraordinary.  From groups of people in the early hours (most likely spilling out of the hotel's rooftop bar) to the garbage truck every morning between 2 and 4am the amount of noise coming in the obviously cheap and not-soundproof glass was extraordinary.

On top of that 1611 seems to be opposite some sort of linen closet where the staff felt the need to slam the door every 20 minutes all night.  In the course of a 4 night stay I estimate I slept no more than 2 to 3 hours each night.

To add to this the toilet obviously had an issue with a valve as water ran through that all night - this was mostly drowned out by the AC but on top of everything else it didn't help.

The next issue was breakfast.  In all my experiences in HHonors hotels the Gold/Diamond members get access to the full breakfast buffet.  This was also the case in my previous visit earlier this year, but by this visit it had changed.  We are now offered a very limited option of 4 or 5 a-la carte options and not allowed access to the buffet.  The options are poor.  On the first morning I had a croissant with bacon/cheese - it was terrible and took 45 minutes to be delivered.  One of the reasons I like the hhonors hotels is because I can get a quick buffet breakfast before going to meetings.  I don't have time for an hour round trip (due to elevators - see below) from my room for a greasy croissant.  Downgrading the breakfast like this is cheap.  I was paying $400+ a night for this stay, don't save yourself $2.  I gave up going for breakfast an instead picked up something on my way to the office.  My wife went for breakfast one more time to give it a try and see if it improved - it was a hot morning and she was refused any cold drinks - only tea and coffee were offered.  Simply abysmal way to treat customers.

The next issue was the elevators (or lack of).  This is a general issue in NYC but normally a hotel like this with 3 elevators can be relatively efficient.  This isn't the case when one of the elevators is blocked from guest use so it can be exclusively used to ferry non-guests to the rooftop bar.  This confirmed the elevator was working, but still during the day it was locked off from guest use leading to some VERY long waits.  This was exacerbated on my final evening when they had delared this elevator broken, and decided to still reserve one of the elevators for non-guests to get to the rooftop bar.  This meant a single elevator served the entire hotel.  I waited 25+ minutes to get down to street level.  For over $400 bucks a night, you must be joking!

A very bad experience - I did somewhat raise some of these issues with the staff, but after my attempt at explaining why the breakfast was no good I didn't see the point pushing it further, I will just remove my custom from the group instead.  I see you value your rooftop bar customers higher than hhonors guests.

title: Hilton with a roof top bar!
text: Great little hotel to stay in. Small rooms but very clean and cozy. The Wifi connectivity was strong and consistent. The overall location is convenient given the location within the city. The Roof Top Bar was a great bonus!

title: Very Disappointing
text:
No hot water on the morning of June 22nd. Ok, accidents and mishaps occur, but my disappointment was the blasé attitude from the front desk when I told them about it at 6:30am.   "Oh yes, we know", she said.  As I checked out an hour later I was asked: "did you enjoy your stay?". 

"Not really, I said, there was no hot water for me to shower this morning. . ". 
No response, the lady was already heads down sorting through receipts. She didn't care.  

Breakfast was also poor.  It took 20 minutes for my check to arrive after I asked for it. I even reminded 2 waiters.  The place was not even busy (7:20am).  And I'd  love 
to see the box that the "fresh squeezed orange juice" is poured from.  The granola I paid $8 for was almost certainly made from Honey Crunch granola bars being broken apart - I even had a corner piece on my plate. 

And it's true that the elevators can take a long time. 

On the plus side, room was comfortable.  However, there are so many other choices that I would never stay here again.

title: Visit friends before surgery
text:
The hotel staff was very friendly.  I liked my room.  It was quiet but contained the amenities.
There were no problems at all with my stay.  I was staying near friends before a surgery.  I would go back to this hotel. The fashion district area was fun to visit.

title: Gutes Hotel der Mittelklasse
text: Das Hilton Fashion District hatte eine gute Lage zu einem akteptabelen Preis. Zimmer sind gut, die Betten wie Hilten üblich sehr gut. Das Restaurant ( welches auch das Frühstück serviert) und die Rooftop Bar sind leider nicht auf der von mir gewohnten Hilton Qualität aber es gibt genug guten Restaurants in naher Umgebung

title: A Bad Apple
text: Poor Service, inability to solve problems, no items on the breakfast buffet, only 1 working elevator to roof top bar on a Friday night.  Took our guest over 30 minutes to arrive and us longer to leave because on the one elevator.  Computers were out in the dining area, which made it impossible to order off the menu.  On Saturday a.m. breakfast only one server working the entire floor.  Stay at another Hilton or Hampton..

title: Great Location
text: We recently stayed at the Hilton Fashion District during our family vacation to NY.  The hotel was in a great location, an easy walk to the Flat Iron District to visit Eataly and the famous Flat Iron building seen in so many TV shows.  There staff is very welcoming and friendly.  They were always happy to answer the tourist type questions we had and they provided many recommendations on the easiest way to get from point A to point B, places to eat, which tour bus company to use etc.  if you are flying in from the West Coasting a red eye-  be sure to join the Hilton Honors program and use the option for early check in!  The option allows members to pay $25 dollars and have their room available before the 3pm check in, subject to availability of course. If the room isnt ready you don't pay the fee.  This was a life saver for us!  We were able to check in at approx 9am EST, take a quick nap, get cleaned up and head out on our adventure without the worry of what to do with our luggage or stopping what we were doing to return to the hotel and check in.  I really enjoyed my stay here and will stay again when we return to NY.

title: One more star for the great service an good location
text:
Small rooms in a good location, only high floor privilege for Hhonors Diamond, except breakfast (that by the way is just acceptable)
Gym, Rare restaurant as well as the roof top bar also just acceptable by Hilton standards.
But the location is good and the service and personal nice and quite efficient.
Very nice restaurants and stores near by.

title: It takes a LOT to get such a low rating from me!
text:
Never thought I would give a place a one star, but I came REALLY CLOSE.  Read the reviews before booking about the elevator issue but thought it was being over blown....It WAS NOT

Pros are many. Very modern and updated (so updated that were laying new carpet on our floor as we arrived) Good location to midtown, Madison Square Garden, Empire State building and walkable to Times Square. Front desk staff were pleasant and attentive.  A functionality issue with the room was quickly addressed and remedied.  

BUT>>>>>  The elevators are very slow, small and few in number. AND to add insult to it, We returned one evening at Midnight, got on an available elevator and WAS TOLD WE HAD TO GET OFF SINCE IT WAS ONLY FOR PEOPLE GOING TO THE ROOF TOP BAR.   Yep, you got it.  Doesn't matter if you are a first time guest of Hilton or a Diamond level Hilton Honors, they will not let you on the elevator, you have to wait for another, just in case someone wants to go to the rooftop bar....and the roof top bar is not that special.  (Actually its small and overpriced) So there you stand, waiting for one of the few remaining elevators to come to the lobby while an empty and available elevator waits empty just in case someone comes and wants to go to the roof top bar.

The management here puts the patrons of the bar above the guests of the hotel!

Went for breakfast Sunday morning, ordered, and after nearly 40 min, manager says to multiple, patrons "sorry, tickets not printing in the kitchen.  You can wait for your order or go to the buffet".  Since we were pressed for time, we chose the buffet.  Few choices, poorly stocked as several of the pans were near empty.  Limited cold or warm choices AND was more expensive than the made to order breakfast.  Breakfast buffet should have at least been comped for the wait.  

In short, nice building, good location, Management more concerned with the patrons of the bar then guests of the hotel...... SHAME ON YOU HILTON!

PLENTY of options in NYC in this area.

title: Excelente
text: Adorei o hotel. Preço  justo. Todos atenciosos. Quartos em ótimo tamanho e limpos, camas super confortáveis.  Localização  bem legal, com restaurantes, metrô e lojas por perto. Dá  para ir a pé  para o Times Square.  O único senão é  que no terraço  do hotel  tem um bar aberto ao público. Eles possuem três  elevadores e nos horários  de pico do bar eles deixam apenas um elevador para os hóspedes e dois para os frequentadores  do bar. Eles têm que rever isso, pois o hóspede paga pelo conforto dos elevadores.

title: A nice Midtown Hotel but is it up to Hilton standard?
text: As a frequent Hilton guest at various Hilton properties in NYC, I still have mixed feelings about this particular property.  Surely the room is a bit larger than other properties, but not also not particularly impressive.  There are some pros with the hotel, such as a real premium high speed internet and a driveway for car services to drop off passengers.  The service was okay, but then I still feel that it is more like an upscaled Hilton Garden Inn, rather than a proper Hilton property.  The location is okay, as it is closed to the Red and yellow line, about ten minutes walk from Penn Station, and plenty of restaurants around the hotel.  I am not sure if I consider a fan of the hotel.  I have no problem staying here again, but possibly prefer other Hilton properties in the city.

title: Not quite up to standard
text: Although centrally located, this hotel has several issues. Reception staff is not particularly friendly and helpful. For example, upon checkout I consider it standard practice to see the check before my card is charged. The receptionist seemed baffled that I actually wanted to have a look at it to check whether any unwanted items were added. Moreover, the Honors breakfast is a bummer. It's a long time that I have eaten such an uninspired French toast. I don't quite understand why they don't let those guests have the buffet without, say, the hot items. I wasn't impressed by the cleanliness either. Particularly the common areas were not clean. My room was also missing a coffee maker. I had assumed it was out for replacement but throughout my four night stay it didn't arrive back. One night I woke up because there was construction noise somewhere below my room. It lasted for quite some time and the next morning you could see that some works had been undertaken. There was never a notice for this. Lastly, their roof top bar has a nice view but is outrageously expensive and poor quality. I probably had one of the worst Mojitos I ever had for 15$. So, bottom line, I think this hotel needs to fix a couple of things before it's worth paying 300$ a night.

title: Location Location Location
text: Just the perfect location to Times Square and Wall Street.  Hotel had a fantastic rooftop bar where you can relax, have a drive or two, and a view of Empire State building.  My room was clean and comfortable.  Customer service was superb from check-in to bar tenders and the Mr. Elevator man.  I would definitely go back and stay at this hotel.

title: Great hotel in the area.
text: Great hotel near 28th street. Couple of blocks to subway. Convenient but not noisy and crowded like mid-town. I was able to get to Time Square by train in less than 10min. Breakfast as a Gold member was just ok. Selection was not much and the omelette they make for you was kind of tiny.

title: Finally found my midtown hotel
text:
I am am regularly in this area for business, and have shopped several Hilton hotels. I think I finally found the right place to stay.

The rooms are more spacious than many hotels in midtown. The view rooms are worth it. The third elevator helps a lot during busy times. While the restaurant Raw isn't my favorite, it's nice to have it onsite. And the rooftop bar is a nice option for a nightcap.

Two quirks I didn't care for:
1. Cool water in the shower. It might be hot for part of the shower, but not the duration.
2. Diamond Hilton members get a breakfast voucher, yes, but it's good for only two dining options. Strange. Just give us "$15" or whatever toward breakfast, so we can choose our options.

title: Poor customer service
text: this was a purchase from the old wyndham hotel, so whatever you are expecting from a hilton, dont expect it here. no room upgrade available, no extended check out available either.  there are no slipper or bathrobe or water in room. When asked for water at the lobby. their response was rude and said you can only have two per room, they cant give you the whole case.   the lobby is a mess as there is a roof top bar, the elevator takes forever and if someone comes back from 4am partying on saturday night, you will be awaken by it and hear every single detail of their conversation.

title: Jennings
text: Great stay, great location and really great staff. Would recommend to others and will stay there again. The bathroom was nice, the room was just big enough and the staff was great. i was very pleased with my stay!

title: Don't go!
text: The elevator wait times were the worst I have ever experienced at any hotel anywhere. And, when one of the 3 elevators was not working, the staff prioritized people waiting to go to the rooftop bar over the paying guests who were waiting to get to our rooms! I'm pretty sure I was generating more revenue for the hotel during my stay then the bar guests. I frequently had to wait over 15 minutes to go up to my room, or to go down to the lobby.  The staff joked about the elevator not working, that they frequently break, and that they should have installed a better brand of elevator. It took over 2 days for the elevator to be fixed!  During one breakfast, we found pieces of plastic floating in the container of milk that we were served. When we showed it to our server, they were very nonchalant about it and simply gave us another -- no apology, nothing.  I have never had a worse experience at a hotel (or a motel for that matter!)

title: Clean and comfortable. No frills
text: We stayed one night and our room was clean and comfortable. My only real complains are that the in-room coffee was terrible and my shower was not as hot as I would like.  We stayed on the 16th floor and could see the top of the empire state building. We did not go up to the rooftop bar, but I hear it's nice.  The restaurant in the lobby level - Rare - was good.

title: Lo recomiendo
text: Aunque la relación calidad-precio en New York es complicada por los altos precios, este hotel cumple con lo requerido en un hotel de 4 estrellas. Por ponerle una pega quizás que ponen que hablan español, pero nada más lejos de la realidad. Buena ubicación, buena comunicación con el metro y muy limpio.

title: Very average- felt like a Hilton Garden Inn, not a full service Hilton
text:
Very average hotel. It felt like a Hilton Garden Inn, not a full service Hilton. 

First the good - very small reception desk, but they were very efficient in checking people in / out. Minimal wait time. Decent bathroom size. When I checked in they told me my room rate included breakfast, but if I chose not to eat breakfast they will offer 2000 additional points

The poor - no doorman / bell-person at the door to help with bags when you arrive in a cab. Poor sound-proofing - I was in the 17th floor but still could hear all the street noises like horns, ambulance sirens, etc. The rooftop bar was closed by 11pm on the night I was there. The air-conditioning unit in my room kept turning off even through I had the unit on High (and not Auto) so it could drown out street noise, but that obviously didn't work.

title: Excellent experience all around!
text: This is a nice hotel. I was there on business. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Little touches like Keurig coffee in the rooms is a nice touch! Nice bar, restaurant and a rooftop bar. Will go there again.

title: Great accomodation
text:
Very close to Time Square, 5th Avenue Shopping, public transport and Theatres.
Bar and snacks, friendly helpful staff and little traffic noise. Close to plenty of eating in Hells Kitchen...check out Spoonfed on West 51st

title: Good value for money
text: Stayed here for one night with visitors from overseas while sightseeing. Hotel was good value for money. Fairly central without the madness and noise of midtown. Rooms were on the larger side for NYC.

title: Super Nice Staff in Heart of New York City
text: I stayed at this hotel for three nights, and couldn't be more impressed. From the cleanliness of the hotel to the friendliness of the staff, everything was great! I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Boa escolha em NY
text: O hotel fica numa boa localização, perto de cafés, metros e perto de um supermercado whole foods. Os quartos são pequenos como quase todos hotéis em NY, e não tem frigobar só uma geladeira com produtos para comercialização. O atendimento dos funcionários é bom.

title: New York New York
text: We stayed at the Hilton for a wedding. The room was very clean and the staff was very friendly. The hallways were freezing and that is our only complaint. We had drinks & nibbles at the restaurant where the waitress was very friendly.

title: Great visit!
text:
My family stayed at the Hilton Fashion District for a long weekend right before the holidays and it was great overall.  The standard room was fairly large and roomy for NYC, well appointed and comfortable.  The hotel location is really great, and was easily accessible to a couple of subway stops or attractions on foot; we used Uber only a couple of times because walking or taking the subway was so convenient.  

The only challenging part of our stay was checking out, which took at least 20 minutes since there were only 2 representatives and a long line of people leaving.  Once we finally checked out, while we were waiting for our Uber, I noticed that we were charged double the nightly rate quoted on our reservation.  Once we went back inside and showed our confirmation email to the manager, we were refunded the difference, but I'm not sure how challenging that could have been if we hadn't noticed until we had already left.  Since it was handled so easily, I would still stay here again - it's a great option based on the price and location!

title: Hilton Fashion District hotel is excellent!
text: The Hilton Fashion District hotel is an excellent hotel for a quick business trip to New York City. It is convenient to the Javits Center and mid-town Manhattan businesses and the subway to lower Manhattan. Good restaurants are nearby. The staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms are small but new and modern. The cost is less than many larger mid-town hotels of the same class.

title: Buono per la vista
text: Hotel in chiave moderna ,noi abbiamo scelto una camera piano alto con vista .Eravamo al 21 piano con vista Empire bellissimo. La posizione dell'hotel e buona e permette a piedi di visitare la città .La colazione viene servita in un locale sotterraneo "Rare" che ha le pretese di un ristorante di lusso con tanto di addetto che ti accompagna al tavolo , ma è veramente brutto con un buffet molto scarso (capisco che siamo a New York, ma nulla a che fare con altri alberghi Hilton) alla fine abbiamo chiesto due caffe espresso chiedendo conferma al cameriere che fosse compreso oltre ad essere pessimo l'hanno addebitato sul conto a 10 dollari più tasse.... nonostante le nostre rimostranze . in conclusione l'unica nota positiva la Vista ......e la posizione .

title: Good hotel in great location!
text:
I was torn between booking the Conrad (great room at a further location) or this Hilton (prime location for me but with a much smaller room). When I first walked into the boutique-style hotel and went into the room, my first thought was "I should have booked at the Conrad"... however, that thought quickly went away.

Yes, the rooms are small, but for New York standards, they were actually pretty sizable. I stayed in a two double bed room with plenty of room for me and my best friend. Great sized television, bathroom with hot running water at all times (these days, sometimes that's not a given, even at high brand hotels!), decent sized bathroom and great sized shower.

Pros: internet speed was fast and reliable, and loved that I did not have to sign in every night. Also, as mentioned, room size was a pro (although, warning for non-new yorkers, rooms are very small compared to, say, a Hilton or even a Hampton in the west and around Texas... think of room sizes similar to London). Plenty of lifts and never had to wait for more than a minute or two. Easy access to taxis and Ubers always showed up within 3 minutes. And the beds! Probably one of the most comfortable beds I've had in a while in a hotel. Also, air conditioning works great!

Cons: in the 14th floor and little to no mobile phone service (but thankfully, wifi was reliable and T-Mobile as free wifi calling which worked great! However, this may be an issue for other travelers). Also, it can get very loud in the lobby area at night due to rowdy parties, but thankfully it's quiet in the rooms! My room didn't have a great view (a brick wall), but this was not a big issue for me, but may be for others. Still plenty of light coming inside. Rooms can be a bit darker, even with all lights on, but nothing too terrible.

Overall, a pleasant stay. For the location, the size of the rooms and the price can't be beat! Hilton diamond member and had great service from the staff

Please be advised: diamonds, there is no lounge at this hotel. But honestly, given that I was out and about the entire day, I later admitted to myself that I would not have even had time to enjoy the lounge. However, might be a decision maker for business users.

Traveling with my best friend for three nights.

title: Not bad but noisy
text:
I stayed for three nights this Memorial Day weekend. I paid for a upgraded "high floor" view. They put me on the 22nd floor, which they said was their highest. The room had a beautiful view of the empire state building, but the noise ... They told me beforehand that the room was right below their rooftop bar and that I might hear "a little" noise. Little was an understatement. Listen, I love to have fun and don't mind a little noise - I don't book hotels in NYC Memorial Day weekend for a "quiet stay" but the constant thud of base from above from about 12 pm to 1 am Friday, Saturday, and Sunday was just a bit much. I really couldn't stay in my room during the day just to chill and relax - you have to turn up the TV loud to drown out the noise. At least one night I was trying to go to sleep before 1 AM - not happening with all that music. By the end of it I had bags under my eyes. For the amount of money I was paying per night to stay there, I don't expect that level of noise nightly - ya'll need that sound proofing asap.

Also - the breakfast buffet was a little weak. Their process for seating is a little strange, they have a perfectly good back area to seat buffet guests but instead go through this off greeting process which takes unnecessary time. The food was mediocre for a what I would expect from a Hilton brand. There weren't many people at all  at the restaurant yet the staff seemed to be hustling. They weren't very attentive to the buffet, food ran out and was not replaced speedily. Fruit was kinda stale - bananas were days old and had brown/black parts throughout when I tried to eat it. Bacon was fine though. Potatoes were a average. All around rather low quality for a Hilton imo.

The rooftop bar itself though is pretty awesome and convenient for a fun time if you're staying at the hotel. Also the hotel's location and proximity to other NYC things to do is good.

So, in sum ... PROs - location, rooftop bar, clean room, nice view on high floors. CONs - noise level on high floors interferes with sleep, breakfast is meh. Between the noise and and the sub-par breakfast I can't say I recommend you stay here unless there's some sort of special. For the amount I paid, I wasn't completely satisfied, especially about the noise. If you ARE going to stay here, request a floor with a view but DO NOT accept the 22nd floor, or bring some earplugs.

title: Great Stay
text: We just stayed at the hotel one night this past weekend.  I booked it using Groupon so got a great deal. We loved the location and how friendly and helpful the staff was.  We valeted our bags since we arrived early in the day.  A very nice service and no charge to guests. When we checked in Charles at the front desk gave us cards for a comp'd breakfast which was really nice.  I am not sure if that is because I am honors member or because he is just a great guy.  Either way we totally enjoyed talking to him and truly appreciated the great customer service.  The room was small but very clean and comfortable.  The bathroom was a great size and very bright.  We heard very little noise from the street, a complete surprise being in the city and even though we were across from the elevator we heard no noise.  We enjoyed grabbing a cocktail on at the rooftop bar.  Mine was called Up for it? and it was so delicious.  Though the weather was not the best the views were still very nice.  We would definitely stay here again.  Being below Times Square is much quieter and we also were able to take advantage of walking from both uptown and downtown.  There is a subway stop very close to the hotel if you decide to take the subway.  We walked and used the subway during out 2 days.

title: Um bom hotel em NY
text:
O hotel é novo e os funcionários atenciosos. O que pesa em NY é o custo, mas isso é uma questão geral em Manhatan, então não há muito o que fazer. 
A única ressalva é que nós pensávamos que havia frigobar no quarto, mas, na verdade, era uma geladeira comercial com os produtos oferecidos pelo hotel e não tinha espaço para armazenamento de coisas particulares. Com isso tivemos que ficar levando nossos pertences na recepção para gelar na geladeira do hotel, uma vez que era remédio e necessitava de refrigeração. 
Fora essa situação, não tivemos qualquer inconveniente.
Quanto à localização, o hotel exige uma caminhada para a Times Square, mas nada que seja demasiadamente cansativa.

title: Great location
text:
We booked this hotel because the reviews were good and the prices were the best we could find for the holiday weekend. The location is good; subways are easily accessible and uber rides are cheap. We paid for a high floor room with a view. We were given the 17th floor (of 22 I believe?) without much of a view at all. Normally I would have returned to the front desk but due to traffic we arrived much later than planned and only had less than 45 minutes to get ready for a broadway show. 

The room sizes are good for the city. The bed was super comfortable and the bathroom clean. We had read previous reviews about no refrigerator so we had previously called to request one and found it in our room upon arrival. They do not have an ice machine which is odd but did bring a bucket filled with ice up to us when we inquired. 

Overall we were pleased with the location and quality of this hotel and will consider it in the future!

title: New York stay
text: Arrived at Times Square and no queues at front desk. Directed to room which was clean and comfortable. Breakfast a little disappointing. General manager personally looked up train times for us and gave us helpful info for our onward journey.

title: Super Hotel in top Lage
text: Für einen Städtetrip total zu empfehlen. Super zentrale Lage von der aus man alles zu Fuß erreichen kann. Schöne (ruhige) Zimmer, super Betten und sehr, sehr nette Mitarbeiter. 100% weiter zu empfehlen.

title: Not for Diamond Members
text: Reserved the hotel room with hhonors points. Called them a day before to ask for a complementary Diamond member upgrade and I was told to call the morning of the day I check-in. When I did that, I was told that I will be given the room on the top floor with a view of Empire State. While checking in they tell me that the room was given to some one else for some reason and they put me on 15th floor with literally no view at all. This, to me, amounts to cheating. I will be cutting short my stay to just one night and will never ever considering staying here again.  A very bad way to start a trip to celebrate wedding anniversary.

title: Staying at the NYC Fashion District
text: Modern and convenient hotel for the New York fashion district. Rooms are small but workable. Facilities are adequate and a nice roof garden for a drink with an excellent view. Internet is excellent and staff friendly. Many things to do including walking in the high line

title: Good hotel, small rooms for price.
text:
Good hotel in a good location. 
Staff lovely,  very helpful and friendly. 
Nice and clean. 
Rooms small for price. 
Nice location out of the hustle and bustle. 
Not far from Madison square and Macy's etc. Only 20 mins walk from Times Square.

title: Hidden Gem in Chelsea
text: We ALWAYS stay at the NYC Fashion District Hilton in Chelsea.  It's very close to Penn Station, Madison Square Garden, and lots of restaurants and shopping.  The staff is always friendly and accomodating.  There is a great restaurant called RARE.  There is also a rooftop lounge that gives an incredible view of the city.  The rooms are always clean and the elevators work great.  Rates are usually reasonable for NYC.  We have been staying there for 8 years and continue to have positive and enjoyable experiences.

title: Relatively good value
text: This is mid range hotel in New York where rooms are tiny and expensive so this hotel was a good option for us over christmas and new years eve. The hotel has good location, staff was very nice and helpful. It was clean, rooms are small but that's expected in NY. Overall I was pretty happy and it was exactly as expected.

title: Wonderful stay at Hilton
text:
This is my second stay at the Hilton New York Fashon District.
Sure will stay again at this wonderful hotel. Very clean rooms, helpful staff, tasty breakfast. Near to everything. You can do a lot of shopping, many good shops around the area.

title: Very good value
text: Stayed here for a business trip and found the staff and hotel very good.  Everyone was friendly from front desk staff to housekeeping.  Rooms are adequate and clean.  I would recommend this hotel for leisure or business trips.

title: Bien grâce à sa situation
text:
Cet hotel est interressant grace à sa situation idéale dans midtown qui vous permet de découvrir NY. A pieds il est à 20 mins de Time Square, 40 de Central Park.
Pour le reste il est très standard et même décevant sur certains points :
- la première journée notre chambre est restée telle quel, c'est à dire que personne n'est venu faire le lit, etc...On nous a expliqué que c'était un oubli...(on est dans un Hilton à 230 eu la nuit)...
- l'approvisionnement en eau chaude est un peu aléatoire. Un matin j'ai terminé ma douche à l'eau froide, un autre matin la même chose dans une autre chambre occupée par ma famille...
- Mauvaise Isolation phonique des chambres donnant sur l'avenue, mais bon il faut dire que NY est une ville très bruyante. Les chambres donnant sur l'arrière sont ok.
- Lorsque votre voisin prends sa douche on a l'impression qu'il est dans votre chambre ! Curieux car les autres bruits sont bien isolés.
- Restaurant proposant une cuisine 100% américaine. Sans plus.
Points positis : 
- Le wifi indiqué à 15 USD par jour ne concerne que le WIFI haut débit. Il existe un wifi gratuit bas débit largement suffisant pour les emails, photos, etc...
- excellente literie.
- Ecran geant dans les chambres.

Un point important : il existe 2 tarifs, un pour les étages bas et un plus cher pour être plus haut.
Autant pour les chambres donnant devant, avec vue sur l'empire state cela peut être bien, autant sur les chambres arrières le surcoût est inutile. On voit juste le mur du building d'à coté !
Bref, je ne sais pas comment sont les autres hotels de NY mais celui-ci ne doit son salut qu'à son emplacement. Le nom Hilton est une facade...

title: Terrific staff and great views.
text: We were up on a getaway weekend and usually avoid the chains preferring the smaller hotels.  We stayed at the Hilton largely because of the price (about $60 less a night then most boutique hotels we checked.)  Very happy with the choice. The room was huge for NYC. Everything was well maintained and the staff was super pleasant and helpful.  This hotel claims great views from their rooms and it certainly was true from ours. Its the tallest building in the area so I expect most rooms have equally terrific views. This is a good bet and only a half dozens blocks from Penn Station.

title: A good CLEAN Value
text: Great location - nice front desk folks - clean room. For the $ - hard to beat! Roof top bar was OK - waiters and waitresses all very nice. What they lack in trendiness they make up with Hospitality. Hey,  southern- it goes a long way with me. Even if they talk funny.

title: Website does NOT reflect the Hilton New York Fashion District rooms
text: The pictures shown on the Hilton New York Fashion District website are “absolutely” not what we were given!  We paid a premium to stay in the Hilton New York Fashion District “Ultra-modern, boutique-style hotel” which is a joke – the website pictures are from twenty (20) years ago!  I requested connecting rooms which I agreed to pay $80.00 – these were not available and never made available  King size bed room was TOO SMALL  HVAC system (air conditioner) was located right at the head of the King size bed and one of the two (2) double beds  Cold air blowing across the head of bed caused us to have to shut OFF the HVAC system at night – it was too much air velocity even on low fan setting, cold and/or on & off all night  We heard every toilet flush and/or door slam with the HVAC system turned off  King room toilet seat was loose and slipped around when you sat down – it was like that from the very beginning of our reservation but after two (2) days of putting up with the slippery seat I called the front desk and asked them to fix it which they did that afternoon – the key point here is that I should NOT have had to ask for the repair!  As expensive as these rooms are it PISSED me off that the room refrigerator is full of liquids / liquor that I will have to pay for if the door is opened – I had to ask for an empty refrigerator, the room was already too small – this refrigerator is NOT mentioned on the website - Hilton $$$ maker at my expense  There is NOT an Ice machine anywhere – it took one (1) hour for them to deliver ICE!

title: Location, service,rooftop bar all tops
text:
Very nice hotel, rooms a little small but it is NYC,  staff was excellent , rooftop bar was fun, piano bar across the street was a lot of fun with good staff

Price was reasonable 

Parking was pricey but again it's the city 

Would definitely stay again 

Short walk to penn station so nice location to get around the city

title: Good location, nice accommodations
text: Stayed here on a quick overnight business trip and was shocked that I didn't previously know about it given how many business trips I take to NYC via Amtrak. It's only a short walk from the train station and centrally located close to most mid town West side attractions. The accommodations and staff are very good. Burger I ordered from room service was good too. You will enjoy your stay.

title: Great location
text: I been the top of the Hilton Honors program since 1988, so I know my Hilton's. Also, lived in New York for 68 years. This is a great hotel if you are coming to New York City on Amtrack, N. J. or the LIRR. Only a few safe block walk south. The down side was the shower in our room, you had to reach in to turn it on and there was a glass wall for about 1 1/2 feet, so it got hit with cold water. If you are coming to New York City to see the World, you would be better around 42nd street, more subway lines north and south, also one west to east, with free transfers. Plus many of the sites are north of 42nd street. Also, nice spot down stairs for breakfast. always look for a hotel that you don't need a subway to keep getting to the areas, you want to see, it gets expensive.

title: Good stay
text: New hotel. Good location close to subway. Clean room and comfortable bed. No noise issues. Friendly service. I didn't try the restaurant or bar as I was only staying overnight. There are lots of restaurants nearby.

title: Great choice especially if this is your first NYC visit !
text:
We've spent five nights at this hotel. The location is great, with all the subway lines 2-3 blocks away, lots of places to eat around the hotel and Times Square is a mile away, The Village is also within walking distance, and so is the High Line.
The staff was kind and helpful, and helped us with information regarding all our requests. (hotel transfer, Broadway tickets, and so on). 
The rooftop bar is also a nice touch. We had a King room on the 11th floor. It was clean, spacious and quiet, facing the street, with a relatively generous bathroom and decent WiFi.
I would not hesitate booking the same hotel on my next NY visit.

title: Exceeded my expectation
text: We picked a hotel for location but it turned out the service succeeded beyond our expectation.  the staff were super friendly and has a really cool roof bar and obviously easy to walk to everywhere. ++

title: Great location and confortable!
text: Spacious room, great staff and a perfect Location. We stay for four days with my husband, the Hotel counts with a rooftop but is a shame that they do not have a special rate for guests. Just crossing the street is a quiet place to drink beers and enjoy a snack (fish and chips are ver good). Definitly we will come back.

title: Sonno...
text:
Pernottato per 4 notti. Camere non particolarmente pulite. Vero è che si gode di una bellissima vista verso l'empire, però le stanze non sono particolarmente insonorizzate. Se avete un sonno leggero, non è consigliata la scelta di una camera "piano alto con vista verso l'empire". Personale discreto.
Hilton almeno ti da una garanzia in più rispetto a tanti altri.
Nel complesso accettabile.

title: Comfortable, very clean and convenient
text: We stayed here as guests of a wedding nearby, and it really was ideal.  The room was small but comfortable and very clean.  There was a coffee maker, safe, iron/ironing board and mini-bar (which we avoided at all costs).  There is apparently a roof-top bar/restaurant but we didn't have time to go.

title: great hotel, great location
text: I didn't expect this place to be so economical, because it's a Hilton. I sort of expected it to be half under construction or something to explain the good price. But I was so surprised- great service, great room, great location, great price. I'll watch for this one again!

title: Happy stay
text: The front desk women and men made this Hilton hotel an absolute pleasure for me. Led by the charming and helpful manager, Sam, they catered for all my needs during my stay from April 27 to May 6 and always with a smile

title: Week in NYC
text:
This was the second trip in 18 months to NYC for my wife and I.we booked the hotel via Tripadvisor (redirected to Hotels.com) about 10 days prior to departure managing to obtain a great prepaid rate of just over £215 per night for 7 nights.We arrived via Taxi from JFK around 9.30pm on a Saturday night.the lobby was busy with people coming and going from the hotel bar and waiting for the dedicated elevator to the rooftop bar, however we were given a warm welcome by the reception desk and able to check in under 2 mins.

We were allocated a king size bed room on a high floor (18th, room 1815).the room was spacious by NYC standards.clean and with all the amenities you need e.g iron and board, hairdryer and plenty of fresh towels.The view wasnt picture postcard however we did look onto the adjacent building roofs with the typical new york water towers and fire escapes and you could see the top portion of the world trade centre.this did also mean there was no street noise so no issues getting to sleep.Our room was situated behind the elevators however you only heard the occassional whooshing sound in the morning with increased traffic of people going for breakfast or leaving the hotel.aircon was great (much needed during our stay with temperatures around 74f) with an easy to use control panel on the wall by the tv.The bed was extremely comfortable so much so we are going to replace our memoryfoam mattress at home as the sleep we had on the hotel bed surpassed this.

the hotel restaurant - Rare - is a much underated gem.We had dinner in here one night.portions were huge and delicious as was the wine.i had the new york strip which was cooked to a perfect medium rare and was more like a chateaubriand for 2 to share.the price of our meal here was less than half we had in the various restaurants we dined at around the city but surpassed a few of them in quality.

The rooftop bar was ok.the cocktail menu was limited on our visit but the views were spectacular.it did seem to get busier during our visit with an afterwork local crowd and therefore not as touristy as say 230 fifth.

The location of the hotel for us was the real highlight.situated closer to the corner of 7th avenue and 2 mins walk to the corner of 6th, you are spoilt for choice with local bars, restaurants and landmarks as well as having several subway lines within a block or 2.having previously stayed on 53rd st in midtown; being situated in chelsea made travelling downtown and to brooklyn that must faster and less crowded as getting the subway from 28th or 23rd st meant most tourists would get off by 34th st.The location also felt more like the real New York (compared to the madness of Times Square).you knew the option was there if you wanted it - go to the corner of 7th and look north and you can see the billboards - but there is a high concentration of apartment blocks so you feel you are more in an actual neighbourhood.

We are already planning a return trip for later in the year and this hotel is certainly top of our list for our stay.I would say provided there is a clean comfortable bed and hot shower that is all you need as a base to explore NYC, however this hotel goes above and beyond in so many respects.

title: Quick Business Trip
text: While I was only in for a quick trip for business, the staff at this hotel was great.  The agents were friendly and outgoing from the moment I checked-in.  After speaking with the agent that I was in for business and would be spending most of the night working, he even gave me a complimentary upgrade on my internet speed, helping me speed things along with my work.  I had a wonderful room with a beautiful view of the Empire State Building.  Next time I am in New York, this will be my go-to hotel.

title: Great location
text: I love the location of this hotel. A one mile walk north or south covers a lot of great restaurants, bars and relevant businesses and tourist sites.  The rooms are small, but big enough. The staff is pleasant and helpful. They have a pretty nice rooftop bar that really makes this an attractive spot as well. I did, however, have a bit of a hot water issue in the shower over a couple days, but it wasn't a huge deal. This place has what it must and the location is great.

title: Hilton Fashion District
text: Very convenient location. Room is very small, but read this is standard for New York. Walking distance to main attractions, or easily reachable by taxi or subway. Did not try the restaurant or the rooftop bar, but saw the line of people waiting to go up everyday. Very nice and friendly staff, from front desk to housekeeping.

title: Great location, staff and comfortable room
text: I was very impressed with my recent stay at the Hilton in the Fashion District in the Chelsea area in NY. The staff was professional, efficient and friendly. The room was large, beautifully appointed and clean. I especially enjoyed the choice of pillows and the bed which was very comfortable. We were on a high floor and enjoyed the views of NY and the window that opened. The location is very convenient to everything. I will definitely be returning.

title: I'd stay again if it was cheap
text: So many hotels to choose from in NYC, but I would stay here again if the price was right. Rooms are a little on the small side, even after upgrading to a high floor, king room. The view was nice. I found it very hard to believe they did not have a microwave avaliable for the room. There was a perfect, empty space for it above the coffee maker. They would rather leave it empty it would seem. If you stay here, do not stay on the top floor, 22. They have a rooftop bar/lounge that's open until 1am. We could hear the thumping music in our room until it closed. Floor 21 or under would have been better.

title: Great stay!
text: Excellent location, clean and friendly staff. Rooms are modern and includes free internet service which was fast. Request of high floor facing street was honored. Great value for price paid. Stay here- you wont be disappointed!

title: Friendly Staff and Clean Room
text:
It's not the most exciting Hilton you've ever stayed at but it's functional. 
Pros: The rooms were updated and clean, housekeeping did what I asked daily (left a note with a tip), and the staff was friendly and helpful. Front desk assisted me in selecting a quiet room upon check in; helpful with directions; hailing a cab. 
Cons: Limited room service menu (restaurant attached is "Rare Bar and Grill" -- all meat -- and that's where food comes from); breakfast disappointing spread (although staff accommodating), small lobby, no quiet place to sit or get a drink, room is small.
I would stay again if price was right.

title: Small rooms, a little far from Times Square, but good if you get a deal
text: This was a small hotel and off the beaten path, but overall good experience.  The room was small, but was up high so we could see the city buildings.  It was quiet and we got a good sleep every night.  The shower was nice and I liked having the Keurig.  There was a walk to Times Square, but if you are willing to hike it, is doable.  The staff was nice and always helped guide us where we wanted to go.

title: NY
text: The hotel is somewhat average, good location but if you're looking for a hotel experience this ain't it. Generally functional, the rooms are average, gym tiny, some staff helpful but a number just grumpy and with an attitude.

title: Great stay
text: We checked in late night and got room quickly. Room was little congusted but ut was clean and i liked the bathroom cleanness too. Next timr when i visit newyork in couple of months i will definitely stay in this hotel

title: Average is being generous
text:
I appreciate hotels in large cities are not always what you would wish for, but apart from Concierge who was fantastic, friendly helpful and knowledgeable, everything about this hotel was average at best.  

The rooms are small, the hotel noisy, the location unbelievably noisy..... if you book here go with the expectation of not much sleep.  Breakfast was not great, very 'processed' if you don't have breakfast included in your stay I would recommend eating out.  Front desk was not great it was a bit like you were doing them a favour staying there. 

It is a good location, with easy walking to the subway and uptown.  But as a Diamond Member with Hilton, I can honestly say there are far far better hotels in NYC to stay at.

title: Great location to explore Manhattan
text:
Just around the corner of Madison Square Garden, this Hotel is a perfect option to discover Manhattan. 
Value for Money (Manhattan Style) is given. Nice rooftop bar/restauran with great views of the Empire State Building, even in Winter.

title: pleasant
text: friendly and helpful staff. I would suggest taking advantage of the the view from the roof top. The location of the Hotel is very close to restaurants and shopping places. I enjoyed my early morning walk exploring the city. I will visit again, thank you for making my visit a pleasant time.

title: Never again...
text:
As Hilton's go, this one is pretty average and surprisingly in major need of a facelift given how relatively young this hotel is. Where do I begin!

The only saving grace of this room is the size. It's pretty big for NY standards but there is not much alternative seating besides just sitting on the bed. There are "chairs" but not anything I would sit in for longer than a minute. The bed itself was saggy and the hotel desperately needs to put in new mattresses. I could barely sleep on it. All the furniture looked tired and worn and the wear and tear is most notable in the bathroom. The wood part of the sink was warped and the neon overhead light looked like it was about to fall off. There is absolutely no counterspace to put your stuff. As other reviewers mentioned, water will leak out from the shower to the outer floor, the door is no use in keeping the water inside. Only plus here is the shower pressure, provided you are able to get hot water.

Forget the service. First morning, no hot water out of the shower. I called the front desk and they said the entire building has an issue and it was being fixed. Nothing offered to compensate for the trouble like a free breakfast. Second night, fire alarm goes off at 3am. After complaining to the front desk about this plus the hot water issue, someone finally offered to provide me some extra Hilton points. Do not expect this hotel to go out of their way to help you.

I only stayed here because I was there with work colleagues who were also staying at this hotel. I would only stay here if the location works out for your needs. Otherwise look elsewhere.

title: Perfect stay
text: This Hilton location is ideal if you need to be in Chelsea or NoMad neighborhoods.  You also can walk easily from Penn Station.  In addition, the hotel is close to a number of really good restaurants--all walking distance (e.g., A Voce or Eataly).  And you are 2 short blocks from the 28th Street subway entrance.

title: "Meh"
text:
I booked this hotel as part of a package with BA (not super expensive but certainly not cheap!!) Having previously stayed uptown we wanted to stay in a new area when visiting with our two children (aged 12 and 9.) 

I had been attracted to the roof top bar and then I realised under 21s are not even allowed in a bar so I emailed the hotel to see if we could get a room overlooking the ESB as the kids would not be able to see the view - unfortunately didn't not get a reply from the hotel.

When we arrived hotel staff were very friendly and welcoming. We were told all family rooms were at the back of the hotel. As we opened our door we were met with perhaps the most underwhelming view ever - a brick wall!! As a result the room was so dark and we had to have all the lights on at all times.

The pictures of trip advisor are not a true reflection of the room we stayed in. 

On the plus side the room was clean and functional and the beds were comfy. The bathroom was nice and the shower was lovely. The room was also quiet - brick walls don't make much noise at night!! 

The hotel is nicely located and we enjoyed spending time around the Flatiron building. It's also well placed for a walk uptown or downtown.

The three star review is not really a criticism rather an indication of how underwhelming the hotel was for us as a party.  If you are travelling without minors and pay for a room at the front overlooking the ESB and are able to use the roof top bar it may be a very different experience.

title: Not impressed
text: This hotel is way overpriced and has no problem overcharging you. The mattresses were also extremely uncomfortable. If this hotel had been half the price, I wouldn't complain. But for this price, I would expect a much more comfortable and organized experience.

title: Prima locatie & fijne kamers
text: Receptionisten heel vriendelijk, fijne ontvangst. Kamers mooi, badkamer ruim, goed bed. Locatie heel centraal. Metro om de hoek en binnen 15 minuten ben je op de meeste plaatsen in Manhattan. Ontbijt hebben we niet gedaan in het hotel, genoeg perfecte ontbijtrestaurantjes in de buurt van het hotel.

title: Nice Stay
text: My company booked me here for 4 nights.  Very clean & nice staff.  I loved the location as it was a nice walk to lots of attractions & easy to get in/out.  The neighborhood is good so never felt worried about my surroundings.  I think my room had a ghost (pleasant one) as odd things would happen while in my room. Maybe it was just all the smokers getting to my head!  Nice rooftop bar too!

title: Great view of Empire State Building
text: The room was a bit small, but not too small to be an issue. Great view of the Empire State Building... especially at night. We were on the top floor and literally felt like we could touch the building

title: 28th birthday trip
text: My overall  experience was great I just wish there was a pool and an ice machine and a fridge in my room. I had some juice and water to put away since I came from out of town. And I wanted to go swimming.

title: Great accommodation at a reasonable price in NYC
text: This hotel is located in the middle of the Fashion District and is a fairly short walk from Penn Station. There are a lot of restaurant choices around the hotel and it is close to a Metro station that can help get you to the rest of the city. The staff are friendly and efficient. Although the rooms are small but they are functional and clean. This is one of my favorite hotel in NYC.

title: Great accommodation at a reasonable price in NYC
text: This Hilton is located in the Fashion District and a fairly short walk from Penn Station. The staff are efficient and friendly and the rooms are clean and efficient. There are good food choices around the hotel. It is also located very close to the Metro and easy to get around the city.

title: Ticks all my boxes...
text:
If a hotel delivers all that it says it will then it has to get full marks - even if it doesn't set the heart racing..

We were looking for a reasonably priced, modern hotel in a centralish location with room for 2 adults and an 11 year old. Tick.

The staff were pleasant and helpful, the hotel was clean and well maintained and there is an excellent roof top bar with great views over the city.

The location is good for walking to the Chelsea Market, High Line, Hudson River Park and for the excellent and highly recommended Malibu Diner on 23rd (breakfast). It feels like somewhere where people live rather than a tourist ghetto. We took the subway, cabs and bus to get around - all of which are easily accessible.

The room had x2 double beds with some room around them and a reasonably sized bathroom - small by Texas standards but perfectly adequate. The air con worked well and the beds were comfortable. WiFi was complimentary and high speed.

If you are looking for a well run, blandly comfortable hotel in a blameless location then this could well fit the bill.

We stayed for 4 nights over the Easter weekend.

title: RECOMENDACION.
text: Excelente ubicación y buen tamaño de los cuartos, buen bar en el roof, personal muy amable, lo único que fallo fue la computadora que tienen para uso de los huespedes, nunca pude imprimir mis pases de abordar para mi vuelo.

title: Excellent all service hotel in great location
text: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times - always great experience.  Love the location. Helpful knowledgeable staff. Pleasant rooms. Nice bar and good restaurant - makes it easy to get a drink or easy meal. Recommend you try it

title: Excellent central location in Manhattan
text:
The Hilton New York Fashion District is located in a great centralized location in Manhattan. As a guest you have fairly easy access to the subway system for longer trips up to the Bronx or down to Lower Manhattan and there is plenty to walk to within a 15-20 minute stroll from the hotel. 

The room pricing for this location was quite reasonable - at least during our stay and we found the room to be more comfortable and more spacious than other properties we have stayed in on previous visits. 

The room itself and the lobby and other public areas that we saw were clean and well maintained and the hotel staff were efficient and helpful. The rooftop bar offers some interesting cocktails and great views of the Manhattan skyline. 

We will definitely consider this hotel again the next time we are looking to stay in this part of Manhattan.

title: Good clean modern rooms
text: The room we had was not large, but it was large enough for 2 people on a weekend trip.  Comfortable furniture and modern decor.   The elevators are very fast.  This hotel has a rooftop bar with great views.  It is very convenient to Penn Station and a reasonable walk or short Uber to many attractions.  The Irish ale house across the street is cool

title: Hilton needs to come learn from this property
text: I was worried about my stay as I had had a terrible experience dealing with Hilton regarding my reservation. I reached out to the property directly in hopes of help, but they never got back to me like they had said. I arrived on a Friday beating terrible weather that caused major air delays. I arrived around 11am and front desk held my bag. Went across the street where a chipotle and Dunkin' Donuts are located and had a little breakfast and some lunch. Came back and asked how I could access the gym, they told me it was unlocked downstairs. So I headed down and was about to hit my first set, and my phone rings. My room is ready! Awesome, I go grab my bag and hit the room. It was NYC small, but just fine. I went to set up my devices on wifi and to charge while I went to the gym, but the internet is down. Oh no, here we go.... called front desk and they sent a maintenance guy, "Nick". He identified and fixed the problem quickly, was super friendly and even provided some recommendations while he was fixing the router. This guy is a great asset to the property and was very helpful. His actions caused me to disregard the earlier issues I had experienced prior to arrival and consider this a 5 star stay.
